Urinated quite freely a very large quantity, at 5 A.M.; urine normal but copious (second day); very little but normal urine (third day), [21].
Vinegary taste in the mouth immediately after drinking milk, [1].
Sleep sound, yet with many vivid dreams, [3].
Pain in the right groin, near Pouparts ligament, following the pain in the left testicle; this remained constant; I never felt this symptom before (sixteenth day), [34].
Roaring and pulsative blowing in the right ear, at night, [3].
Menses came on a week too soon, scanty, and lasting only one day, [8].
Frequent gripings in the abdomen, without flatulence, [1].
It is hard for him to get up in the morning, as he has no desire to rise, [2].
Blisters form easily on the heel, when walking, [1].
Hot lips, [1].
Painfulness of the hæmorrhoids when walking, [1].
Screaming, at night, during sleep, [1].
Pain in the head and abdomen, on coughing, [1].
Pulling and drawing in the top of the shoulder, when at rest, [1].
A swelling in the eyes, burning, and a flow of tears, which affords relief (second day), [28].
Wandering pains continue and seem to increase; particularly drawing and expanding pain in the side of the neck, [28a].

Pain in the centre of the abdomen, from afternoon till bedtime; it seemed as if a lump were lying there; the pain extended upward toward evening, accompanied by sleepiness, yet she was not able to sleep at night, [1].
Pain in the outer canthus of both eyes (twelfth day), [15].

Bloated feeling of the abdomen coming on about fifteen minutes after eating, and lasting half an hour, at 8 P.M. (fifth day); constant feeling of distension, coming on shortly after eating, especially supper; this symptom was noticed throughout the proving, [26].
Tenderness of the upper lip after rising (second day), [45a].
Great thirst without heat; drink tastes good, but does not quench the first, and seems to distress the stomach, [1].
Burning and hot feeling in the loins (region of kidneys), when taking a long breath, [1].
Coryza, with chilliness, catarrh and cough, [1].
Falls asleep late (after a few hours), [2].
Headache in the forenoon, as if the brain were crushed, [1].
Very frequent sneezing always preceded by nausea, [1].
First tickling, then smarting pain in the last joint of left great toe, frequently recurring, [2].
The lower limbs pain as if beaten; she desires to sit down, and when sitting she feels as if she must stand up, [1].
Rhus relieved, [19].
Itching on the left nipple; it bleeds occasionally, and seems as if it would ulcerate, [1].

In the evening, dulness and confusion of the sinciput (soon, third day); in the morning, after awaking, vacancy and confusion of the sinciput (fourth and fifth days); in the evening, vacancy of the sinciput (ninth day), [29a].

Distressing dry feeling in the nose, after rising; dryness in the nose, at noon (second day); troublesome dryness and sensitiveness of the nose, soon after taking the medicine (fifth day); some sensitiveness and dryness in the nose (tenth day); nose dry and tender, in the morning after waking (eleventh day); dryness of the nose (thirteenth day); tiresome dryness of the nose, in the evening (fifteenth day); great dryness and sensitiveness of the nose (eighteenth day); teasing dryness of the nose, in the morning (nineteenth day); dryness and tenderness of the nose (twentieth day); dryness of the nose, and feeling as if its mucous membrane was swollen, in the open air in the forenoon (twenty-third day); great dryness of the nose (twenty-fourth day); *dryness of the nose (twenty-ninth day); the effect upon the nasal mucous membrane during the whole of the proving was quite peculiar; at one time acrid fluid flows from the nose, and again the organ appears to be as dry and stiff as parchment, and the next moment he has to blow out a quantity of thick phlegm, which is followed by a return of the dryness; dryness of the nose (thirtieth day); distressing dryness and stiffness of the nose, at noon (thirty-first day); dryness of the nose (thirty-fifth day); severe burning and dryness in the nose, at noon when sitting (thirty-sixth day); dryness of the nose and stiffness of its walls (fortieth day); dryness and tension of the nose (forty-first day); dry feeling in the nose, though it is actually moist, in the evening (forty-third day); dryness of the nose, in the evening (forty-seventh day); burning dry nose, in the evening (forty-ninth day), dryness of nose (fifty-third and fifty-sixth days); the nose not nearly so dry as the day previous (fifty-eighth day); great dry feeling in the nose, especially towards its point (sixty-second day); dryness of the nose (sixty-eighth day); great dryness of the nose (seventy-second and seventy-sixth days); dryness and tickling in the nose (seventy-eighth day); great dryness, extreme sensitiveness, almost sore feeling of the nose (eightieth day); dryness in the nose (eighty-first day); dryness and parchment-like stiffness of the nose (eighty-fifth day); great dryness of the nose (eighty-seventh day), [45a].
Drawing toothache, [1].
Acidity in the mouth, and acid eructations after drinking milk, [1].
Cramplike pain in lower jaw preceded by pain in neck, [1].
Jerking in the left lower extremity, [1].
Hard, dry, concussive cough (third day); continued four or five days, [32].
When awake in the night great distress in the stomach (gnawing aching in pit of stomach), with sensitiveness; could not bear weight of clothes (twenty-first night), [20].
Frequent awaking at night, on account of throbbing in the molar teeth, extending over the cheeks back towards the occiput, [1].
Tongue white, in the morning; red and clean, in the afternoon, [1].
Flickering before the eyes when looking into light; he sees a zigzag circle of colors, [1].
Considerable congestion of the face, at 3 P.M. (sixth day), [33].
Bitterness in the mouth, in the morning on waking, [1], [3].
She awakes at 1 A.M., and cannot fall asleep again, on account of wakefulness, [1].
*Some blows through the whole head, [1].
Hypersensitiveness of the auditory nerves in one who hears with difficulty, so that playing the piano causes nausea, [1].
Violent stitches in the chest with every inspiration; he dared only to take a short breath; from this the head became affected (after five days), [1].
Boring pain in the knee-joint, when at rest, [1].
The canthi of the eyes red and inflamed, slightly adhesive, and exuding a little (fifteenth day), [29].
Shooting pain from the lumbar region to the left lung (seventh day), [20].
Severe pain in the shoulder-joint (could cry out), as if it would tear off; pain is relieved for one fourth of an hour by much belching, [1].
Burning in the roof of the palate, [7a].
One day, three sudden shoots down right thigh into toes, each time making him lift up the foot and shout, [19].
Ulceration, with agglutination of the eyes, in the morning, [1].
Fainting fit, in the forenoon (after twenty-three days), [1].
*Tension in the forehead, [1].
Left tonsil much swollen and covered with pustules (twenty-ninth day), [21].
Ringing in ears (sixteenth day), [34a].
Stitches in the vagina every three or four seconds, and after a quarter of an hour a similar attack, [1].
Feverish shivering, even of the head, with icy-cold hands, yawning and great weakness, [5].
Stitches in the sides of the abdomen, for one hour, followed by difficult breathing, [1].
*Vertigo (eighty-first day), [45a].,
I notice that my lips are cracking; they feel very dry (fifth day), [37].
Beating, very painful headache in the vertex, in the morning soon after rising (after six days), [1].
Sore pain in the rectum mostly between the stools, and like an outward pressing, even when lying, in attacks at regular intervals, accompanied by hæmorrhoids, painful when touched, [1].

Appetite diminished (twelfth and thirteenth days); little appetite (seventeenth day); the appetite was diminished, and after taking but a small quantity of food, he had the feeling as if the stomach was overloaded (twenty-sixth day); appetite diminished, in the forenoon (thirty-first and thirty-third days); appetite diminished; he ate rather from habit than from necessity (thirty-eighth day); appetite diminished (forty-eighth day); little appetite (fifty-second day); at noon the appetite was very poor, and after eating, there was a troublesome feeling of fulness in the stomach and aching in the scrobiculus cordis (fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Nosebleed the third evening during the menses, [1].
Loud sounds and humming in the ears (immediately), [1].
Coition, with insufficient erection (after twenty days), [1].
Boring pain in the point of the left testicle, following the pain in the chest (sixteenth day), [34].
In the morning on awaking, dryness of the tongue and palate (third day), [29a].

Since the thirty-second day I have had a vesicular eruption on the scalp, chest, back of the shoulders, and also on the calves of the legs, and on the knee-joints; a few of the vesicles became pustules, and when squeezed yielded a tough sticky matter; but pressure was painful and made them look angry; those on the scalp itched; brushing the hair was agreeable, but combing or scratching made the pustules sore; the brush brings off more scales than usual; the skin of the nose is also peeling (forty-fourth day), [38].
Burning in the lower half of the legs, at night in bed, she had to uncover them, [1].
Long unrefreshing sleep (after twenty-three days), [1].
Convulsive shooting in the tip of the tongue (twenty-first day), [40].
She feels the pulse beating through the body, particularly in the whole left chest, [1].
Stitching pain in the soles, also from touch, she can scarcely walk, [1].
Itching on the scalp (two hundred and forty-third day), [45b].
Jerking pain above the right eye, [1].
Frequent micturition (after four days), [1].
Drawing pains in the corns, in the evening, [1].
After 11 A.M., frequent attacks of a dull headache, deep in the left side of the forehead when at rest and when moving, which sometimes increased to a drawing-throbbing pain (first day), [25b].
Febrile excitement, immediately after dinner, [1].
Symptoms distinct and more severe on the left side (eighth day), [38].
Distension of the abdomen and emission of flatus, when taking a walk, [1].
Numbness and sudden paralytic sensation of one lower extremity when standing, [1].
Severe dry cough, with stitches in the right chest, [1].
Itching in the upper part of the cheeks, and after rubbing it, a burning smarting, [1].
Much footsweat of intolerable smell; the toes become sore, [1].
Many itching pimples on the legs, [1].
Swelling of the eye, with headache on the same side, [1].
Uneasiness in the abdomen, as if diarrhœa would set in, passing off from emission of flatus, [1].

Violent stitches outwards over the left orbit, with complete drawing together of the eye, for three successive days, after arising in the morning, continuing until noon, somewhat relieved in the open air, [5].
The tip of the tongue feels scalded, [29].
Smarting pain on the outer side of the right hand (fifth day), [38].
Feverish, weak, hot urine, [1].
Ineffectual desire to urinate, at 11 A.M. (fifth day), [26].
Dreadful gnawing frontal pains, [66].
The ankle joint pains, after walking in the open air, as if compressed, [1].
Smarting of the eyes, in the evening; the candlelight seems to be a red ring, wherewith he cannot see, [1].
Feverish chilliness, with alternation of heat, till in the night, [1].
Sensation of swelling and ulceration on the left side of gums, especially the upper jaw, at noon (third day), [18].
Epigastrium tense, pressing pain in it one hour after dinner, and after walking in the open air, [2].
Twitching of the upper lid, [1].
Chilliness, commencing in the throat, three or four times, in the evening, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Pressing pain in the upper abdomen, afternoons, [2].
All the teeth are painful, particularly a hollow molar, which pains as if elongated and swollen, with swelling of the gums and cheeks, with which the pain ceased, [5].
Sensation as if drops came from the bladder (which was not the case), particularly when at rest, [1].
Beating headache with every movement, [1].
Stitches in the weak ear, over which she laments loudly, [1].
Severe pain in uterus and left ovary (seventh day); pains in uterus very severe; pains pass down into the vagina (eighth day), [21].
Stitches in the left scapula, [1].

Aching in the vertex, increased in the open air, where it became very teasing, towards noon; after dinner, increased to the feeling as if a heavy weight lay on it; this pain lasted all day in a minor degree, and did not go off till evening (eighteenth day), [45].
Cold sweat at night on the breast, back, and thighs (after thirty-six hours and on sixth day), [1].
Pressure in the head every other morning at 8 or 9 o'clock, and so alternately till going to sleep, [1].
The eyes are painful on looking at the flame of a candle, [1].
A toe-nail, which had been crippled for years, suppurated, and in its stead a new and healthy nail formed, [1].
Very sensitive to cold north wind, [1].
Sticking pain in the forehead, though only on walking, [1].
Pain in the shoulder, which was higher than the other from disease, also when touching it, [5].
She feels as if she could easily injure herself, strain herself, sprain a joint, etc., [1].
In the afternoon, itching, burning, and redness of the edges of the lids, and of the skin on the outside of the nose (twenty-fourth day), [29].
Dulness of the head (after twenty-four hours), [1].
*Pressure in the temples and tension in the brain, on reflecting and on mental work, [1].
In the morning, shooting in the tip of the tongue (immediately, second day), [40].
Red spots on the glans, [1].
Vertigo, even to falling, every morning when rising, [1].
Cramplike pain in the left lower jaw and in the glans penis (first day), [18a].
Headache, with pressure in the eyes, after eating, [1].
Pain in the right side of the chest, especially on stooping and lying on the right side, [7].
Tired feeling, at 9.45 P.M. (second day), [40a].
The posterior muscles of the thigh are very painful when sitting, [1].
Pressure over the eyes if he goes into bright daylight (after eleven days), [1].
Easily strained when at work, and consequent stiffness and tense feeling in nape of neck, [1].
Sore throat, with difficulty of swallowing, [10].
Colic pain in upper part of abdomen, above umbilicus (after eight hours and a half); occasional pains (fourth day), [44a].

Feverish heat, with chilly shivering, accompanied by dull and heavy pain in the forehead, after previous flickering before the eyes, as from a thousand suns, with heat and pressure in the eyes; also much nausea, great oppression of the chest, as if everything were constricted, yet without shortness of breath, from morning until evening (after seventy-two hours), [1].
Pain in the hip, worse from walking, [28a].
Itching in various parts of the body, relieved by scratching, after which there is a pinkish color (after two days), [28].
Weakness of right wrist, when using the hand (fifth day), [36].
A general good-for-nothing feeling (fourth day), [44].
Twitching of the lips, [1].
Cutting in the upper lip, as from a splinter, [1].
*In the evening, dull pain in the whole head, which lasted till late at night (fifth day), [24].
Vinegary taste in the mouth all day, [1].
Clammy taste in the mouth (one hundred and forty-second day), [45b].
For the last two days have had the contractive pain in the back of the neck, mostly on right side (fifth day), [36].
Sharp stitching pain passing up the vagina into the body of the uterus, somewhat relieved when bending double (eleventh day), [21].
Frequent dryness of the mouth, as if the tongue would cleave to the mouth, without thirst, [1].
Tearing in the head, over the forehead, and in the eyes, from 2 P.M., until evening when going to sleep, [1].
Jerking in the lower lid, [1].
Woke at 4.30 A.M., without apparent cause, and remained awake (second day), [21].
All kinds of pains in the long bones, particularly at their extremities, when walking in the open air, [1].

Before dinner, he observed on the inner side of the lower lip a vesicle, the size of a hemp-seed, filled with a dark blood, but it did not annoy him much, and after dinner was found to have disappeared without leaving a trace behind (second day), [25f].

Sp. gr. 25 (five days before proving); 22 (four days before proving); 25 (three days before proving); 28 (third day of proving); 25 (fourth, ninth, and eleventh days); sp. gr. urine 30 (from thirteenth to nineteenth days), [22].
Complexion pallid (fifth day), [31].
Very feverish (fourth and following days), [21].
Throat dry, worse evening (nineteenth day), [20].
For half an hour teasing aching in the left ear, about noon (sixth day), [44d].
Sensation of nausea and anxiety, when exerting the eyes, [1].
Easily affected by cold, after drinking a glass of water excessive chilliness and watery slimy diarrhœa, lasting until going to sleep, [1].
Much cough, with expectoration, day and night; the cough wakes her at night, with sensation in the chest as if hollow, and smarting therein as if sore, [1].
Pressing and jerking and beating, with heat in the head, as if everything would issue from the forehead and eyes, for three days, [1].
Pressure in the liver generally when taking a walk, [1].
Short violent tearing from the forehead down beside the right ala of the nose, [2].
Stitches in the anus after the morning stool, lasting until afternoon (after seven days), [1].
At night, during frequent waking, stitches in the tip of the elbow, [1].
Vertigo, with cold hands and feet (after thirty-four days), [1].
While sitting quietly, a severe tearing pain in the left shoulder-joint, lasting but a few minutes, but there remained for a day or two a feeling as if the shoulder were wrenched (sixth day), [27].
Dimness of vision, in the forenoon (first day); all the forenoon, unusual weakness and dimness of the eyes, followed by frequent dry tussiculation (third day), [25a].
Tearing in the tibia during the menses, [1].
Digging pain in the eyeball (twenty-sixth day), [30].
The left lower extremity is jerked upward, in the forenoon, while sitting (after four days), [1].
Internal chilliness in the warm room the whole day, for several days, [1].
A red pimple on the margin of the red of the lower lip, with sticking pain only on touch, [1].
Profuse sweat, while walking, [1].
The eyes seem blinded, in the morning, [1].
Continuous chilliness, [1].
Burning in the stomach, after eructations, [2].
Scalp for a long time thickly covered with scabs, [39a]. [Up to the age of fifteen I had been frequently troubled with ringworm.]
Continuous stitches in the left chest, without any relation to the breathing, [1].
Pain in the ear, as if ulcerated, on swallowing, [1].

In the evening had a severe headache, characterized by pressing pains in the temples, which seemed to press outwards, began at 6 P.M., and continued till next morning; have had similar headaches after drinking strong coffee, but had taken no coffee while taking the medicine (second day), [34].
Complete loss of appetite, [65].
Very heavy and drowsy, [9].
Coryza about noon (second day), [43].

Suffered from constipation, which caused bleeding, and weight and pain in the rectum (twenty-third day); stool with less pain (twenty-fourth day); during the past ten days I have suffered much from constipation and from piles, with severe pains across the lower part of the abdomen, extending down the inside of the thighs, both abdomen and thighs feeling sore to touch (fortieth day), [22].

Pain in sacrum, extending through hips and thighs to below the knee, with weakness and lassitude when moving, especially going upstairs, as if limbs would refuse to act before reaching the top (twelfth day), [44a].
Unsuccessful desire for stool towards evening, then in the morning, stool often hard and lumpy, [1].
Astringent smarting in the forepart of the urethra, in the morning when awaking, [1].
Staggering vertigo, every afternoon from 4 to 6 o'clock, when sitting and walking, [1].
Constrictive pain in the temples, several mornings, [1].
In the afternoon, tearing and aching pain in the frontal region, which sometimes extended into the temporal region, and lasted an hour (first day), [39b].
Strong erections (second day); from the twenty-ninth day on, however, only short, and with quick emission of semen during coition, [1].
Lachrymation, morning and evening (after twelve days), [1].
After coition discharge of blood from the vagina, [1].
About 2 A.M., violent throbbing of all the arteries of the head (third day), [25g].
Violent persistent erection, at night, [1].
Yellowish-brown spots about the neck, that scale off on rubbing, [7].
Very dry tongue, in the morning, [1].
Violent burning in the bladder, without desire to urinate, [1].
Numb feeling in the nerves, also in the tongue, with dulness of the head and absence of thought, in the evening, [3].
Swelling of the feet (after twenty-seven days), [1].
Panaritium on left index finger with severe beating and stitching in it (after twenty-three days), [1].
Cutting in the abdomen, at night, with urging to urinate, [1].
Headache externally on the left side, painful to touch, as if suppurating, [1].
All parts of the body on which she lies or sits are painful, [1].
Severe stitches in the left side of the abdomen, [1].

A weak feeling all over (ninth day); quite weak (tenth day); wakened weary (twentieth morning); after sleeping, afternoon, no disposition to move or talk, but to sit quietly and wonder what is the matter (twenty-third day); with fulness in the temple (twenty-ninth day), [20].
Sensation of heat in throat, [1].
After lying down, fine drawing shooting in the left side of the occiput (twelfth day), [28c].
Vomiting after the morning nausea of some food, followed by retching, [1].
Violent palpitation of the heart and beating of all the arteries, in the evening in bed, [1].
Much sweat and exhaustion, while walking, [1].
Eyes hot and dry (fourth and twelfth days), [21].
He sleeps at night only from 10 to 4 o'clock, [1].
Feels very faint when walking out of doors, in the evening, for five days (three days after last dose), [16].
Burning in the forepart of the urethra (after nine and twenty days), [1].
Sensation like sparks in the left upper lid (fifth day), [25a].
Agglutinated eyes, in the morning (after burning, in the evening), [3].
Cracking or feeling, as of the bursting of a bubble in the upper part of the nose, [1].
Tearing in the upper maxilla, [2].
Bilious vomiting, two mornings (after three days), [1].
Awaking at night with anxious warmth, [1].
Profuse sweat on the scrotum, [1].
Dulness in the head, with pressure in the eyes, aggravated by walking in the open air, [1].
The hair falls out a great deal; a bald place is formed (two hundred and forty-ninth day), [45b].
With the pain in the forehead, dryness and fine stinging in the mucous membrane of the nose, as from a cold in the head (second day), [44a].
Pressure in the pit of the stomach, [1].
Yellow complexion (nineteenth day); appearance grew daily worse (twenty-first to thirty-first day), [32].
Neuralgic pain over the right eye (I was accustomed to this some time ago, but had not had it lately), (ninth day), [22].
Disgust for tobacco after smoking, [29a].
(Diminution of the falling off of the hair), (twenty-third day), [45b].

In the evening, contractive pain in the forehead and temples (twenty-sixth day); dull aching in the forehead (in a quarter of an hour, thirty-seventh day); contraction and pressing in the forehead (forty-seventh day); aching in the forehead (forty-eighth day); in one hour, in the frontal bone a painful aching, which extended across the nasal bones and both malar bones (fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Tension at the bend of the ankle-joint, as if too short, when walking (first days), [1].
The headache is better when lying down near an open window (three days after last dose), [16].
Great dragging in my right side (fifth day), [37].
The teeth feel loose on biting, and on eating feel paralyzed, [1].
The hair of the head so more and tender that he could not comb it, [19].
Violent coryza, with rawness in the chest, and cough, with much expectoration, [1].
Stitching pain in the left lung and in the third toe of the right foot at the same time, of the same character, lasting but a few seconds (tenth day), [27].
Itching and burning of the eyes (fourth day), [36c].

Cough frequently dry, whooping, and choking, with pain in the pit of the stomach, and scraping, raw, sore pain in the larynx, which is not felt when swallowing saliva; the cough does not awake her from sleep, but after awaking it becomes very severe and continuous; at times there is a rattling in the trachea, resulting in mucous expectoration, [1].

Passed a very restless night (second night); disturbed sleep (third night); do not feel rested, in the morning; sleep very much disturbed by laborious dreams (fourth night); very tiresome dreams (fifth night); very restless night, full of dreams; awaking often in fright (sixth night), [21].
Prickling at the point of eruption before the pimples first appeared, [24].
Itching on the occiput near the nape (thirteenth day), [45].
Lips always hot, sticking, and burning, [1].

In the morning after awaking, tongue thickly furred (fourth and fifth days); in the morning on awaking, dryness and burning of the tongue, which was covered with a dirty whitish-yellow fur (tenth day), [29a].
She eats without hunger or appetite, only from habit, with natural taste to food, [3].
Woke at 3 A.M., could not sleep again for an hour or two; at last went to sleep lying on face (twenty-second night), [20].
Pain in abdomen and back, like pain of menstruation (ninth day); (no menses for three months), [44a].

After a glass of beer, feeling of dryness in left nostril, and sensitiveness of the mucous membrane on inspiring the air of the room; the latter sensation went off almost entirely in the open air (nineteenth day), [22a].
Sleepy early in the evening, with pressive dulness of the head (after seventy-two hours), [1].

Beating in the pit of the stomach, in the morning, then ebullition in the chest, like palpitation of the heart, followed by burning heat of face and body, without perceptible outward heat or redness, without thirst, but with some sweat, [1].
Tension of the abdomen, in the morning (after two days), [1].
A cicatrix on the tip of the index finger commences to bleed spontaneously, [1].
In the morning, slight sensitiveness of the edges of the lids (one hundred and thirty-fifth day), [45b].
The urine when passed is frequently cloudy and dark, as if mixed with mucus, [1].

In half an hour (when at rest), dull drawing headache in the left side of the forehead, with a similar pain, now in the left knee-joint, now in the left outer malleolus, now in left wrist (second day), [25e].
Small white blisters inside of the cheeks, [29].
Itching on the borders of the eyelids (eighth day), [44b].

In the evening, he perceived on the inside of the upper lip, near the right commissure of the mouth, a small painless elevation, which in a few days changed into a small pedunculated wart, with three free apices (twenty-eighth day). It still remained months after the termination of the proving, [28d].
Drawing pain in the right wrist-joint, [2].
Nausea, with the chilly sensation (thirty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day); considerable nausea (thirty-eighth day), [21].
Pressure on the stomach, as from a stone, [1].
Pressive contractive pain in the top of the head (the first days), [1].
Dimness of vision, with giddy confusion (first day), [25g].
Sensation as if the heart filled all the cavities of the body, with labored muffled beating (twentieth day), [20].
Anxious dreams of being threatened with rape (after two days), [1].
Blue rings around the eyes, [1].
Flow of water in the mouth coming from the stomach, disappearing after eating, [3].

Headache only in the sinciput, mostly toward the forehead; pressure on the brain passing off in half a minute, returning eight or ten times in an hour; it would then remain away for an hour or an hour and a half, returning the next day but not so severe (after twenty-three days), [1].
Coppery taste in the mouth, in the morning on waking, [1].
Little appetite, but much thirst, [1].
Shuddering with the pains, [1].
Stitches between the scapulæ (after twenty-four days), [1].
After rising in the morning, had an attack of nosebleed (fourth day), [37].
*Along with the febrile heat there occurred a disagreeable aching pain in the forehead, and great restlessness, which went off when sweat broke out (thirty-eighth day), [32].
Considerable pain in the right knee (fourth day), [21].
Noises in the abdomen, [1].
Hard stool, with cutting in the rectum, [1].

Creeping-tingling pain in the upper arm, worse from motion and stooping, passing off during rest and when lying in bed; the pain extends to the shoulder-joint, and causes an uneasiness in the arm for three days (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Violent pressure in the ears on swallowing and sneezing, [1].
Itching on the head, with impatience, [1].
Dryness of the tongue (second day); (in half an hour, third day), [25g].
Inflammation and swelling in upper part of throat, [1].
Very tired in the morning, when rising from bed, [1].
Mouth very slimy, in the morning, [1].
Fluent coryza, with sneezing, which she had not had for two years, [5].
Roughness and burning in fauces, which is aggravated by hawking, [1].
Drawing and tearing in the scalp (one hundred and second day), [45a].
Drawing in the teeth (eleventh day), [44f].
Pain in the feet when walking in the open air, as if the tendon at the ankle was sprained, [1].
Pressing drawing on the right false ribs, toward the back, passing off from motion or from rubbing, [2].
Tension in the left thigh and leg, like pain when parts have gone to sleep, extending to the sole of the foot (after twenty-four days), [1].

Stool, which has been free and regular, is to-day, large, hard, and difficult (eleventh day); loose, yellow, watery, at 8 A.M., with pain and some flatulence (fifteenth day); sudden urging to stool with pain in the abdomen, at 6 A.M.; stool yellow, thin, and scanty, with much tenesmus (eighteenth day), [20].
Sleep does not refresh, but leaves a tired aching feeling all through the body (third, fourth, and fifth days); disturbed sleep continued (for ten weeks), [24].
In the evening, by candlelight, a veil before the eyes; the surrounding objects appeared to be enveloped in smoke; rubbing and wiping them had no effect (third day), [30].
She becomes much heated from a little walk, [1].
Tingling sensation in the left side of the nose; a strong inclination to sneeze, but I can not (fourth day), [21].
Tearing, now above, and again below the right calf (after fourteen hours), [2].
Rheumatic drawing in the testicles, also along side in the thigh, [2].
The anterior part of the palate is painful as if burned, [1].
Tearing in the knee and elbow-joints (after sixteen days), [1].
She felt that she had a weight pressing on her thighs, momentary, [8].
Face pale and collapsed, with an expression of great anxiety, [51].
Pain in the occiput, mostly at night, and worse when lying on it, as if hollow and as if ulcerated, both externally and internally, relieved by pressure with the hand, [1].
Stitching pains in the temples (seventh day), [38].
Mouth dry, [76].
Water trickles from the nose, [1].
Eruptions, Dry.
Urging to stool, but passed very little; am not constipated, but seem to have lost power, at 6 P.M. (tenth day), [21].
Doughy taste in the mouth, [1].
Vibratory contraction in the top of the head, in the evening, [1].
Continued and violent eructations, in the evening, preceded by great distension of the abdomen, [1].
Lame feeling in the knee-joints (seventh day), [38].
During the later days, the stool became hard, knotty, and insufficient, [1].
*Headache, with nausea, [1].
Aching in the head, in the forenoon (twenty-second day), [43].
Tolerably severe pressure at a small spot between the scapulæ, [2].
Moist pimply eruption at the margin of the vermilion border of the upper lip, [2].
The feet become swollen from much walking, [1].
Rheumatic drawing in the left side of the head, [1].
Mucous coating on tongue, one or two hours after eating, [1].
Radiating pains up the back of the neck and occiput (three or four days after ceasing to take the medicine), [29a].
Creeping in right ear, [1].
Stupid and dizzy feeling in the head, so that frequently he does not know what he is doing, [1].
Cutting in the testicles, [1].
Aching on the right side of the vertex, with rigor (first day), [18].
*Violent pressure in the forehead, [1].
Always slight sweat before going to sleep, in the evening, [1].
About 8 P.M., great flow of sweetish saliva into the mouth (forty-eighth day), [29].

Feel very tired this morning (third, fifth, and sixth days); beginning to feel tired and listless, at 8 A.M. (thirteenth day); feel very sick; have a heavy cold, never had such before; lungs very sore; harsh distressing cough, worse from going from cold air to warm room, and vice versâ (twenty-first day); very languid all day (twenty-seventh day); feel very stupid (eighty-seventh day); feeling very tired I took a dose of Nux vomica, after which I found all my symptoms returning, pustules on the conjunctiva, throat, and tongue, also the loss of memory (one hundred and ninth day); much better (one hundred and tenth day); entirely relieved (one hundred and eleventh day), [21].
Black comedones on the nose, upper lip, and chin, [1].

Suddenly struck with a severe sore pain in right side of head (sixth day); it then gradually went round to the left side, till at last of the whole head became like a soft bladder, intensely hot, and covered with wheals, large oblong blotches all over; the pain was so severe, and the head so sore, that he dared not touch it; indeed, he could not lie on the softest pillow; it then went round to occiput, most painful; on eighth night was nearly raving; could not sleep, moaning and tossing about, longing for death, loathing life, could have killed himself without compunction; the last severe attack was in the cerebellum; the organ of amativeness seemed to swell out like two eggs, throbbing and intensely sore; the lumps felt quite soft and puffy, similar to the wheals on forehead, [19].
At 5 P.M., had a slight chill; at 6 P.M., flushes of heat, the skin getting slightly moist (fourth day), [33].
Sick all day in my room (second, third, and ninth days), [20].
Yellow spots in the face and a yellow saddle across the upper part of the cheeks and the nose (after twenty days), [1].
Stitching pain in the stomach and in the distended abdomen, in the afternoon, [1].
Burning jerking in the right eyelid, [1].
Inclination for coition, with great emission of semen, with but slight voluptuous feeling, followed by tension in the abdomen, extending to the spermatic cords (fifth day), [1].
Slow pulse, 56 to 58 (after thirty-two days), [1].

The quantity of urine was so small as to alarm me; not more than 8 ounces in twenty-four hours; constant irritation and desire to urinate (thirty-eighth to fortieth day), [38].
After a walk, violent heat in the head and face, [1].
Dimness of vision and weakness of both eyes, with innumerable confused dark spots floating before the eyes (in two hours), [25f].
Uterine pains very severe; the uterus feels as if clutched and then suddenly released, causing nausea, at 7 P.M. (sixth day), [21].
Intense headache, frontal and temporal, [12].
Much itching in the eyebrows, and in the tip of the nose, [1].
Painful pressure on the malar bone and beneath the eye, [1].
In the evening, vertigo; feeling as if all the blood rushed to the head (fifth day), [42a].
Feels dull and drowsy, [28a].
In the afternoon, while walking, itching tearing in the left temporal bone, which came on by fits some five or six times, and was so violent that it made him stand still (first day), [39].
He talks aloud during sleep, [1].
Stiffness in the lower extremities, extending up to the hip-joint, [1].
Frequent sneezing (sixth day), [45c].
A red herpetic spot on the upper eyelid, scaly and peeling off, [1].
Dry cough, as if proceeding from the stomach and abdomen, or from constipation, or as if something remained lodged in the stomach that would not pass off, [1].
Painful swelling of the gums, [1].
Pressing pain on the lower left ribs, only when walking, [1].
Twitching of both orbiculares palpebrarum, which was relieved by going into the open air (thirsty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day), [21].
Sharp tingling pains in the tips of the fingers (twenty-sixth day), [38].
Drawing and tearing in a part of the skin which had once been injured, [1].
Bruised pain in the eye on pressing it together and on feeling of it, [1].
A very painful pustule in the middle of the lower lip, [1].
Fluent coryza of burning water, [9].
Hoarseness and fluent coryza (after four days), [1].
Sensation in the right eye, as if a foreign body were in it, which compels him repeatedly to rub and wipe the eye, in the afternoon (thirty-fifth day), [45a].
Uneasiness in the legs every evening, with cramp in them, [1].
Headache in the forehead and vertex, followed by anxiety in the pit of the stomach, with trembling, afterwards violent nosebleed, [1].
Itching and burning of the lids, which are red and swollen, in the morning (ninth day), [44d].
Discharge of blood with every stool for eight days, [1].
The white of the eye reddened (third day); redness of conjunctiva less (fourth day), [36].
Pressing jerks in the molar teeth, mostly when stooping, [1].
Stitches from within outward in the forehead on every step, all day; also on loud talking and coughing he is obliged to wrinkle the forehead, [1].
Severe stitching pain through the left ovary, at 4 P.M. (fifth day); at 4.30 P.M., through left ovary and acetabulum, I can scarcely bear the pain (sixth day), [21].
The food will not go down, [1].

Hot flush over face and whole head, lasting but a few seconds, instantly followed by slight perspiration (after forty minutes); flush over the head, with the headache (after two hours and three-quarters); slight flush, with slight perspiration and slight increase of pain in the head (after five hours); flush of heat in face and head, followed by perspiration on the same parts (after nine hours, third day, and after eleven hours, fourth day), [44].

Very violent piercing, cramplike pain deep in the right orbit (probably in the muscles), which, as far as he could judge, seemed to extend through the bony wall of the orbit into the frontal sinus; it lasted a few minutes, and then alternated, with a similar pain in the left orbit (after half an hour, second day), [25f].
Slight stopped up feeling of the ears (one hundred and eighty-fourth day), [45b].
Twitching of the lids for many days, [1].
Redness of the eyelids and conjunctiva (fourth day), [30].
Stitches in the left chest, when coughing (after six days), [1].
Dryness and roughness of the tongue and palate, [1].
Repeated severe vomiting, at night, with violent headache (after twelve hours), [1].
Sensation as if the vulva were enlarged (twenty-third day), [20].
Head stupefied (eighty-third day), [45a].
Tearing toothache out through the left ear, during and after eating, [1].
Pressure in the lower part of the abdomen, to the left of the navel, and at times quite in the left side, [2].
Cramping drawing in the right shoulder and in the whole right side, [1].
Beating in the region of the liver, [1].
Great desire for wine, which he previously did not drink at all, [1].
A few sharp flashing uterine pains (eighteenth day), [20].
Unpleasant taste in the morning, mouth dry and slimy, [1].
Burning pain in the sternum, when drinking beer, [1].
In the morning, after awaking, painful rubbing dry feeling in the borders of the right eyelids (fourth day), [25f].
Pressure on the bladder, in the morning, and urging to urinate, urine passing only after waiting several minutes, [1].
Even at night he must arise to urinate, and as often as he woke he had to urinate, with much thirst, even at night, [1].
Black spots before my eyes all day, passing in all directions (third day), [21].

Dimness of vision of both eyes, with great sensitiveness to bright daylight (second day); great dimness of vision (on reading), as if the cornea had lost its transparency; at the same time feeling of dryness (as from fine sand) between the eyelids (after one hour, seventh day), [25a].
Itching of the lids, obliging him to rest them every moment, in the afternoon; the eyes can scarcely endure the light at all, in the evening (twelfth day), [15].
Little sleep at night, on account of pain in hip-joint, when moving it, [1].
Sensation of paralysis in the forehead, [1].
Momentary stitches around the right lower ribs, towards the pit of the stomach, relieved by empty eructations, [2].
The pains are renewed and increased during and immediately after a meal, [1].
Severe stitches in the occiput, extending toward the vertex, [1].
Indolence of both body and mind, with difficult breathing (after eight days), [1].
Severe itching smarting at the inner canthi of the left eye, with lachrymation and somewhat reddened conjunctiva, [2].
Turbid urine with constant desire to urinate, [10].
Whirling vertigo, in the evening after lying in bed a quarter of an hour, as if he would fall into a faint, everything whirled around in the head, two evenings in succession, [1].
Bleeding from the gums on the slightest touch, [9].
The feet go to sleep, frequently when sitting, especially in the morning, [1].
Burning and easy fatigue of the eyes when reading, [1].
The skin of the whole body pains as if sore, [1].
Pressure in both orbits, [1].
Profuse leucorrhœa of lumpy mucus, having a fetid odor, with drawing pain in the lower abdomen, [1].
Sensation of many burning sparks in the eyelids, that are immediately drawn together, [1].
Continual inclination to stool, yet passed but little, [1].
Pressing pain in the malar and nasal bones, [1].
Restless sleep, for several weeks, with many dreams and tossing about, later quiet sleep, [1].
Lentil-sized brown spots on the elbows, surrounded with an herpetic-looking skin, [1].
Stitching pain in throat, when swallowing, [1].
Emissions disappear (secondary effect), [1].
Symptoms of threatened catarrh (fourteenth day); symptoms at height (fifteenth day); catarrh declined (sixteenth day), [16].
Burning in the eyes, [1].
Almost painful tickling under the nail of the left index finger, [1].
Colic from the navel to the pudendum, mostly when touching the abdomen, [1].
In the evening, drawing in the left eyebrow (forty-third day), [28c].
10 P.M., a chilly sensation in back and right shoulder, running downwards; chilliness in the back, if lying on either side, removed by lying on the back (twenty-first day), [20].

The menses, of an elderly female, which had been absent for two months, returned forty-eight days after taking the medicine, accompanied with drawing from the teeth into the cheek, which was swollen, [1].
Severe burning in the sternum, [1].
On the inside of the nose, especially on the alæ nasi, great itching and feeling as if the nose were swelled (twelfth day), [29a].
Tightness and constrictive sensation in the chest (third day); continued four or five days, [32].
Dull pain over the right eye and in the right temple (third day), [37].
Dryness in the throat, with sense of thickness, [8].
Sore pain in the region of the liver (after five hours), [2].
Much matter in the eye, in the morning, for several days, [48].
Slight sensitiveness in the right ear, judging by the feeling in the cavity of the tympanum (one hundred and thirty-second day), [45b].
In the evening violent pain, as if the head were screwed together from without, with flying heat in the face (twenty-eighth day), [33].
Intense itching of the skin, [10].
Violent colic and faintness before the menses, [1].
He awakes in the morning, at 3 o'clock, and cannot fall asleep again, [1].
Tearing pressure in the orbits of the eyes, particularly of the left eye, [2].
Pressure, heat, and glittering in the eyes as of a thousand suns, [1].
Pressure on the right chest in paroxysms, relieved by empty eructations, [2].
Very thirsty for cold water, drinking much and often, especially in evening, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Stitching headache in both temples, in the evening, [1].
Shooting-smarting pains along the inner side of the left arm and leg, while sitting or at rest, at intervals during the day, worse in the evening, from 5 P.M. till late (eighth day), [38].
Menses anticipated one day the first month and two days the second month; afterwards they came at the proper time, [24].
Pressure in the abdomen a few days before the menses, and after this had passed off, soreness in the perinæum and swelling of the pudendum before the discharge of blood came on, [1].
Tearing in the left frontal eminence (after eleven hours and a half), [2].
*Pressure in the head, in the morning, immediately after rising, [1].
I could scarcely open my eyes, which were agglutinated, with forcible closure of the lids; in the evening the light obliges me to shut them (fourteenth day), [15].
About 2 A.M., he awoke with aching pain in the occiput (third day), [22g].
Deepseated, tensive, dull pain in the lumbar region (right side), (third day), [36].
Pain in the front teeth, at night, [1].
Swelling of the upper lid and dry matter in the lashes, [1].
9.30 A.M., a slight but decided tingling in the urethra, for about an inch back from the head of the penis (fourth day), [40].
Sleepless at night, without anything to complain of, only she cannot lie quiet (after twenty days), [1].
No appetite; loathing of meat, [19].
Heat in the face, after a meal, [1].
Frequent gurgling empty eructations, [2].
*Tearing in the forehead, [1].
Boring above the root of the nose (twentieth day), [34].
Slight attack of vertigo and palpitation of heart, when walking in the open air, [1].
The complaints are considerably worse, evenings and nights, than during the day, [1].
Profuse perspiration after coughing, [9].
Feeling as if the head were stuffed, as the pain in the eye ceased, in the evening (third day), [35].
Very giddy at times, with dislike to all work, [1].
Scraping cough; it seems as if it had settled on the chest, [1].

At 6 P.M., suffering with a pain or great weakness in the small of my back (fourth day); pain not so severe (sixth day); back still aches and causes nausea, and a faint feeling while standing (seventh day); back still uncomfortable (eighth day), [37]. [The prover explains the backache:
Ravenous hunger, and if it is not appeased, water accumulates in the mouth, [1].
Shooting sharp pain in the upper bicuspids, left side, about 8 A.M. (thirty-second day), [38].
Teeth on edge, [1].
A vesicle on the left border of the tongue (thirty-third day), [33].
Heat in the tips of left toes, shooting like an electric spark through the left side up to the head, there leaving a troublesome weakness, lasting one half minute, [1].
Very sleepy, inclined to sleep at any time (after seven days), [16].
Cramp in the calves at night (after a cold), [1].
Tearing and pressure in the left temple and eye, [1].

With the burning heat in the throat, fulness and pressure in the head; this gradually increased into a severe frontal headache, more severe over the left orbit (second day); increased (third day); continued four or five days, [32].
In the evening, the gum around the stump of a tooth in the lower jaw, right side, is painful, as if a parulis were about to form; it went off before bedtime (ninety-ninth day), [45b].
In the morning, after awaking, itching in the eyelids (second day), which are gummed together (third day); itching much diminished (fourth day), [36].
Frequent sneezing, which always gave relief to the head (sixth day); in the afternoon, frequent violent sneezing (fourteenth day), [33].
Cramplike drawing below the right mastoid process (fifth day), [25a].
*Aching in the frontal bone (first, second, and third days), [29b].
Headache all day, with great mental depression, [36].
Black flies seem to float not far from the eyes (after twelve hours), [1].
Sleepiness during the day, she falls asleep as soon as she sits down, [1].
Heat in the head, so that it seemed like a burning coming out of the ears, causing difficult hearing and dim vision, [1].
Hypersensitiveness of hearing, [1].
Sick pale look, in the morning, with dim red eyes, [1].
Frequent jerking of the left lower eyelid, with sensation as if the tears would flow, which necessitates frequent wiping, [1].
Great aching between shoulders and under the left scapula, extending into the left lung, worse on expiration (fifteenth day), [20].
Long continued cramp in the soles of the feet, evening in bed, [1].
Vertigo, so that when looking up while walking, he stumbles, [1].
Pasty taste, in the morning, [1].

Bowels moved three times (thirty-first day); natural stool (thirty-second day); no stool (thirty-third day); bowels moved twice (thirty-eighth day); painful urging to stool, which was hard and in lumps, and considerable bleeding from the rectum after stool, at 6 A.M.; bowels moved freely and without pain, at 7 P.M.; moved quite freely at 10 P.M. (forty-fifth day); two stools (fifty-third day); one stool (fifty-fourth day); at 6.30 A.M. and 8 A.M. (sixty-second day); three stools (sixty-eighth day); two stools (eightieth day), [21].
Blood-streaked expectoration after a meal, [1].
As if surfeited, with nausea and feeling of debility, [2].
Dry feeling in the mouth and throat (first day), [20], [20a].
Great increase of sexual desire (first five days), [1].
Weakness of the muscles of the hand, [2].
Painful cracking in the head, as if something in it broke, with pain in the neck, when turning the head, [1].
Painless swelling in the nape of the neck, about the size of a hazelnut, [1].
Drawing pain in the right and left lower back molars, [2].
Pain in the nates, so that he can scarcely sit, [1].
About 4 P.M., after a glass of beer, pressive pain on the left eye (nineteenth day), [22a].
She is quite hot, then cold, with great faintness, [8].
Slight nausea after lunch (fifth day), [38].
At 11 A.M. slight pressive headache; the whole head is affected; this pain ceases in an hour; it returns in the evening over the right eye only (seventh day), [15].
Stitches from the navel to the pudendum, when coughing and gagging, [1].
Swelling of the upper lid, with redness and burning pain, [1].
Tearing in the right thigh, when walking, with pain of the parts from touch, [1].
Much ringing in both ears, while sitting, [1].
Leucorrhœa increases, when she has frequent eructations and retching, she then becomes pale in the face, [1].
Dizziness in the head, in the afternoon (soon, sixth day); dizziness, in the morning, soon after getting up, that lasted till 5 P.M. (seventh day), [44a].
Throbbing headache, in the evening, [1].
Burning on the skin of the arm on the outside just below the shoulder-joint, as from a blister, [2].
On two spots of the vertex there are found very tender scabby elevations, the size of a pea, which last several days (forty-third day), [28c].
Pressive headache, at 10 A.M.; towards 5 P.M. it increases; it feels as if the base of the brain were tightly compressed by a band (eighth day), [15].
Stitching, headache, outward through the eyes, the entire day, [1].
Quick decay of the teeth, [1].
Severe vertigo, at 9 A.M. (sixth day), [42a],
Itching in the urethra, [1].
Pimples on the chin with ulcerative pain, when touched, [1].
Purring in the lower limbs, arms, and hands, [1].
Violent stitching, as from needles, in the tip of the left thumb, [2].
Sore ulcerated gums, [3].
Pressure on the upper part of the sinciput, [2].
The eyes feel heavy and the lids are inclined to close, [8].
Sharp pains in each ovary and pressure to pass water; the pains ceased after passing water; later in the day a dull heavy pain in left ovary (first day), [22].
Little micturition with much thirst (after three days), [1].
Puffed face (after five, and forty days), [1].
Ringing in the ears recurring several times during the day (fourth day); occasional attack (sixth to tenth day), [39b].
Tearing in the left maxillary articulation, just in front of the ear, [2].
Vertigo, only when walking in the open air, she must be led, [1].
Itching on the eyes, [1].

Tearing in the head, mostly in the sides and forehead, at times with drawing and sticking and ulcerating pain, and especially relieved or removed by moving the head, by pressing upon it, and by free air, [3].
Jerking of the right leg at intervals during the day, followed by trembling of the right hand, so that he could not write, [1].
Toothache from the slightest draft of air, [1].
Obstruction of the nose, for seven days (after eight days), [1].
Great appetite, which, however, could not be freely indulged; a small quantity of food caused troublesome distension (second and third days), [17e].
Tension of the lower lip, [1].
Great uneasiness in the evening in one lower extremity, as from a sort of internal imperfect itching, [1].
Vertigo, as if from intoxication (soon, second day), [22c].
*Heaviness of the head while sitting, lying, moving, and stooping, [1].
Scabby nostrils, [1].
Pulsating throbbing felt externally on the head, [1].
*Rush of blood to the head; a pressure in it and out at the eyes; a feeling of numbness before the ears, [1].
Severe oppression of the chest, in the evening, the breathing very difficult, and on lying down much aggravated; she must sit up in bed; accompanied with flickering before the eyes, [1].
Restless sleep, with frequent waking, after midnight, [2].
At 9 P.M., in the undecayed teeth of the left lower jaw, aching pains which last an hour (fourth and fifth days), [22b].
In the morning, after waking, also at intervals, feverish shivering, with short breath, as from internal heat, which, however, did not exist, [1].
Smarting throughout the urethra, [3].
Before going to sleep, shooting pain in the upper border of the left orbit (first day), [33a].
Great exhaustion in the morning during menses, [1].
Creeping sensation on the inner margin of the left orbit, [2].
Pulsating in the left side of the occiput, that at last changes to a jerking, [1].
Excessive appetite, she was never satisfied; after eating, eructations tasting of the food, [1].
Faintness in the morning when rising from bed, as if he would sink, with loss of thought; then chilliness with gooseflesh and yawning for one hour, tongue very pale, pulse weak and slow, [1].
Stitches frequently in the left side of the head, in the afternoon, in the occiput in the evening, [1].
With icy-cold hands, warm feet, or vice versâ, frequently, however, both cold at once, [2].
Severe pressure in the chest, evening in bed, [1].
Dragging feeling in the eyes (fifteenth day), [20].
Slight sweat, in the morning, after awaking, [1].
Crawling sensation in the face, [1].
A good deal of coryza and sneezing, [56].
Pressing pain at lower part of right calf, as if cramp would set in, [2].
*Tearing as with a saw in the head, [1].
The eyes become fatigued from reading and writing, and pain in the internal canthus as if sore, [2].
Strong bearing-down pains, [10].
Burning pain on the tongue, [1].
Dizziness, like a tingling and buzzing out at the forehead, if she walks rapidly, or moves the head suddenly, [1].
Drawing in the occiput, [1].
Aversion to all food, particularly to meat; he could only eat butter, bread, and soup, [1].
She feels chilly from every motion, though in a warm room, [1].
Burning in the right side of the abdomen, when walking far, [1].
Hiccough during the habitual smoking, with contraction of the throat, and sensation as if a plug were in it, producing nausea and accumulation of water in the mouth, [1].
The scalp pains when touched, as if the roots of the hair were sore (after three days), [1].
Anxious oppression in upper part of chest, [8].
A ringing roaring in the head coming out at the ears, [1].
Some blood discharged with the stool, daily, for a long time, [1].
Voluptuous dreams, with pollutions, [1].
Slight sensitiveness and swelling of the gums on the right side of the lower jaw (sixtieth day), [45b].
White flickering before the eyes, [1].

About noon, shining red swelling of the point of the nose, whereby the anterior angle of the left nostril felt thick, hard, and painful to the touch (thirteenth day); increased redness and swelling of the inflamed nose (fourteenth day); the redness of the swelling on the nose is diminished, the shininess of the skin, and the sensitiveness to touch continue (fifteenth day); swelling of the nose as yesterday (sixteenth day); at 6 A.M., on the inside of the swollen portion of the nose is a hardened, transparent, bright-yellow mass, which can only be detached with difficulty and pain (seventeenth day); rapid diminution of the swelling of the nose, of which next day not a trace remains (eighteenth day), [21].
Sore pain in the ear, [1].
Both ears feel as if plugged up; am somewhat deaf; obliged to ask that a question be repeated (seventh day), [37].
Ebullition in the left side, like a bubbling, [1].
Rush of blood to the head, even during a soft stool, and after riding in a wagon, [1].
Stitches in the corns, even during rest; when knocking against, them stitches so severe as to cause a scream (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Dryness in the fauces (after eleven days), [1].
Stitches and tearing in the anus, [1].
Constant sweating and frequent itching in the left external auditory meatus (first day), [25e].
Burning in the mouth, in the morning, without thirst, [1].
Some flatulence, in the evening (eighteenth day), [20].
Cutting in the rectum in the afternoon, drawing towards the lower part of abdomen, followed by unsuccessful bearing down and pressing to stool, [1].
Tearing in the head more in the afternoon than in the forenoon, with weakness and thirstless heat; is obliged to lay the head upon a table to get relief, [1].
Have a cold, with few but sudden coughing spells; expectoration full and easy only in the morning, after breakfast (twentieth day), [20].
Pain in all the limbs, particularly in the hips (after two days), [1].
Severe bleeding of the teeth, in the morning, [1].
Stitching pain in both sides of lower abdomen, [1].
When at stool, profuse flow of saliva into the mouth (second day), [18d].
Agglutination of the eyes, two mornings (after twenty days), [1].
Stitch in the right mammary gland, the worst when getting cold while walking or riding, yet she could neither see nor feel anything wrong there, [1].
Menses several days too early (after forty-eight hours), [1].
At 11.30 A.M., occasional violent shooting in the right cheek-bone (sixth day), [37a].
Soreness in the anus, [1].

The appetite, which had been increasing for some days, is uncommonly good to-day (twenty-first day); increased appetite, so much so that, contrary to custom, he must eat at other times than the accustomed meals (twenty-sixth and twenty-seventh days); appetite diminished (thirty-first and thirty-second days), [35].
Anxiety in the limbs; he has no rest anywhere, [1].
Tension in the tendons over the knee, when going upstairs, [1].
Shooting in the inner sides of the tips of the fingers (fourth day), [38].
Inclination to sleep, particularly in the forenoon; she must sleep for an hour, [1].
Slight drawing in the occiput and nape (one hundred and eleventh day), [45b].
Moderate appetite, yet by no means for meat, towards which he has had an aversion for many days, [1].
Burning in the rectum, daily, with hard stools, intermingled with unsuccessful desire for stool (first days), [1].
Stye on the upper lid by the inner canthus, [1].
Burning in the point of the tongue (soon), [29].

Several pimples on cheeks and wrists, which are very sore, and of a pustular character at first, then resemble chicken-pox (sixth day); pimples still on cheeks (for ten weeks); pimples on cheeks just before and during menstruation (for three months); the pimples were attended by burning and soreness; when opened; pus and blood were discharged, and a small pit was left at the seat of the pimple, [24].
Discharge of much more urine than would correspond to the quantity of drink taken (after thirty-six days), [1].
Tearing in the nose, after dinner, disappearing for a short time after pressure upon it, after dinner, [3].
Cold air is disagreeable to him, [1].
Green halo around the candlelight, [1].
Waked with stitching pain in the right temple (thirty-second night), [38].
Pain on the right side of the tongue (which is then coated with thick mucus), which hinders chewing and distinct speaking, [1].
Sleep disturbed, through vivid unpleasant dreams (after sixteen days), [1].

Slight soreness of the outer corner of the left upper eyelid; slight itching of the inner surface; at 5 P.M. (seventh day); increased soreness of the eyelid (eighth day); lid much swollen; eye half close; swelling beneath the lower lid; œdematous, looks as if stung by a bee; lid sore to touch and on closing the eye; slight itching of the inner surface, causing the eye to water (ninth day); eye somewhat better (twelfth day), [26].
A deathly paleness of the face, [18].
Pimple on the tip of the tongue and very sweet saliva, [1].
Ulcerative pain in the left upper jaw (soon), [15a].
A thick painless lump on the lower jaw, tense on chewing, [1].
Menses three days too late (after nineteen days), [1].
Very disagreeable acrid bitter taste in the mouth, after breakfast (seventeenth day), [45a].
Pain and soreness through the bowels, all the evening (eleventh day), [23].
Stitches in the head, over the ears, lasting several minutes, [1].
Tension at the anus after stool, [1].
Painful drawing, now in the right, and again in the left side of the occiput, inferiorly (after five hours), [2].
Heat in the hands, in daytime, during mental excitement, [1].
Pimple near the right nostril, which afterwards formed a large scab, [1].
Dull aching pain in chest, right side, near sternum, fourth and fifth ribs, 12 to 1 P.M.; pains in chest return (thirty-second day), [38].
She felt best when at rest and while lying, [1].
Offensive breath as from mucus in the chest, [1].
Blowing of blood from the nose, at night, [1].
Pain in the region of the navel, very acute when coughing and stooping, [1].
Sudden hoarseness (after seven days), [1]
Paralytic sensation in the left arm, yet there is the proper mobility both in the arm and also in the fingers, [1].
Face much heated, in the evening, with heat in the head, [1].
Tearing in the left upper arm, at a small spot above the elbow, [2].
In the evening, frequent sudden tearing in the left cheek, in the right nape muscles, and in the right tibia (twenty-second day), [28c].
Bleeding of the nose when blowing it, in the evening, [1].
Constriction of the sphincter ani (fifth day), preventing any movements of the bowels (sixth day), [44].
*Pressive headache in the forehead, more violent on motion, [1].
*Heaviness of the head, so that every motion was disagreeable, [1].
Cough, with stitches in both sides of abdomen, upper part, [1].
Pain in almost all the teeth, during dinner, [1].
Dry day cough, which necessitates lying down, and during which it stops; at night while lying also no cough, but dry coryza, [1].
Great faintness, with heat and then coldness, [8].
The hand is immovably bent in toward the little finger, [1].
Dryness in the nose, [1].
Increased appetite the whole first part of the proving, [3].
Somnolence every third day, returning four times, the child slept almost the whole day; when it sat down it fell asleep, and complained also of pain in the forehead, [5].
Stitches in the right side of the chest, toward evening, during inspiration, [1].
Heaviness of the eyes, [1].

On the internal surface of the left lower lip he observed a group of grayish-white aphthæ, which were rather painful; after a time, several aphthæ appeared on the right upper lip (they lasted a week), (fourth day), [25f].
Cracking in the articulation of the jaw on chewing, [1].
Sore pain in throat, when swallowing, [1].
After lying down, slight drawing in the right ear (twelfth day), [28c].
Anxious heat, from 4 to 5 A.M., and from 5 to 6 P.M., [1].
During a week, spasms as from nervous weakness, lasting a day at a time, pulse somewhat weak, then again spasmodic, [1].
Pain in the hæmorrhoids after a natural stool (after four days), [1].
Contractive pain in the anus and then forwards and upwards into the abdomen, during stool, [1].
Screwing-together pain in the left side of the head, [3].
Fluttering noises in the ear, [1].
Shooting-stitching pain in the left molars, mostly from 11 to 12 o'clock (fourth day), [38].
Throbbing of the carotids (twenty-second day), [20].
Insipid taste, in the forenoon (second and thirteenth days), [30].

During the menses she was obliged to remain in bed for two days, on account of an uneasiness in the body, drawing pain in lower limbs and in abdomen, with rumbling; on the second day, palpitation of the heart, for several hours in the forenoon, accompanied with dyspnœa (after nine days), [1].
Great stoppage of the nose, for several days; on blowing the nose clots of blood are at times discharged, [1].
Tingling in the upper incisors, [3].
Aching-throbbing headache in the right half of the occiput (second day), [25].
Drawing in the arms from above downward, extending to the fingers (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Slight compression of the head, in the morning (tenth day), [44a].
Abundant discharge of water-colored urine (second day), [1].
Itching of the toes, [1].
Stretching out the neck and straining the cervical muscles distort the facial muscles (eleventh day), [1].
Tongue feels too large and scalded (thirteenth day), [21].
In the morning on awaking, sensation of dryness in the mouth (fourteenth day), [29].
Tickling on the tip of the right great toe, [2].
After emission, indolent, languid, sensitive to damp air, with turbid urine, vertigo, and constipation, [1].

Attack of sensation as of an icy-cold hand between the scapulæ, then coldness over the whole body, then spasm of chest as if suffocating, lasting several minutes, then clonic convulsions of right lower limb with jerking of it, and jerking of the right arm when the leg is held quiet; lastly there remains a trembling of the lower limb, continuing the whole day (after ten days), [1].
Asleep sensation in the outer ear, for eight days, [1].
Eyes feel like balls of fire, especially the left, which is much injected (fifty-seventh day), [21].
Much scurf on the head (for forty days), [1].
Remained languid for five days (after three days), [23].
Burning swelled feeling of the feet, [9].
In the morning, seized with profuse nosebleed; had four attacks during the day, a bright-red flow suddenly appearing, and disappearing as suddenly (third day), [25].
A roundish bright-red spot on ball of right hand, with violent itching, not relieved by scratching, evening, [2].
Pinching pain in the bladder, [1].
Pain in the eyes several times, with headache and heat in the eyes, [1].
Rush of blood to the nose, especially in the open air, [1].
Sensation of emptiness in the abdomen, [1].
Deep-toned roaring in the ear when lying on it, synchronous with the pulse, for two nights, [1].
About 10 A.M., a pretty violent drawing in the left temple, which only lasted a short time (second day), [25f].
Cough, with expectoration, [7].
Inflammation of the corns, [1].
Bruised pain in the muscles of the calves and in the hamstrings, [1].
Felt tired and weak about breakfast time (twenty-fifth day), [20].
Collection of water in the mouth, at 9.30 A.M. (third day), [45].
Very viscid nasal mucus (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Face flushed (after five hours and a half), [33]; (second day), [35].

Sudden and uncontrollable thirst, at 9 P.M., but water tastes insipid, unless very cold (fourth day); a very unusual thirst appeared, at 9 P.M.; I must have water (sixth day); a peculiar thirst, which lasted all the evening; water tastes natural if cold (ninth day); marked thirst, at 9 P.M. (tenth and following days), [20].
Painful pimples on the forehead, [1].
Fever and sickness all day, with thirst, [9].
Drawing and sticking in the nape of the neck, even when at rest, arresting the breath, [1].
Hard pressure in the pit of stomach, as from a stone, even when fasting, but more severe from eating bread, [1].
During eructations (in a very warm room), blood rises into the mouth, which he spits out, [1].

A peculiar headache, not easy to describe, accompanied by vertigo, and compelling her to keep quiet, and at its worst to sit still; she felt relief by shutting her eyes (fourth day); again affected by above described headache and vertigo. Today she was obliged to remain constantly seated in order to keep off the attacks; they were rather less in the open air. In the afternoon this vertigo became extremely severe; it followed upon nausea, inclination to vomit, twisting and turning in the stomach, yawning, excessive prostration, almost amounting to trembling of the limbs, and occasional noise in the head and ears. (The vertigo had this peculiarity, it increased in violence on stooping or moving about, but was alleviated by sitting still), (eighth day), [31a].
Pressive pain all over the head, especially on the occiput, aggravated by external pressure (fifth day), [22b].
Coryza, with diarrhœic stool, [1].
*Throbbing in the head, in the morning, [1].
Shooting pain in the second right upper molar (after one hour), [38].
Very salt tasting expectoration from chest, [1].
Discharge of bloody mucus after the stool, [1].
Burning in the rectum the entire day, [1].

He must urinate two or three times in an hour; pressure on the bladder, yet he must wait a long time before the urine comes, which then passes without pain; if he endeavors to retain the urine, he is attacked with anxiety and pressure on the bladder (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Some transient stitches behind the left ear, in the evening (twenty-fourth day), [45a].
Swelling and pain in the eyelids, with lachrymation, [1].
Coryza, for several weeks (after seven days), [1].

Fever, with pressing first in the temples, at intervals of several minutes; short breath, as from internal heat, the whole night through; following this in the morning, weak in the lower limbs, thirst, want of appetite, sleepiness; during the day feverish shivering, pain in the throat, and swelling of submaxillary glands, [1].
Tongue coated white, [1], [29].
Drawing on the left side of the lower jaw and in the left thigh, in the afternoon (fourth and fifth days), [44d].
Tension and drawing in the left shoulder-joint, passing off when moving it, [2].
Blisters in the mouth painful, while eating, [1].
Swelling of the lower lip, with eruption upon it, [1].
Nosebleed two afternoons in succession, at 3 oclock, followed by pain in the nose on touch, [1].
Palpitation of the heart, with anxious feeling, which necessitates taking a deep breath, without any influence on the spirits, for several days (after twenty-two days), [1].
Digging and contraction in the abdomen, with passage of much wind, [1].
Swelling of the gum, with throbbing pain, [1].
Violent pain in the middle of the head, caused by coughing and sneezing, [1].

Heavy pressing pain over the left eye, extending towards the side of the head, about 3.30 P.M.; sensation of great fulness deep in the left orbit, at 4 P.M.; headache confined to the left side, better in the evening; made worse by shaking the head; better in the open air; when I went to bed, 11.30 P.M., very slight headache (first day); occasionally darting pains, extending from the left eye over the side of the head towards the occiput; the pain in the left orbit and left side of the head continued all day long, as described yesterday, a heavy pressing pain or fulness, with occasional darts through the eyeball and side of the head; headache better after meals (second day); about 8 o'clock, had some pain, as yesterday, and it lasted all day; no particular time of aggravation; headache aggravated by mental labor (third and fourth days); awoke in the morning with slight headache, which grew worse towards 9 A.M., lasting so for about an hour, when it abated (fifth day), [31].
Continued erection after coition, and after nocturnal emissions, [1].
Burning, as from pepper, in the mouth, day and night, causing thirst, not relieved by drinking, [1].
Occasional sharp shooting pains in the eyeballs, during the day (eighteenth day), [20].
Feeling of dryness in the trachea (after three days), [1].
Pain as if burned, on the anterior part of the palate just back of the teeth when touching it with the finger or tongue, [1].
Aching in the right eye, and sometimes a feeling as if the eyeballs were swollen, during the forenoon (eighth day), [44d].
Sensitiveness of the upper lip, which is quite dry (fifty-fifth day), [45a].
Coming from college, felt a light sensation in the left limb, from the hip down (third day), [27].
Pain in the tibia as from a bruise, [1].

Whirling and staggering, while sitting, after drinking a harmless drink, so that he thinks he will have an apoplectic stroke; this lasted five minutes; afterwards, flush of heat lasting five minutes, [1].
The breath has a bad odor, when coughing, [1].
Drawing pain in the left side of the face, as if in the skin, above the eye, on the temples, and on the malar bone as far as into the lobule of the ear, mostly in the morning, [1].
Copious secretion of earwax (fifty and fifty-first days), [29].
Epistaxis, and in one case, a man of 60, nose bled every day, after the third day of taking the medicine, something which had not occurred since childhood, [76].
Great thirst, in the morning, after awaking, [1].

Woke at an unusual hour, namely, at 5 A.M., with aching-throbbing headache in the right half of the occiput, and pain in the left side of the small of the back; the former went off in half an hour, the latter after getting up in bed (second day), [25].
Smarting pains in the urethra near the meatus (thirty-second day), [38].
Stitches transversely through the abdomen, from the right to the left side, as quick as lightning (after thirty-six days), [1].
In the forenoon, frequent alternation of headache (at one time in the forehead, at another in the occiput), and the previous (gouty) pains in the joints, but only when at rest (fifth day), [25g].
Swelling at the orifice of the external auditory meatus; pressure near antitragus causes stitching pain, [1].
Cough, which affects the chest and stomach greatly, [1].
Sensation of stiffness and coldness in the arms, as if they had no blood in them, without any perceptible coldness to the touch, [1].
Rush of blood to the head (after five days), [1].
*Vertigo, in the forenoon (first day), [25e]; (thirty-second day), [43b].
Glans hot, with pale red and at times itching eruption, [1].
Stitches in the forehead as if in the bone, [1].
When falling asleep he was attacked with an internal trembling, and with itching in the thighs, going off after scratching, [1].
Roaring and singing in the left ear much diminished), (sixth day), [40].
Itching in the face, on the arms, hands, back, hips, abdomen, and pubes (after two, twenty, twenty-three, and twenty-eight days), [1].
Smarting-boring pain to the right of the navel (after eighteen days), [1].
Orgasm of blood, with congestion of blood to head and chest (after sixteen days), [1].

In the forenoon, some burning on the edges of the eyelids (seventh day); slight burning in the external canthi (sixty-fourth day); during the day, severe burning on the edges of the eyelids (two hundred and third day); slight burning of the tarsal edges (two hundred and seventy-ninth day), [45b].
Noise in the right ear, [1].
Tearing and smarting as from pepper, posteriorly on the right side of the tongue, [2].
Sensation of fog in his head and dizziness, which makes him sad; ideas indefinite, with irresolution, [1].
Bloated feeling in the lower part of the bowels, with dull aching in the ovaries, and a return of the heavy feeling in the head, with sleepiness (fourth day), [22].
Yellow expectoration, tasting like rotten eggs, [1].
Violent coryza (after fifth and seventeenth days), [1].
Red mark across bridge of nose, as if I had been wearing spectacles (tenth day); less (thirteenth day), [13].
At noon, good appetite and much thirst (first day); great appetite (second day), [42].
Accumulation of salt saliva in the mouth, [1].
Too salt taste to all food, [1].
Tickling in the palate, posteriorly (thirty-second day), [18a].
Leucorrhœa, with itching in the vagina (after three days), [1].
Sour taste in the mouth, in the morning after a good sleep, [3].
What he eats tastes like nothing, like bad wood, [1].
Burning in the feet, at night, [1].
Sexual thoughts, without erections (fourth day), [1].
Mouth insipid, with loss of appetite, [1].
Cold knees, at night, [1].
Stitching and tearing in the heels, day and night, more pain when treading on them than when at rest; they were pale and cold, and felt numb, [1].
Pimples on the right cheek, [1].
Stitching-smarting pains in the left knee and on the inner sides of thighs and arms (sixth day), [35].

Heart's impulse and rapidity increased, especially during inspiration (after eight hours); have occasionally, in the past, noticed a slight irregularity of pulse; the irregularity of the heart has entirely disappeared (fourth day), [39a].
After dinner, several fine stitches in the right concha (fifth day), [25a].
Whizzing before the ears, in the evening when writing, interpolated with whistling, [1].
Heaviness in the stomach, with dull pain about the abdomen, [1].
Yellowness of the face and whites of the eyes, for one day, [1].
Attacks of vertigo while walking, with apprehension on looking in front of her, wherewith there was immediately a crawling ("Kriebelig") before the eyes, [1].
At 9 A.M., felt suddenly sick, with distress in the pelvis, which increased during the forenoon (second day), [20].
Yellow leucorrhœa (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Boring, as with a hot iron, in the teeth, [1].
Movements of the scalp from the nape of the neck over the vertex to the forehead, [1].
Occasional roaring in the ears (first day); roaring all day long (second day), [39b].

Beating in the top of the head, very painful from the slightest motion, on turning the eyes and on moving the head or body, as if it would force outwards, also indistinct beating during perfect quiet, [1].
Stitches transversely through the abdomen, just over the hips, [1].
Disagreeable metallic taste (tenth, eleventh, and twelfth days), [26].

In the evening swelling at the wrist-joint, at the bend of the elbow, and around the ankle-joint; the joints are stiff during motion; in the morning the swelling was gone, but the parts were painful to touch, [1].
Want of steadiness and dizzy feeling accompanied anxious state (fourth day), [30].
Dull aching pains in region of kidneys and small of back (thirty-second day), [38].
Thick yellow discharge from the nose (seventh day), [37].
Throat red and dry (twentieth day), [20].
Aching in the small of the back (ninth and sixteenth days), [20].
At noon, he had an uncommonly good appetite (first, second, and third days), [29b]; (second day), [41]; (fourth day), [41b]; (tenth day), [43]; (several days), [45a].
First a slight tickling in the left temple, then a sensation as if the skin were being drawn upwards, [2].
Profuse general nightsweat, from evening till morning, [1].
Felt worse after sleep this afternoon; great vascular excitement, and felt sore and lame all over; did not wish to move (seventh day), [20].
Pressure in the eyes at night (after two days), [1].
