Feeling as if she had taken cold, with soreness and burning in the nostrils and aching in the alæ nasi; the right nostril feels stuffed, yet there is a slight watery discharge, in the evening; nose symptoms abating after going to bed (first day); nose burning and painful, especially at the root of the nose (after two hours); the whole feeling is one of a severe cold in the head (after five hours, second day), [44].
Burning of the eyelids externally, [1].
Cough, with coryza, every morning until nine o'clock; he sneezes already early, while in bed, [1].
In the evening, severe cold in the head with headache (twentieth and twenty-first days), [34].
Pressing pain in the right side of the abdomen, [1].
Frequent starting when falling asleep, [1].
Pressure on the bladder, with burning after micturition, in the evening, [1].
Pains like knives shooting through the uterus spasmodically, [10].
Drawing pressure under the right scapula, at one time more in the back, then again in the side, especially felt when siting with the arm held out free from the body, [2].

Vilent sneezing (immediately); frequent sneezing, which increases the pain under sternum (seventh day); few sneezes (forty-second day); frequent sneezing (forty-fifth day); occasional sneezing and hawking of mucus (fifty-fifth day); occasional violent sneezing, in the forenoon (fifty-ninth day); frequent sneezing and dry tussiculation (sixty-seventh day); occasional sneezing, in the morning after rising (eighty-fifth day); occasional sneezing and coughing up of thick mucus (one hundred and tenth day); frequent sneezing (one hundred and forty-seventh day); violent sneezing, in the evening (two hundred and seventeenth day); very violent sneezing, at noon, ten successive times, followed by frequent dry tussiculation (two hundred and nineteenth day); occasional sneezing (two hundred and thirty-first and two hundred and thirty-second day); occasional violent sneezing (two hundred and seventy-ninth day); occasional sneezing (two hundred and eighty-second day), [45b].
Gurgling to the right of, near to the small of the back, [1].
Drawing and stitching in all the fingers of the left hand, [1].
Pressure on the shoulder, at night, which felt as if it had gone to sleep and was sprained, [1].
Looseness of the teeth and bleeding of the gum, for three weeks, [1].
Unusual thirst, [57].
*Aching pain in the forehead (immediately, ninth day); in the morning the usual headache (tenth day), [22b].
Little pleasurable sensation during coition (second day), [1].
Expectoration from the chest, without much cough and without dyspnœa, [1].

For many years he had been subject to great scaliness of the head, so that a large quantity of scales came off when he combed or brushed his hair, and his coat collar was always covered with them; for a few days he has not noticed any of these scales, so that he thinks the Sulphur must have acted curatively (fifty-first day); no scales when he combs his head, though he used to have a good many (seventy-fourth day), [45a].
In the evening, after walking in the cold wind, I had a sore, rough, burning feeling in my eyes, aggravated by gaslight and on attempting to read (second day), [30].
Seems to be averse to smoking tobacco (secondary effect?), [1].
Vertigo, with qualmishness to falling sideways, while walking in the open air, [1].
Trembling of the lips, [1].
Crawling or prickling stitches in the sole and under the toes, more during rest than during walking (after four days), [1].
The eyes feel tired and look injected (after five hours, second day); tired and reddened (fourth and fifth days), [44].

After heat, redness and puffiness of the face, which lasted two hours, and during a following paleness of the face, lasting many hours, an inability to urinate of fourteen hours' duration, followed by the desire to urinate every one-fourth hour, with scanty discharge; these periods of retention and urging to urinate recurred several times; the last of these retention lasted twenty hours, notwithstanding much drinking (first day), [1].
Fine sticking pains occasionally in left lower jaw and the glands underneath, particularly when touched, [1].
Herpetic eruption on the lips, [1].
Complete loss of appetite; he desires only acids, [1].
Heat and swelling of the margin of the anus, [1].
Frontal headache and pain in the temples returned daily, more marked, morning, noon, and evening (twelfth to twenty-third day), [38].
Slimy diarrhœa, with distended abdomen, [1].
Burning in the right eye for a short time, which recurs at short intervals (seventeenth day), [34].
Drawing cold feeling in single upper incisors, [1].
The itching changes to burning, [1].
Redness of the white of the eyes (after seventeen days), [1].
Burning of the upper lids, [1].
Tingling in the forearm, [1].
Bitter taste, in the morning, relieved by eating, [1].
In the afternoon, slight tearing pains in the left eyebrow (seventeenth day), [28c].
Much ringing in the ears, and tingling or roaring in the head, for several days, [48].
Heat in the left eye, in the morning, with swelling of the inner canthus, [1].
Vertigo and weakness, even to falling, in the morning on rising, [1].
The brownish stool, although scanty and not hard, is expelled with much straining, [2].
Dull frontal headache, at 3 P.M. (second day), [35].
The arm goes to sleep when resting the head on it, [1].
Extremely sleepy at noon, afternoon wakeful again, [1].
Slight creeping in the throat, with sensation of hoarseness, which causes frequent hawking, [2].
Stitches in the forehead, in the evening, which afterwards constantly became more violent, [1].
Smoking tobacco is not relished by one accustomed to smoking, [1].
Frequent attacks of cutting pains in the abdomen; she must draw herself quite together for a couple of minutes, [1].
Aching in tibia (thirtieth day); in lower part of both tibiæ, 12 to 1 P.M. (thirty-first day), [38].
In the morning, on awaking, arid, wrinkled lips (third day); lips dry and shrivelled (fourth day); dryness of the lips and palate (tenth day), [29a].
Tenderness of upper lip (eleventh and forty-first days), [45a].
Transient dull drawing pains in the right forearm and thigh (third day), [36].
Giddiness in the head, she can scarcely carry it, [1].
Repeated stitches in a spot in front of left chest, in the afternoon (twelfth day), [15].
Dull pain in the sacrum (thirty-fifth day), [21].
Dreams full of dispute, [1].
Excessive vertigo, in the morning on rising; as soon as he attempts to stand he falls back upon the bed, only disappearing after half an hour (tenth day), [1].
Severe itching on the head, when the headache passed off, [1].
While eating, pulsations in pit of stomach, the more he eats the worse it becomes, [1].
Icy coldness of both hands in the warm room, they send a chilly feeling through the whole body, [2].
Heaviness in the back, in the morning on awaking, as if she could not turn or raise herself, or as if she had lain in a wrong position, almost as if the parts had gone to sleep, [1].
Much pain and weakness in small of back, [8].
Dulness of the whole head and unsteadiness of it, with tension of the muscles of the throat and back of the neck, [1].
Protrusion and itching of hæmorrhoids, [1].
Pain in the left ear, as if it were being torn out, [1].
Sour odor from the mouth, [1].
I noticed a peculiar quite unpleasant exhalation from the body after getting warm in bed (twenty-seventh day), [38].
When sitting he is sleepy, and when reading he falls asleep, [1].
Accumulation of flatus, [7a].
Weary pain in left shoulder-joint, [8].
Burning sore pain in the upper part of the left chest, even from touch, [2].
Throbbing and boring in the teeth, [1].
Small dark specks before the eyes; eyes dazzled after looking long at an object (twenty-third day), [34].
Collection of saliva in the mouth, sour and bitter, [1].
She wakes at 1 A.M., and cannot fall asleep again, [1].
Going out in the morning into the open cold air produced great discharge of tears from the right eye, painless; seated for awhile in a warm room this ceased (second day), [38].

The skin of the head is again covered with many white scales, difficult to get away (one hundred and eighty-ninth day); on combing the hair, a quantity of scales fall from the head (one hundred and ninety-third day); many scales on the head (two hundred and thirty-second day); a large number of scales on the head, especially the vertex (two hundred and fifty-third day); accumulation of scales on the scalp (two hundred and sixty-ninth day), [45b].
*Hammering headache on vivacious talking, [1].
Pressure on the bladder and frequent micturition, with tension in the lower abdomen, [1].
Single, violent, undulating jerks of pressing headache, quite in forepart of the forehead (after thirty-five hours), [2].
Swelling of the inner part of the gums, [1].

On waking from a lewd dream, found my abdomen covered with semen; it was the first time for a long while that I had had an emission (third night); had a seminal emission, unconscious of it until I waked; no dream; did not wake until morning (sixth night), [27]
Dull pain in old roots of teeth; they are sensitive to the action of cold, [1].
A strange tickling sensation in lower part of chest, [8].
Sensation of hunger, in the abdomen; speedy fulness from a few morsels, [1].
Putrid sourish offensive stool, [1].
Sourish taste in the mouth, [1].
Intermittent slight tearing, low down in the left side of occiput, near the neck, [1].
Ulcerated nostrils, which had troubled me for some weeks, were much relieved), (second day), [24].
Two stools and always with some tenesmus, [1].
Waving and confusion in the head returns, in the evening
Violent cutting in the stomach, extending up to the breast, with constant motion of flatus, which cannot find exit (after four days), [1].
Tearing in the lower part of the right foot (after eleven hours), [1].
Immediately after a meal feeling of soreness in throat, like a cramp at the inner side of the cervical vertebræ, [1].
Periodically recurring, but not very severe pains in the temples, followed by acute drawing pains in the temples, [17a].
A full feeling in the head, [28a].
Pressure and drawing in the legs from the knees to the toes, more when sitting and lying, better when walking, [1].
Numb feeling in right tonsil (after four days), [1].
Inclination to cold feet, [1].
Drawing pain in the occiput, so violent, while chewing, that he was obliged to stop eating, [2].
Swelling and some redness of the right upper eyelid, in the morning, [2].
*Pressive headache (even in the morning after rising), mostly on the vertex, as if the eyes would be pressed down, [3].
Drawing in the upper molars, [2].
Profuse secretion on lower part of the glans of purulent fluid, having a sourish salt smell, with itching, [1].
Drawing pain in both sides of the abdomen, in repeated attacks, [1].
Dyspnœa, with mucus in the chest difficult to loosen, [1].
Heaviness in the feet, when walking, [1].
On clenching the fist, the last joints of the fingers feel sore; if pressed, they are quite painful (thirty-second day), [38].

Transient sensitiveness of the mucous membrane of the nose (fourth day); mucous membrane of the nose feels sore, on smoking (thirty-second day); at dinner, a peculiar feeling in the right nostril; he felt as if the mucous membrane detached itself from the bone and rose as a blister, at the same time frequent sneezing; these symptoms were present almost all the afternoon (thirty-fourth day); raw pain on the edge of the right nostril (sixty-fifth day), [45a].
He bites the teeth together at night, during sleep, which causes great pain, [1].
Orgasm of blood in body, three days in succession (after twenty-seven days), [1].
Uneasiness in the whole body (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Every noise distresses him, [1].
Bitter taste in the mouth, with dulness of the head and ill-humor, [1].
Towards evening, in the open air, there were several dull shoots through the right external meatus (one hundred and twenty-seventh day), [45b].
She becomes paralyzed from vexation, [1].
All the pains came suddenly, leaving more gradually but very soon, except the pain in the face and shoulder, [27].
Fulness in temples and forehead, and throbbing of carotids (twenty-third day), [20].
Flying shoots in the left temple, in the afternoon (twenty-eighth day), [40].
A few vesicles appear on the upper lip, right side, sore to the touch (twenty-sixth day), [38].
Pressive headache in the right side of the occiput, [2].
Wearisome sleep (after fifteen days), [1].
Lassitude, at 9 A.M. (twenty-third day), [20].
High fever, with rash, [10].
Drawing-tensive pressure in the abdomen, [2].
Jerking of either of the limbs, when moving them, [1].
Griping in the lower abdomen the whole day, in quarter-hour attacks, with hard stool daily, three days in succession (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Vertigo, lasting some minutes, followed immediately by slight shooting in the anus (fourteenth day), [45b].
Slight burning and profuse lachrymation of the left eye, in the forenoon (tenth day), [45].
A few sharp shooting pains in the vaginal orifice (nineteenth and twenty-third days), [20].
Burning in the right flank, [2].
Heat in the head, evenings (after three days), [1].
Very disagreeable resinous taste in the mouth (fifty-fifth day), [45a].
An inflamed pimple behind the right ear (one hundred and sixty-second day); a small inflamed pimple behind the right ear (two hundred and sixty-third day), [45b].
Pressive headache in the house, with tightness of the scalp, relieved by uncovering the head, [1].
Violent squeezing pain, first in the left, then in the right auricle, close to the meatus (first day), [18a].
Arthritic drawing in the knees, [1].
Tearing pain in left cheek, and thence over the ear toward the occiput, [1].
Frequent awaking at night, many nights in succession (after six days), [1].
Swelling under the eyes, in the morning after awaking, [1].
She cannot endure any draft of air on the teeth; no pain while in bed, pain commences early in the morning, about one hour after rising; also no pain from touching or cleaning the teeth, [1].
Cutting in the toes as with a knife, at night, mostly when lying on the back, with redness of the tips of the toes; by morning the pain has all gone (after forty-one days), [1].
Inclination to sneeze, that shook her almost spasmodically, [3].
Discharge of greenish-red fluid from the vagina, during pregnancy, [1].

A sharp pain under the ensiform cartilage, as if a nerve were made tense, in a spot that could be covered by the end of the finger, worse from inspiring and going upstairs (after eight hours); the pain has entirely disappeared (fourth day), [39a].

At night, drawing pains in the region of the left eyebrow and aching in the left eyeball, as if it were swelled out and pushed forward; the aching in the eyeballs only went off the following morning, after getting up (twenty-fifth day), [40].
Lentil-sized, red, insensible nodules, here and there, in the hands, which ooze on prickling, [5].

The complaints disappear during violent exercise, such as walking in the open air, fencing, etc. (horseback riding excepted), and appear most frequently and severely when sitting quiet, forenoon and evening, [2].
Intense headache, with sensation that his head and ears were suffered, [51].
Pain darting along the wrist and dorsum of right hand to between first and second fingers; soon a similar pain on corresponding part of the palm of the hand (thirty-second day), [38].
Pressing in the vertex (twenty-third day), [20].
Sweat on the feet, [7a].
Stitches in both sides of the upper abdomen, when coughing, [1].
A large blister on each upper arm with violent itching, [1].

Sensation of bearing down in the pelvic region, with a slight dragging pain from the sacrum (fourth and fifth days); pelvic symptoms increase; more weight and bearing down; more pain extending into the loins and down the thighs in front, with constriction of the sphincter (sixth day); symptoms of the pelvic region last the longest (seventh day), [44].
Attacks of flushes of heat, as if hot water were poured on one, with redness of the face, sweat of the whole body, and anxiety, without thirst, yet without dryness of the throat, [1].
Profuse sweat in the face, after eating warm food, [1].
Tensive pain in the tendo Achillis, [1].
Eyes feel pulled downward (nineteenth day), [20].
Urging to stool in the evening (unusual); stool insufficient and difficult to pass (fourth day); small soft stool in the morning (fifth day); hard difficult stool at night (seventh day), [36].
In the morning dryness of lips, the mucous membrane of which lies in folds; aridity of the commissures of the mouth, which are covered with small whitish scales (fifteenth day), [29].
Sensation as of a knife plunged into the left hand, just on the ball behind the little finger, for a few minutes (seventh day), [27].
Intermission of the beats of the heart, after dinner, [1].
From 10 A.M. to 6 P.M., throbbing pain in the left temporal region, which was aggravated by walking, and at 6 P.M. suddenly went away (fourth day), [44c].

Dryness of the nose, burning on the outer borders of the alæ nasi, which are very sensitive to touch, in the evening (fifth day); dry feeling and troublesome tension in the nose, in the forenoon (fourteenth day); troublesome dryness in the nasal cavity (sixteenth day); in the nose sometimes dry feeling, and sometimes a discharge of watery fluid from it (seventeenth day); dry feeling in the nose, towards noon (eighteenth day), [45].
Throbbing in the head (temples), on the neck, and about the heart; everything in it throbbed and trembled, [1].
Vertigo, when rising up in bed at night, [1].
Dulness of the head, as from violent coryza, with reeling, [1].
The lips are sore, smarting, and disposed to crack, [9].
Pain all over the bowels, with sense of fulness and soreness, [24].
Swelling of the gums with sore pain, [1].
Constrictive pressive sore throat, just above and on the larynx, [2].
Scraping sensation in the throat, when swallowing, [2].
Nightly toothache, on account of which she could not sleep, and in the morning when it ceased, she was so agitated, that notwithstanding great weakness, she could not go to sleep, [1].
Shaking of the brain, from striking the foot against anything, [1].
Violent nosebleed (after twelve days), [1].

He raised himself about midnight, as if in delirium, began to laugh; on being questioned he closed his eyes tightly, sat quite stiff, with outstretched arms and hands and tightly set teeth; after drinking a swallow of water he asked what he was to do with so much water in his stomach, yet he drank more, held up his hand bend, as if holding the glass, laughed and said, Now this is strange, this water did not agree quite well; afterwards talked of three doctors who were coming, and referred to persons as if they were standing about, [1].
Painful pressure in the place of a hernia, during violent laughter, [1].
Discharge of blood with stool, which is not hard, [1].
Hair came out much, in the morning, on combing it, [44d].
The commissures of the mouth, especially the left one, smarted as if raw (fourth day), [44c].
Dull pressing pain on a small spot in the occiput, [2].
Inflammation of the eyes, with redness of the whites; stitching and pressure therein, [1].
Stitching pain in the right abdominal muscles, with visible twitches, [1].
Severe throbbing headache in the temples, [1].

Pressure and cutting in the throat, when swallowing, with a coating of mucus in the throat; on attempting to hawk up the mucus the pressure and cutting are aggravated, with a sensation as if the throat were cut with shears, followed by bleeding; dulness of the head, heat over the whole body, fever, pulse 108, followed by a stupid condition, in which he did not know whether he was awake or asleep; during the night frequent waking, with great accumulation of mucus in the throat and distressing dreams; on rising the next morning weakness, sweat on the forehead, and qualmishness, so that he lay down again, [7].
Occasional noises in the head and ears (eighth day), [31a].
Very thirsty, in the morning, [1]; (fifth day), [20].
*Headache, as if screwed together, in and over the forehead, [1].
Violent drawing in the right side just above the hips, extending up to the ribs and towards the kidneys, relieved after the emission of flatus, [7a].

Headache comes on with the heat and gets better with it, but never quite goes; it is as if the occiput were opening and shutting; better by cold water or in open air; worse by bending head down, [16].
*Vertigo, in the morning, with some nosebleed, [1].

Fine stitching in the scapula, also extending into the side of the chest, only when sitting and walking fast; during moderate walking it ceases, so also when leaning on the painful spot; mostly in the evening and afternoon, [1].

In the evening, immediately after dose, sweet taste in the palate (thirteenth day); sweetish taste (seventeenth day); in the evening, sweetish taste in the mouth (twenty-sixth day); sweet taste (in one hour, thirtieth day); in the forenoon, sweet taste (thirty-third day), [29].
The arms go to sleep, even to the hands, particularly painful when they lie under the covers, in which case there is also a painful stiffness in them, [1].
Tension around the knee, [1].
Looks ill; has double rings around the eyes (two hundred and seventy-eighth day), [45b].
Itching on the eyeballs, [1].
Tearing around the knees and malleoli, only when sitting and lying, [1].
Great thirst, with desire for beer, in the evening (eighteenth day), [45a].
Aching pain across the loins, worse on moving, [9].
Nausea almost immediately, followed by drawing in the limbs, [1].
*Vertigo when walking over running water, even to falling down, and all parts seem paralyzed, [1].
In the evening, tearing in the right cheek (thirtieth day), [28c].

Throat dry and hot, with paroxysms of pain, attended by lachrymation, in the afternoon; worse at 8 P.M.; a raw feeling in the posterior nares, with dryness and rigidity in the throat below; throat so dry as to seem like a board; in swallowing it seemed as if the opposing parts would not blend, they were so dry and rigid; frequent paroxysms of pain in throat, with lachrymation; fauces red (twenty-second day); throat worse after sleeping, with paroxysms of pain, attended by lachrymation, relieved for a time by detaching mucus, which had to be swallowed; throat bright red; feeling of dryness and rigidity in the throat, and of rawness in the posterior nares (twenty-third day), [20].
Painful sensation of dryness in the nose, with violent coryza, [1].
Red swelling on the forearm, with pain as from pressing on a suppurating boil, [1].
Much weakness in the lower limbs, [1].
Undulating pressure in the inguinal canal, from within outwards, [2].
The hand becomes numb and goes to sleep if he holds anything tightly or carries anything, [1].
4 P.M., chilliness, with heat in the forehead, lasting half an hour, [1].
Constant headache, [66].
Sharp pain in the left side, near the heart, in the middle of the afternoon, and again about 10 P.M. (tenth day), [22].
Burning constrictive pain in the shoulders, chest, and throat, evenings, [1].
Whizzing and roaring in the ears, with sensation as if they were stopped, yet she can hear, [1].
Slight tearing on the right malar bone, below the temple, [2].
Dark rings around the eyes (twelfth day), [20].
Burning in the urethra, [1].

I got up in the morning with boring pain over the right eye, and rheumatic pain in the region of the insertion of the temporal muscles of the coronoid process, which was entirely relieved for a few minutes after eating and while eating; this pain was worse on the right side, although it slightly extended to the left side in the same region, and into the right temporal region (fifth day), [27].
Some griping pains in the lower part of the bowels; passed away about 10 A.M. (eleventh day), [22].
Chilly sensations in the back, with the sleepiness, at 8 P.M. (twentieth day), [20].
Hoarse, this evening (third day), [37].

An inflamed pimple on the occiput (twenty-second day); some inflamed pimples at the back of the scalp (sixtieth day); on the occiput two painful pimples, and a similar inflamed pimple on the middle of the vertex (seventy-ninth day); several painful pimples on the occiput (ninety-ninth day); [I must repeat the remark, that the large quantity of scales I used to have on my head for some time back have quite disappeared, and that I cannot now bring away anything of the sort by vigorous combing and brushing, but the hair on the vertex is falling off considerably, so that a bald place is beginning to appear.] on the right side of the scalp a small painful pimple (one hundred and eighth day); several small, not itching pimples, in the hollow at the back of the head downwards towards the nape (two hundred and twenty-third day), [45b].
In the forenoon, drawing in the teeth, which recurred several times (tenth day), [44f].
Both eyes feel heavy, with tendency to keep them closed (third day), [31].
In the evening, jerking cutting in right eye, spreading to the temple; it lasts several hours, and can be excited anew by touching the right side of the tip of the nose (first day), [18d].
Pressure in the throat, even when it is dressed very loosely, [1].
The teeth become elongated, so that she can scarcely chew, [1].
Pinching pain in the vertex and in the upper part of the occiput, with sore feeling, which at last became a burning, [2].
Jumping-aching pains in lower molars, [11].
Large blisters on the right thumb, with itching, [1].
Fatigue and powerlessness in both arms, on awaking, [8].
A white vesicle in the white of the eye, close to the cornea, [1].
During eructations, in the morning, griping in stomach, as if something would tear loose, [1].
Much pain when walking, on account of excoriation from the leucorrhœa, [1].
Constipation succeeding a relaxed state of the bowels, [8].
Profuse secretion of thick, yellow, purulent nasal mucus, for several days, [3].
Great heat until midnight (first eight nights), [1].
Tongue rather white-furred (forty-third day), [22a].
Arrests breathing when standing still, [1].
Right eye looks red and feels sore, left eye normal (third day), [37].
A white spot before the eyes, on looking into the air, [1].
*Dulness of the head, in the morning, and pressure in the forehead till noon, [1].
Flickering before the eyes (after forty-eight hours), [1].
A sensation under the skin of the face as if dashed with cold water, with perceptible coldness of the face, in paroxysms, lasting a few minutes, [1].
Feet cold and damp all day, feeling as though I stood in cold water up to my ankles (my feet are usually dry), (eleventh day), [22].

Pulse, A.M., 84; P.M., 80 (forty-first day before the proving); P.M., 84 (fortieth day); A.M., 83; P.M., 80 (thirty-ninth day); A.M., 80; P.M., 78; (thirty-eighth day); A.M., 72; P.M., 73 (thirty-seventh day); A.M., 76; P.M., 78 (thirty-sixth day); A.M., 75; P.M., 75 (thirty-fifth day); A.M., 76; P.M., 72 (thirty-fourth day); A.M., 73; P.M., 78 (thirty-third day); A.M., 74; P.M., 77 (thirty-second day); A.M., 73; P.M., 75 (thirty-first day); A.M., 74; P.M., 72 (thirtieth day before the proving); A.M., 90; P.M., 80 (third day of proving); A.M., 82; P.M., 80 (fourth day); A.M., 80; P.M., 75 (fifth day); A.M., 74; P.M., 75 (sixth day); 1 P.M., 80; 6 P.M., 74 (seventh day); A.M., 74 (eighth day), [37].
Thought she would vomit during the perspiration, but was relieved on getting up and moving about (eleventh day), [23].
Menses eight days too late (the after effect), (after twenty-eight days), [1].
Uterus congested, and a yellowish leucorrhœa pouring from it; beginning to prolapse; slightly displaced (fortieth day), [22].
Throbbing drawing toothache, [1].
Violent nosebleed, in the morning on blowing the nose, [1].
Drawing pain in the shoulder-joint, in the morning in bed, lasting one hour after rising, [1].
Frequent short paroxysms of coryza, [1].
Upper lip sensitive to touch (second, eighth, and eleventh days), [45]; (sixty-eighth day), [45a].
Cramping pain in hip-joint, she must walk about to relieve it, [1].
Dizzy unsteady feeling when getting up to walk (after two hours); dizziness returns when rising to walk; the least movement causes dizziness (fourth day), [38].
Itching and burning in the nostrils, as if sore, [1].

Frequent sneezing (nineteenth day); frequent sneezing, in the afternoon (twenty-eighth day); frequent sneezing (thirty-second day); frequent severe sneezing, at least ten times in succession, at noon (sixty-seventh day); frequent sneezing, in the afternoon (seventy-eighth day); repeated severe sneezes (eighty-first day), [43a].
During the day, aching in the forehead (eighth day), [18b].
Burning in the outer canthus frequently during the day for one hour, [1].
Dulness in the sinciput (after three hours and a half), [2].
Continual stupid feeling in the head, [1].
Feeling of heaviness in the chest, necessitating deep breathing, [1].
Jerking of the leg when falling asleep, [1].
Contraction of the chest, in the morning on awaking, [1].

One sharp darting pain in the right ovarian region, (seventeenth day); pain in the right ovarian region, as of a thread running downward to the uterus and drawn tightly (eighteenth day); pain in right ovary; the dull ovarian pain is sharper on inspiration (nineteenth day); pain in right ovary, worse in the afternoon (twentieth day); dull pain in the right ovary, with occasional sharp shooting pains (twenty-second day); steady pain in the right ovarian region and backache (twenty-third day); pain in right ovary, soreness on pressure after sleep, in afternoon. Felt too badly to move (twenty-fourth day), [20].
No appetite, [8].
Burning-contracting cramps of stomach, from a cold, [1].
Jerking in the left lower lid almost constantly, [1].
Languid dull feeling, at 8 P.M. (twentieth day), [20].
Bitter sourish taste in the mouth, at noon after eating, [1].
Pressure on the upper part of the sternum, like a weight, [1].
Painful stitches in the left thigh, when walking (after eleven days), [1].
Violent cutting transversely across the abdomen, as from flatulence, passing off from motion, accompanied by cutting in the left testicle, [1].
Shooting pains in the teeth (tenth day), [34a].
Stitches in the right side of chest and scapula, during inspiration and cough, [1].
Dimness of vision, as from a fog, with the headache, [1].
Morning sweat for several mornings, with anxiety, [1].
Tongue sticky and coated a dirty yellow; a very putrid taste, which causes nausea (third day), [21].
Eyelids heavy, in the evening, [1].
The hollow of each concha, and each external meatus were unusually moist from a viscid fluid wax (second day), [25b].

Almost uninterrupted heat of the whole body, with redness of the face and sweat of the head and body, accompanied by severe headache, like a heaviness, also palpitation of the heart and trembling of the whole body; after the heat, chilliness and coldness, with deadness of the hands, lasting four days, [1].
Heat in the feet, at night, [1].
Goneness, principally located in stomach (after two hours and a half, second and third days), [42].
Pass water much more often than is my habit (tenth day), [22].
Sensation of hunger, with the sensation as if the brain moved in waves (twenty-second day), [20].
Painful jerk from the throat to the pit of the stomach, in the morning, when sitting up in bed, [1].
Tearing in the upper part of the right side of forehead (after eight hours), [2].
Redness and violent burning on both cheek-bones, [1].
Appetite for only soft food, not for bread or meat, [1].
Free loose discharge from the bowels, after the cutting pain in the hypogastric region; previously the bowels had been regular (fifth day), [27].
Profuse sweat, with the eruption, [23].
The pain was relieved after eating, at 4.30 P.M. (second day), [35].
Stoppage of both nostrils, with frequent sneezing, [1].
Anxious trembling, with cold sweat on the forehead, [1].
Jerking in the lower jaw on falling asleep, [1].
Felt sleepy after eating, at 4.30 P.M., and went to sleep, sleeping until 7.30 P.M. (second day), [35].
Itching and stinging in the rectum, [1].
The urine deposits blood in the vessel, [1].
*Violent headache at night, which disturbed sleep; she had rest in no position, [3].
Tickling in the ear, [1].
In the afternoon, burning in the eyelids, with flow of tears (second day), [29a].
Movements of the scalp forwards and backwards, he must press the molars together, [1].
Vertigo, in the morning in bed, when rising, as if everything in the room were in motion, [1].
Distressing stopped sensation in both ears, for many days, [1].
Menses fourteen days too early (after a few hours), [1].
At noon, after walking much, I felt hungry without much appetite; without feeling satiated, the latter part of the meal was not relished (second day), [30].
Tearing in the malar bone, also at other times in the lower jaw, as if the parts would be torn out, [3].
Lungs felt slightly sore, but no cough and no expectoration, except now and then to clear the throat of a little phlegm (twelfth to twenty-third day), [38].
Twisting pain in right knee, and a kind of drawing pain on inside of same thigh, above the knee, [9].
Slight drawing behind the left ear (two hundred and sixty-third day); severe drawing (two hundred and sixty-fourth day), [45b].
Pressing stitching-tearing pain in the groin, extending into the thigh, when stepping out while walking (fourth day), [1].
Undulating pain in the upper part of the femur, [2].
Strong taste of Sulphur in the mouth (soon), [29].
Gnawing and weakness in the stomach, which ceased at supper (twentieth day), [20].
Hard and inflamed boil on right nates, [9].
*Vertigo, like reeling, while walking, [1].
She is either too cold, or becomes hot, which immediately results in sweat, [1].
During menses, drawing from the teeth into the cheek, which becomes swollen, [1].
Numbness of the fingers of right hand, evening, [1].
Herpes around the mouth, [1].
Stitching-scratching sore pain in pharynx, during empty deglutition, [1].

Asthmatic attack at night; he lay with the head bent forward, felt oppressed, had to take deep breath in order to get air, for one hour, followed by cough, with expectoration of tenacious saliva (after four days), [1].
Irresistible desire for sugar, [1].
Hawking up of phlegm, in the morning (after four days), [1].
Great burning and lachrymation of the eyes, [11].
Hard stool, fæces covered with slime, at 6 P.M., followed by slimy, bilious, or catarrhal stool, at 8 P.M., and again at 11 P.M. (second day), [23].
Cramplike pain in the stomach and abdomen, [1].
The hair of the head is painful on scratching, [1].
Severe constriction of sphincter ani (seventh day); so intense as utterly to prevent stool (eighth day), [44a].
Feeling of tension in the neck (third day), [36].
Tingling in the feet (after four days), [1].
*Headache as from a board in front of the head, [1].
Taste of manure in the mouth (after five days), [1].

Some yellowish leucorrhœal discharge, with the bearing down in pelvic organs, in the morning; slightly, bloody and increased in quantity, at 10 A.M.; more profuse, yellowish, creamy, or slightly bloody, at 9 P.M. (ninth day); (none in the morning); slightly yellow and somewhat bloody, offensive slightly, in the evening (tenth day); glairy, amber-colored, slightly offensive, occasionally bloody (eleventh day); sanguineous, in gushes, but not profuse (thirteenth day), [44a].
Footsweat, particularly at the toes, for two weeks, [1].
After drinking coffee, burning of the right cheek and auricle, with chilliness of the rest of the body (third day), [18].
Sense of smell more acute than usual (eighteenth day); increased acuteness (twenty-third day), [20].
Boring-digging headache in the forehead, commencing in the forenoon, lasting the whole day, from the slightest motion, [1].
Stitches in the head after a meal, [1].
Intolerable itching inside of the nose, which is sore on scratching (after two days), [28].
The slightest exercise, even writing, excites sweat, [1].
Tearing cramp pain extending from the hips to the foot coming on suddenly when walking, lasting eight or ten minutes, [1].
The left side of the tongue is covered with blisters (fourth day); much worse (fifth day), [21].
With every movement of the body, nausea, as if to vomit, and such weakness that he had to lie immediately on the ground; in the open air all the limbs felt relaxed, [1].

Menstruation regular, but scanty, and the flow dark (before the proving). Menses came on (second day); on stepping out of bed I was taken unwell, the blood running down to my feet; flowed freely all day (twentieth day); flowed all day and felt badly (twenty-first day), [22].
Dulness of the left side of occiput (after three hours), [2].
Stitching pressure in the left great toe, more during rest than when walking, [1].

On waking from nap, at 7.30 P.M., pain in the lumbar region, more on the left side; pain in the lumbar region all night of a dull aching character (second night); pain in back better this forenoon; pain in the lumbar region somewhat but not much better, in the evening (third day); pain in the back all day, more of a dull ache (fourth day); still some pain in the back (fifth day). Never had any form of backache before I took this medicine, [35].
Great exhaustion and indolence, [7a].

Tearing in the arms from the wrist to the shoulder, so that he could scarcely move the arm on account of pain; when letting it hang down it became blue and rigid; pains mostly at night, less during the day and when at rest, [1].
In the afternoon (when driving in his carriage), headache in the whole of the left side of the cerebrum (third day), [25e].
Feeling of prostration (after one hour, second and third days), [42].
*Vertigo on stooping, [1].
Tired pain in the small of the back, [1].
The water accumulates in his mouth in large quantities, like waterbrash, but passes off after eating, [1].
The back teeth become loose and seem too long, with simple pain on touch, and on eating, [1].
Short hacking cough, in the evening, after lying down, with expectoration of much pure coagulated blood, once every minute (after eight days), [4].
While combing his hair, in the morning, he observed a small, not red elevation, on the right parietal region, sensitive to the touch (thirteenth day), [39b].
When falling asleep startled by an oppressive ebullition of blood, [1].
If she eats a little too much, the next day she has a horribly sour, offensive taste, [1].
Eyes slightly adhering, in the morning, on awaking (fourteenth day), [45].
Slight swelling of the right parotid gland, in the evening (third day), [37].
During the menses, nosebleed, three successive evenings, [1].
Red, salt-sour water is exuded from a left lower hollow back tooth, [3].
Roaring in the ears, [1]; (in two hours), [25].
Pressure in the abdomen going off after stool, [1].
Drawing in the gums over the two upper front teeth, [2].
Bad sweetish taste in the mouth, [1].
Griping in the bowels, with sensation as if they would turn inside out, [1].
Stitches in one of the breasts, [1].
At 9.30 P.M., dull pain over both eyes; it seemed to be in the bone (ninth day), [35].
Extreme nervous restlessness, [8].
During the menses it grows black before the eyes, with weakness; she must lie down, which relieves her, [1].
Sourish nightsweat, five mornings (after seven days), [1].
Violent stitches in the region of the liver, in the evening, for eight minutes, painful also from touch, with constipation, [1].
No appetite for dinner (ninth day), [32].
Inflammation of the eyelids, with a stye thereon, [1].
Imperfect emission, with lascivious dreams, [2].
Lower extremities go to sleep while sitting, [1].
Sore pain and swelling of the gums; they recede from the teeth and bleed from the slightest touch, [1].
A transient slight attack of vertigo (after fifteen minutes), [18].
Painful heaviness in the upper incisors, [1].
Inclination to sigh (after two days), [28].
Burning and sticking in the right side of the occiput, [3].
Diarrhœa after partaking of boiled milk, [1].
When she cannot expectorate with the cough, her breath almost leaves her, [1].
The right foot goes to sleep (after two days), [1].
Many dull stitches in the anus in succession, [2].
*Lachrymation and burning, in the morning, [3].
Sudden transient deafness, as if from a plug in the ear, [1].
Painfulness of the whole back, when sitting bent over while writing, [5].
With the dull headache drooping of the eyelids; I feel as though I had not sense enough left to lift them (third day), [21].
One-sided deep pressive headache, with pressive pain in the molar teeth, [1].
Crawling in the feet, when standing, [1].
*Boring headache on the top beneath the vertex; the spot is also painful to touch externally, [1].
Nausea, with bitterness in throat, without vomiting, [1].
Sensation of a veil before the eyes, and dim vision for near and distant objects, [1].

Urine, average quantity, 28 ounces; average sp. gr. 1022, fortieth to twentieth day before the proving; average quantity 30 2/3 ounces; average sp. gr. 1022 (for five days before the proving); 20 ounces, sp. gr. 1027, on standing it grew cloudy and deposited a white sediment (first day); 23 ounces, sp. gr. 1022 (second day); 24 ounces, sp. gr. 1024, clear, no sediment (third day); 23 ounces, sp. gr. 1021 (fourth day); 24 ounces, sp. gr. 1024 (fifth day); 26 ounces, sp. gr. 1024 (after Sepia 30, sixth day); 19 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; on standing, a brickdust sediment, and vessel covered with white substance and looking like ground glass (seventh day); 19 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; bad odor; red deposit of a deeper color; smarting in the urethra while urinating (eighth day); 22 ounces, sp. gr. 1023; no sediment (ninth day); 24 ounces, sp. gr. 1022 (tenth day); 28 ounces; sp. gr. 1022 (eleventh day); 31 ounces, sp. gr. 1021; no sediment; looks healthy (twelfth day); at noon, passed urine which was clear; sp. gr. 1026; on standing four hours it deposited a brickdust sediment, and the walls of the glass were coated white; at 9 P.M., urine showed sp. gr. 1034, and was flocky when voided, and on standing two hours there was a dark brickdust deposit, and the sides of the vessel were thickly coated with a white substance (thirteenth day), [45].
Yawning and stretching, in the morning, in bed, [1].
A sharp piercing pain in the lower lobe of the right lung, coming on in paroxysms, and so severe as to almost make me cry out (third day), [42].
*Great dulness and confusion, [1].
Slight tearing between the left knee and calf, [2].
Cough, from tickling in trachea, toward morning, without expectoration, [1].

During the day, increased frequency of micturition (first day); fulness in the bladder, urging continually to micturition (fifth day); micturition almost every hour during the day (ninth day); micturition more frequent than yesterday, not painful, but with a constant uneasiness, as of great fulness in the bladder (twenty-first day); nearly every hour in the afternoon (twenty-second day); increased frequency of micturition (twenty-ninth day). Urine during the proving, amber-colored; slightly turbid; sp. gr. 1030; strongly acid; bile pigment; marked proof of bile acid, in large quantity. Normal urine; amber-colored; slightly turbid; sp. gr. 1028; no sugar; no albumen; no bile pigment; slight trace of bile acid, [20].
Complexion showed a remarkable change; it had a dirty earthy appearance (sixth day), [29a].
*In the morning, aching pain in the forehead (fourteenth day); slight aching in the forehead (twenty-fourth and following days), [22].
Cutting pain in the throat, with raw feeling, and accompanied by the accumulation of much phlegm, [9].
No appetite for supper (third day); little appetite for breakfast; loathed his dinner (fourth day); more appetite, at noon (sixth day), [45c].
Tensive pain in the calf (after fourteen days), [1].
Tenesmus in the rectum, with dull pain in the lumbar region (after fourteen hours, second day), [21].
Stiffness of the nape of the neck, [1].
Whizzing and beating in the ears, [1].
Pressing pain on the chest, aggravated by certain motions, [1].
Soft painless swelling on the patella; when kneeling the knee is unyielding and tense; the swelling feels numb, [1].
Have had a sense of nausea all the morning, with no desire for food; think I will not dine to-day (sixth day), [37].
Distressing dry coryza, causing obscuration of the head, especially after eating, [1].
Dull feeling in the head with the pelvic distress (sixteenth day), [20].
Much eye-gum on the ciliæ, in the morning, after waking (ninth day), [44d].
Dull aching frontal headache (left side), (fifth day), [36].
Tongue thickly furred with a dirty-yellow coating (fourteenth day); thickly furred tongue, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); in the forenoon, tongue furred (thirty-first day), [29].
Violent beating in the head and sensation as if the head were in motion, in the evening in bed, [1].

Stitching beating in the roots of several teeth, with burning in the gums, renewed when entering the room after walking in the cold air, also after eating and biting, particularly when anything arm touched them; this condition lasted for eight days, after which the tooth began to turn black and decay, [1].
Dryness of the throat the whole day, [1].
In the morning on awaking, clammy taste (third day); in the morning after awaking, taste clammy and insipid (fourth and fifth days), [29a].
Wrenching pain in all the molars, [9].
After a meal, pressure as from flatulence deep in the abdomen, to the right; later, in the side it is felt, only when moving the part and bending forwards, [2].
Prickling in soles of feet and pain in the corns, [1].
Swelling of the feet, they burn and are very dry, [11].
Headache worse in the open air, better in the house, [3].
*Heaviness in the head (fifteenth and seventeenth days), [34a].
At noon, when sitting, some vertigo (twenty-sixth day), [45b].
Frequent hard distension of the abdomen, with cutting in the bowels, [1].
Frequent sneezing, [1].
Very bad odor from the mouth, in the morning, and also afterwards, [1].
Dizziness, with sticking in the head
The skin of the whole body is painfully sensitive to the slightest knock, [1].

In the afternoon, in addition to a frequent alternation of the already-described pains in the head and joints, there occurred a violent cramplike tensive pain close to the right mastoid process (when at rest), which seemed to pierce into the deepest parts of the bone; it lasted for a few seconds, and then made way for a shooting pain in the right temple (second day), [25f].
Reappearance of menses which had been suppressed for four months (after eighteen days), [1].
Burning-aching pain in occiput, which feels as if its seat were beneath the bone; it lasted till the afternoon, and then gradually went off (after one hour, eighth day), [22a].
Stitches as with a knife in the right eye, [1].
Great lachrymation and coryza, [56].
Pressing in the pit of stomach (after thirty hours), [1].
Ringing in the ears, and roaring, as from a wind, especially after lying down, [1].
Single stitches, at times through the head, [1].
Aching in the legs and ankles (first day), [22].

Violent boring pain in a hollow tooth, always occurred in the evening and tormented him until late at night (fourth, fifth, and sixth days), [35]. [As he had no more toothache during the whole time of the proving, he was disposed to attribute it rather to wet weather, then prevailing, than to the Sulphur.]
Feel weak (fourth day), [37].
Severe itching in the nape of the neck, [1].
Chilliness, with thirst, towards evening, followed by nightsweat, [1].
Violent pressure from without inwards below and in front of the right and left ear, [2].
Acrid water ran out of the eyes (third day), [25g].
Accumulation of saliva in the mouth, when beginning to eat, [1].
Fetid odor of the (generally sweaty) feet, [1].

It seems to me that I have taken cold by the sensation, although I have not exposed myself; head troubles me very much; the anterior and posterior nares and the pharynx seem as though they had been skinned; these feelings are mostly confined to the right side; head feels dull and heavy, and there is a thick yellow mucous discharge from the right side, and on putting the finger into the nose, it becomes bloody; the sensation is the same that I once had after snuffing persulphate of iron into the nose, a kind of excoriated sensation (third day), [37].
In two hours, dull aching in the whole right half of the brain (first day), [25f].
Lachrymation, in the open air, [1].
The femora are painful when sitting, she must change her seat frequently (after ten days), [1].
Many black pores in the face, [1].

At night, in bed, there occurred deep in the right side of the forehead, in a circumscribed spot the size of a crown piece, a slight digging-shooting pain, which lasted a few minutes (first day), [25g].
Coryza, which he formerly never had; he snuffles continually, [1].

Swelling of the whole body, face, abdomen, legs, and the arms down to the wrist-joint, without thirst, but with great shortness of breath, lasting three weeks, fever every two or three days, chills and heat alternating, coming on at irregular hours, even at night, the heat accompanied with sweat all over (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Falls asleep late on account of wakefulness, [1].

Attack of nausea, in the forenoon, after taking a walk, black before the eyes, had no appetite; heat before dinner, with pain in all the limbs; the nausea continued, he had headache, and in company, weakness, even to fainting; every trifle affected him and he was easily startled, [1].
Beating in the side of the head on which she lies, [1].
Felt warm all over; perspiration on chest and neck, at 4 A.M. (first night), [23].
Before the menses, burning in the pudendum, [1].
Intense headache, in the morning on waking and after getting up, [1].
Rawness in the chest, as of raw flesh, [1].
Very disagreeable and acrid bitter taste in the mouth, after breakfast (fifty-sixth day), [45a].
On waking from sleep before midnight, pressure in the left frontal protuberance (ninth day), [21].
Sensation as if the nape of the neck were swollen, [1].

Following the perspiration, headache in the right side of the head and face, not severe, but with a surging sensation in the forehead, like waves of pain rolling up and beating against the frontal bone (after forty minutes); pain in head more severe; still on the right side (after one hour and a half); somewhat abated after eating dinner (after two hours); increased again in ten minutes; severe pain in the head, extending somewhat to the left side of the forehead, with the flush (after two hours and three-quarters; less severe (after four hours); slight increase (after five hours); pressive headache, all the time, in the evening, most in the frontal region, lasting till midnight, but abating after going to bed (first day); headache returned, but not so severe as yesterday; pain in forehead quite violent (after three hours); violent pain in the head, mostly in the forehead and malar bones, with heat in the forehead (after five hours); headache relieved by rest and sleep for three hours, in the afternoon (after eleven hours, second day); some headache and pain in the face, but not marked, unless she thinks about it, then the pain is quite severe (after three hours); headache abated (after nine hours, third day); general dull headache all day, with pallor of face (fourth and fifth days); headache abating (sixth day), [44].
Itching in the ulcer, [1].
Tensive pain in the dorsum of left foot, making it impossible for her to walk on the pavement, [1].
At night feverish heat, with anxious fancies and fanciful dreams, with sweat of the head, [1].
It feels dull and heavy over the eyes and in the forehead (fifth day), [37].
Salt saliva, [1].
A back tooth is painful to touch, [1].
Frequent fine burning stitches in different parts of the skin of the left upper eyelid, as if from fine sparks (seventh day), [25].
Appetite for dinner unaltered, but afterwards unusual fulness and weariness, relieved by walking in the open air (second and third days), [22a].
Gnawing in the posterior molars, [1].
In the evening, watery colorless mucus from the nose, [33].
Tension in the skin of the face, as if beginning to swell (fourth day), [20].
Coryza and great lachrymation, [56].
Inclined to take a long breath (after three hours and a half, second day), [42].
Tearing in the hand, [1].
A leucorrhœa, from which she had suffered a very long time, left her completely while under the proving), [8].
Sore corroding pain on the upper part of the toes, [1].
Loss of appetite; nothing is relished, [1].
Stitches in the anus (after eight days), [1].
Pressive pain, as if on something sore, in left side of occiput, [1].
Aching on the eyelids (fifth day), [45c].
Cracking in the ear, or like the bursting of bubbles, [1].
Unsuccessful urging to stool, with load and pressure in the rectum (twentieth day); great urging to stool at same hour as yesterday (twenty-first day); in evening (twenty-second day), [20].
Passed a great deal of flatus all day, which did not relieve (second day); a great deal of flatus from vagina and rectum, without relief (third day), [21].
No appetite, nothing tastes good to her, [1].
Heaviness in the occiput, particularly in the morning, [1].
Eruption of pimples on the upper lid, [1].
In the morning after awaking, palate dry (fourth and fifth days), [29a].
Single jerks in the teeth, day and night, when a draft of wind gets into the mouth or ear, followed by a grumbling, causing restlessness, [1].
Very mawkish taste, sour taste after eating, [8].
Urine with much white sediment and fetid, [1].
Some stitches in the crown of the head, [1].
Pain in the nose, which was swollen and internally ulcerated, [1].

With the constipation and piles, severe pains across the lower part of the abdomen, extending down the inside of the thighs, both abdomen and thighs feeling sore to touch; at times unable to stand, for past ten days (fortieth day), [22].
A sharp shooting pain through the heart, like an electric shock, about noon (eleventh day), [58].
About 3 P.M., for an hour, remarkable dilatation of the pupils (thirty-second day), [27].

Dull pain in the root of the tongue, which increased towards evening and obstructed speech; it looked somewhat red and swollen (after two hours, sixth day); in the evening the pain in the tongue returned, and that more severely than yesterday (seventh day); in the evening the pain in the tongue again came on severely; he cannot describe the pain; the tongue feels much swollen, inflamed, and as if it were strongly pressed upon; on pressing the finger on the left side beneath the tongue backwards, he felt a very painful hard pimple of the size of a pea (eighth day); in the afternoon, violent pain occurred in the tongue; it was swollen, and the speech, in consequence difficult; the pain of the tongue lasted until late at night (tenth day); forced to leave off taking the Sulphur on account of the pain in the tongue; during this time the pain, swelling, and pimple disappeared (eleventh to sixteenth days); slight feeling of the pain of the tongue (eighteenth day); same pain in the tongue (twentieth day); the pain and swelling of the tongue increased so much that he could not be persuaded to continue the proving (twentieth to twenty-fourth days); in three days tongue again quite normal, [24].
Burning in the left ala nasi, lasting for several minutes, and frequently recurring, in the morning (second day), [18d].
Distension of the abdomen (after first hours), [1].
Eruption on the face, a red roughness of the skin, [1].

A peculiar wavelike sensation extending through the body; a wavelike motion down the arms and legs to near the extremities; then a sudden interruption of wave and an expansion, with sharp rheumatic pain, lasting but a minute and then subsiding (after four doses), [28].
Blisters in the mouth, with burning pain, [1].
Pulse 120, with rash, [10].

Aching in both temples after dinner (ninety-fifth day); at noon, aching in both temples. (one hundred and fifth day); slight drawing in the temples and occiput (one hundred and second day); slight aching in both temples, in the forenoon (one hundred and forty-third day); tenderness of the head on both temples (two hundred and forty-fifth day); severe aching pain in both temples, after reading in the evening (two hundred and fifty-fourth day), [45b].
Headache, as from incarceration of flatus, [1].
He cannot take a deep breath on account of a contracted feeling around the lower part of the chest, [1].
Burning from the stomach upwards, [2].
A couple of jerks in the right temple near the ear (fifty-fifth day), [45a].

Great distress in the stomach, it is sensitive to the pressure of the clothes, and there is an aching and throbbing, relieved by slight eructations; in the afternoon the distress is worse; it is sore and sensitive as a boil; even walking is painful from the jarring; this almost entirely ceases after supper; some flatulence in the evening (fifteenth day), [20].
Pressure in the upper lids, [1].
Severe cough, with little expectoration, but mostly with bitter vomiting, yet only evenings, when lying in bed, [1].
Bruised pain in the right malar bone, even at night, [3].
Noise like boiling water out at both ears, and frequent painful drawing in the right ear (first day), [25b].
Stitches in the parotid gland, which swelled and produced a tensive pain when moving the head, [1].
Putrid after taste from beer, [1].
Stitches in the left temple, [1].
Burning sensation in the margin of the left lower eyelid, towards the outer canthus, [2].
It is painful within the ear, when cleaning, [1].
Violent throbbing headache at night (after twenty days), [1].
Right eye much inflamed; great burning and lachrymation of the eyes, [11].
Itching on the crown of the head, with great falling out of the hair, [1].
Pale yellow urine without sediment by day or night, [2].
During the day, frequent cramplike tensive pain in the muscles of both mastoid processes (second day), [25d].
Dry coryza, with prickling headache in the forehead and eyes, constant irritation to cough, and much dry cough during sleep without waking, [1].
Obstruction of the nose and difficult breathing (after eleven days), [1].
Much salivation, in the evening, [1].
Swelling of the gum about an old stump, [1].
Symptoms still return, especially marked about 12 to 1 P.M., and 4 to 6 P.M. (forty-second day), [38].
Have always had a strong appetite, but while taking the medicine, had but little inclination to eat, [27].
Great protrusion of hæmorrhoids, when walking, [1].
Entire loss of appetite, but constant thirst, [1].
Burning in the mouth, with eruption, about it, [1].
Beaten bruised feeling of the lower limbs; every nerve therein was painful; also painful when touched; pain removed by dancing, [1].
Pressure in the throat, as if he were choked with something which would not go down, [1].
Pain as if bruised in right hip-joint, only when lying on that side, [1].
Accumulation of flatus in the abdomen, immediately after walking in the open air, [1].
Very offensive and sour-smelling, soft, pappy stool, evacuated very quickly, [1].
Drawing pain in the leg down to the heel, where it was a stinging pain, [1].
Icy-cold feet, afternoon and evening, when sitting, [1].
Drawing toothache if anything hot or cold is taken in the mouth, [1].
Alternate cold hands and feet (several days after ceasing to take the medicine), [29a].
Drawing through the forehead and temples very acute, as though a worm were crawling through it (first day), [1].
Pressive headache, at 10 A.M. (fifteenth day), [43].
Sensation of contraction of the chest, in the morning (after seven days), [1].
Protrusion of a humid painless hæmorrhoid from the anus after a natural stool, [1].
Lips cracked, [1].
She cannot sleep at night on account of incessant cough (after forty days), [1].

Severe cramps in the uterine region, at 7 A.M.; so severe I was obliged to leave college and go home, at 11 A.M.; menses made their appearance at 10 P.M., but the pain continued till morning (seventy-second day), [21].
Arthritic drawing in the knee and finger-joints, [1].
Shortness of breath when walking, [1].
The skin of the palm of the hand peels off, [1].
Drawing pressure near the spinal column, near the left scapula, at times drawing to the neck, [2].
Sweat over the whole body, in the morning, after awaking, [1].
Violent rising of heat to the head, every five minutes, [1].
Burning of the lids, that are inflamed and red and tense on motion, [1].
Occasional sharp shooting pain in the left lung, on expiration (eighteenth day), [20].
Pressing pain at the root of the nose, [1].

On the right anterior border of the tongue, a hard raised spot the size of a lentil; on moving the tongue, shooting pain in it (eighth day); the swelling and pains in the tongue were greatly diminished, and the following day were quite gone (ninth day), [26].
*Sensation of heaviness in the head, and dulness, as if he would fall forward, relieved while walking, but then a fine sticking in the head, [3].
At 8 A.M., pressive pain on both sides of the sagittal suture (sixth day), [25].
Noise and whistling in the abdomen, with distension, [3].
Tensive pain between the scapulæ, [1].
Dryness of the red of the lower lip, with scabs and tensive pain, [1].
Dry, scaly, rough upper lip and margins of the nose, with burning, [3].
Left side of throat and tongue and corner of mouth covered with vesicles (seventeenth day), [21].
Much oppression, particularly when walking, [1].
Headache, as from pressure, from within outward (after thirteen days), [1].
Thirst, [76].
Aching at back of right eye for half an hour (after some days), [16].
Painful thrust in the head when coughing, [1].
Much mucus in the throat, he must hawk much, [1].
At night in bed, drawing in the right upper row of teeth (third day), [25a].
Pains in tendons of right foot about the ankle, [1].
Cramp in the toes, recurring several days, [1].
Frequent cutting through all the teeth of the right row from a draft of cold air, [1].
Tired feeling all over, which lasted all day (first and third days), [42].
Sleep at night disturbed, with pain in small of back (after twelve days), [1].
Transient aching in left eyeball (fifth day), [36].
Pressive headache at vertex, [9].
Pain across the lower part of the bowels (twentieth day), [22].
Pinching in the throat, from larynx upwards, [1].
Congestion to the anus soon after dinner (after five and twelve days), [1].
Eruption on pubes increased (fourth day).
Burning of the eyes, with redness of the outer canthi and discharge of corrosive tears, [3].
Flow of water into the mouth (in half an hour, first and second days), [35b].
Itching on the outer side of the sole of left foot, [2].
Tension and contraction in the skin of the face, particularly the forehead, [1].
Stitching in the anus as from a stick, [29].
Pain in the small of the back (after five, and sixteen days), [1].
Redness of the white of the eye, in the morning on awaking, with burning, smarting, and pressure, [1].
Head symptoms much worse after sleeping, afternoon (twenty-ninth day), [20].
In the morning, dryness and tension of the skin of the lips (forty-eighth day), [29].
Pressure on the chest, from stooping and deep breathing, [1].
Salt sour taste in the mouth, while eating, [1].
Some dimness of sight (after some days), [6].
Daily griping in the abdomen, without diarrhœa; at the same time much flatus accumulates; relieved by eructations, [1].
Coated tongue, [1].
At 3 P.M., the pain in my right side is nearer to the sacrum; it is a dull heavy ache, a pulling sensation (fifth day), [37].
Paleness of the face, [1].
The mucus brought away on blowing the nose has streaks of blood in it (twenty-seventh day), [28c].
*Vertigo for eight minutes, while walking in the open air on an elevation; he could not step firmly, with obscuration of his senses (after four days), [1].
Tenesmus in the anus, with sensation of soreness, in attacks at intervals, [2].

Aching at the root of the nose (twenty-fifth day); at noon, very troublesome aching pain in the nasal bones (one hundred and twelfth day); during the day, severe aching in the nasal bones (one hundred and thirteenth day); at noon, very severe aching in the nasal bones, and creeping in both temples (one hundred and fourteenth day); during the day, a disagreeable feeling of aching and fulness in the nose, one of the nasal bones was thickened and swollen (one hundred and seventeenth day); in the morning, severe aching in the nasal bones, and dry feeling in the nose. The aching in the nasal bones went off in the forenoon, but recurred at noon in great intensity and went away again in an hour (one hundred and eighteenth day); at noon, severe aching in the nasal bones and dry feeling in the nose, though a drop or two of fluid occasionally escapes unobserved from the nostrils (one hundred and nineteenth day); occasional severe aching in the nasal bones, in the forenoon (one hundred and twentieth day); during breakfast, very violent aching in the nose; the pain extended into the frontal sinus, but did not last long (one hundred and twenty-second day); occasional aching pain in the nasal bones (one hundred and twenty-fourth day); frequent aching pain in the nasal bones, in the forenoon (one hundred and twenty-seventh day); dry feeling and aching in the superior nasal passages (one hundred and twenty-eighth day); towards noon, quite severe aching in the nasal passages (one hundred and thirtieth day); frequently recurring, but always transitory sensation of soreness in the nose (one hundred and thirty-second day); occasional aching in the nasal bones (one hundred and thirty-third day); in the nose, very tiresome aching and feeling of dryness (one hundred and thirty-third day); aching in the nose, at noon (one hundred and thirty-fourth day); occasional tiresome aching in the nose (one hundred and thirty-fifth day); during the day repeated aching at the root of the nose (one hundred and thirty-sixth day); towards noon, tiresome aching in the root of the nose (one hundred and thirty-eighth day); tiresome aching in the bones of the nose, at noon (two hundred and seventh day); aching pain in the root of the nose, in the evening (two hundred and thirty-sixth day); frequent aching pain in the root of the nose throughout the day (two hundred and thirty-seventh day); aching at the root of the nose (two hundred and thirty-eighth day); aching pain in the nose, at noon (two hundred and forty-eighth day); in the forenoon, very severe aching pain in the nose about its root, with dryness of the Schneiderian membrane (two hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
Feel sick all over (twelfth day), [21].
Boils on the thigh (after seventeen days), [1].
Waked at 3 A.M.; a rush of ideas prevented sleep for an hour, when I broke out in profuse sweat; followed by quiet sleep (twenty-seventh day), [20].
Pinching jerks in the head, in the morning when rising, [1].
Great weariness in bed, with early waking, yet cannot sleep again, [1].
The left jaw very little painful (two hundred and eighty-fourth day), [45b].
The chilliness is felt in evening only, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].

Intermittent fever, returning frequently during the day, at indefinite periods, first general heat, with sweat in the face, violent thirst, and bitterness of the mouth; then chill, with general coldness even in the face, with inclination to vomit, pressure in the forehead, extending into the temples; during the heat, vertigo, as if he would fall, [1].
Heaviness in the abdomen, [1].
Tearing pressure around the pit of the stomach, [2].
Smarting in the urethra, when urinating, [1].
Aversion to sour and sweet things, [1].
Sweat in the morning, after awaking, which continues very profuse the whole day, and makes him so weak by evening that he could not stand on his feet (after thirteen days), [1].
Sticking pain under the right false ribs, with the short, dry, evening cough, [1].
Sour taste and eructations, lasting several days (fifth day), [26a].

In bed every place appears too hard for his head, which, on account of this disagreeable feeling, he must keep moving hither and thither, without succeeding in finding a better position (twenty-ninth day), [18a].

Fine rash over her body, particularly about the bends of the elbows and knees; this was attended by prickling, tingling, and itching; while in a warm room it remained out, and she felt well; if she passed into a cold room, the eruption would disappear, and she would then have the most severe rheumatic pains in and about these joints (nineteenth day); it had extended over the arms to the axillæ, and over the lower extremities to the groins; when warmly dressed, and in a warm room, she felt well; when exposed to cold or severe weather, the eruption and the rheumatic condition returned (fifty-third day). When the eruption makes its appearance, it is attended with profuse sweat, which usually lasts two or three days, [23].
Pressure at the stomach, after a meal and from touch, [1].
Soreness in the abdomen, as if the menses would appear (after four days), [1].
Stool of whitish color (third day), [1].
Speaking caused fatigue, if continued for any time (twelfth to twenty-third day), [38].
Swollen dark-red gums, with painful throbbing, as if beginning to suppurate, so severe that it was scarcely endurable, [1].
He wakes at night with contraction and oppression of the chest; he had to breathe heavily and deeply for an hour, also on waking in the morning felt some contraction (after two days), [1].
Slight sensitiveness of the whole scalp (one hundred and ninth day), [45b].
Pressive pain, as if sprained, immediately under the left shoulder-joint, in the back, [2].
Occasional drawing in the teeth and limbs, especially the right thigh, in the morning (seventeenth day), [44f].
Near the outer canthus of the left eye an intensely red, excessively itching and burning spot on the skin; the left palpebral conjunctiva much reddened (twelfth day), [29a].
*Pressive pain in the forehead, mostly in the forenoon, [1].
The teeth pain as if too long, and there is a tingling in them, like a vibration, [1].
Drawing-stitching pain in the internal ear, from within outwards, [1].
Pain most in back, across hips (thirteenth day), [44a].
Pressure in the upper left chest, toward the axilla, mostly during a strong expiration; when touching the part, pains as if bruised, [2].
Tongue red and clean; the papillæ elevated; it feels as if burnt (twenty-second day), [20].
Painful swelling of the upper jaw above the gum (after three days), [1].
Much ebullition of blood in the whole body, at night, producing restless sleep, [1].
Aching pains in the left frontal region, in the evening (sixteenth day), [43].
Stitches in the penis, [1].
Small red pimple on the forehead, roughness of the forehead (first to sixth day), [1].
Crampy pain in the bones of the face, [1].
Difficult expulsion of soft thin shaped fæces, [1].
Very severe pressure in the chest, when not touched, [1].
Feeling as if the upper lip were swelled (first day), [45].
Hoarseness, she cannot sing high notes, [1].
Much itching of the scalp (after sixteen days), [1].
Profuse footsweat, but without odor and not causing soreness, [1].
Movement in the brain on shaking the head, [1].
Amative feeling quite dormant, [19].
Pressure in the stomach, in the evening, followed by headache, [1].
Sensation of a plug in the throat, [1].
Sensation of heat in the eyes, [1].
The menses, which had always been very regular, came on seven days too early (after twenty days), [1].
He gets very hot in the face, immediately, from talking, [1].
Colic before the natural stool (after four days), [1].
Eyelids heavy, with much frontal pain, [9].
Nausea in the morning, on waking, towards evening and at night, [2].
Agglutination of the eyelids, only in the evening, [1].
Head tired; I could hardly lift it from the pillow; could hardly do anything but wonder what is the matter with me (second day), [20].
Pressing sore pain in the lower cervical vertebræ, in the evening, while walking in the open air, [1].
Swelling of the axillary glands, [1].
In the evening, headache, with several momentary attacks of oppression (ninth day), [15].
Stool consisting of light-colored fæces, thin, looking almost like grits, [7a].
Distressing itching in the nose, which is still stuffed (eighteenth day), [34a].
Vertigo, on waking at night, [1].
He must rise at night and walk about for half an hour, [1].
Slight frontal headache off and on during the day (fourth day), [36].
Dull stitches in the whole head, lastly in the occiput, making him feel quite inactive, [1].
Feeling of roughness in the mouth and throat (forty-third and forty-fifth days), [22a].
Several fits of sneezing, in the morning after rising (fourth day); several violent sneezes in rapid succession, in the evening (tenth day), [45].
Headache all day; worse from 5 to 6 P.M. (fourth day), [38].
An inflamed pimple above the left eyebrow (one hundred and twenty-seventh day), [45b].
Tearing in the sole of right foot, close to the toes, [2].
The left side of the tongue and throat and left nostril covered with small vesicles (sixth day), [21].
Tingling in the ear, with deafness, so that the ears do not seem to be sensitive to sound, which seems to be only dimly appreciated by an internal sense, [1].
Jerking in the vagina upwards, in the morning, after awaking from a dream, [1].
Stitches in the parietal and occipital bones when coughing, [1].
Stitches from within outward in the forehead every day, from 11 A.M. till evening, [1].
Much pain in the swollen gums of decayed teeth with swelling of the cheek, [1].
Rather frequent desire to urinate, [19].
Bruised pain in the right upper arm, also during motion, [1].
Drawing pain seeming to be external on the forehead back to the occiput, in single drawings, [1].
Bruised pain and weakness in the hip-joint, worse when rising from a seat, so that she cannot walk without holding on to something; it became better from continued walking, [1].
Every night, on retiring, I have a pain across the lower part of the bowels; relieved by passing urine; felt it only when lying down (thirteenth to sixteenth night), [22].
Swelling of the inner mouth and gums, with burning in the mouth extending into the throat, [1].
Jerking of the limbs, at night, [1].
A cold sensation on right side of top of head for a short time, in the evening after sunset (seventh day), [15].

Having been constipated since the first day, I feel at 9.45 A.M. a sudden violent aching in the anus, relieved by fast walking, and ceasing entirely as soon as the fæces began to pass (never had anything like it before), (third day), [40a].
Jactitation of muscles of upper arm, [1].
Sore pain in the tibia, only during motion, [1].
Stitching-tensive pain in the hypochondria and pit of the stomach, during movement when stooping, [1].
Tension in the knee when walking in the open air, [1].
Stiffness in the back part of the neck (after two days), [28].
Expulsion of ascarides, [1].
*Pressive headache, especially in the forehead, going off in the course of the day (fourth day), [24].
Itching in the rectum and anus, [1].
Chilliness, at 6 P.M.; he must lie down, [1].
Bitter taste of all food, with very coated tongue, [1].
Stiffness in the lower part of the back, so that he can only with difficulty straighten himself, [1].

Average quantity of urine, 6 ounces five times in twenty-four hours; normal color; no sediment; sp. gr. 1020 (forty-first day before the proving); 1030 (fortieth, thirty-ninth, and thirty-eighth days); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1028 (thirty-seventh day); A.M., 1020; P.M., 1030 (thirty-sixth day); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1020 (thirty-fifth day); P.M., 1030 (thirty-fourth, thirty-third, and thirty-second days); P.M., 1028 (thirty-first day); A.M., 1022; P.M., 1029 (thirtieth day before the proving); sp. gr. 1030; dark red, less quantity, passed only three times (third day); A.M., sp. gr. 1030; P.M., 1030; three times, 6 ounces each times; a yellowish-red deposit adheres to vessel; urine brick-red in color (fourth day); A.M. and P.M., sp. gr. 1030; very scanty, deep red; no desire to urinate; pass but little at a time (fifth day); A.M., sp. gr. 1030; P.M., 1025; as on fifth day (sixth day); P.M., sp. gr. 1025; very scanty; red deposit on side of glass (seventh day); A.M., sp. gr. 1022; noon, 1030; urine very high-colored; it looks like powdered brick (eighth day); the urine remains dark red until the twenty-third day, [37].
Blows blood from the nose, [1].
Vision as through a veil (twentieth day), [34].
*Dulness of the head, after walking in the open air, [1].
Itching in the ear, immediately followed by itching heat in the outer ear, [1].
Rending pressure over the right hip from before backwards, [2].
Noises in the right ear, [3].
A long-continued pain under the right shoulder (fifth day), [38].
Vertigo, every afternoon from 3 to 5 o'clock, everything turns in a circle around her, when walking, sitting, and lying, [1].
Face pale during the perspiration (eleventh day), [23].
Beating in the left chest (after six days), [1].

Salivary secretion increased; for a long time he had every now and then traces of blood in the saliva (twelfth day); rush of water into the mouth (seventeenth day); in the evening, great flow of saliva mixed with blood (twenty-sixth day); great flow of saliva into the mouth; bloody streaks in the saliva (in one hour); increased secretion of saliva mixed with streaks of blood, in the afternoon (thirtieth day); in the forenoon, copious secretion of saliva mixed with streaks of blood (thirty-third day), [29].
Dreams frightful, of murder (sixteenth night), [20].
Headache so that the eyes seem to close, [1].
Appetite uncommonly good (fifteenth day), [43].
Bitter spoilt taste in the mouth, every morning, [1].

Anxious dreams at night, as if he were chased and had to run backwards; on awaking he imagined something was coming from above, which oppressed his chest, followed by crawling and stitches in the chest, [1].
Sore pain of the tongue (after seventeen days), [1].
Jerking in the nape of the neck, with shaking of the head, [1].
First a smarting, then a cutting, and at times also pressing sensation in the left side of throat, [2].
Beating toothache, which on the third day became stitching, with rapid decay of the teeth, [1].
When awaking, in the morning, overheated, [1].
Tickling burning in the right axilla, [2].
Pain and weight in the abdomen, on rising in morning (twelfth day); pain and tenderness in abdomen (thirteenth day), [44a].
Lachrymation in the open air, several days, [48].
*Headache over the eyes, every morning, as from stopped coryza; was constantly obliged to sneeze, [1].
For some days past there has been a humid eruption on the top of the head, like tinea capitis, small grainlike pustules filled with pus, and drying up into honeylike scabs (thirty-second day), [18a].
Weakness of sight, she sees things only sideways, [56].
Disagreeable cold feeling in the lower front teeth, [1].
Burning pressure in the spinal column (after thirteen days), [1].
Excoriated feeling about the anus (fourth day), [37].
Pressing sore pain in the shoulders, as if excoriated, [1].
Heavy sweat, as from a cold, [9].
Pressure and tension in the forehead and eyes, with burning, [1].
Constant accumulation of mucus in the throat, which almost suffocates her, [10].
Pressing pain on left forearm internally and externally at the bend of the elbow, [2].
