Violent pains in the left eye, as if it were rubbed against spiculæ of glass, and drawn in towards the pupil. He was obliged to close the eye five or six times involuntarily. This was followed by burning in the eye and flow of tears. The attack lasted about two minutes (fifth day), [17a].
Mouth sweetish, and foul all day, [1].

Urine clear, amber-colored, acid, free from sediment, film, or cloud, passed about every six or eight hours; average daily quantity (winter) about 45 ounces; sp. gr., A.M., 1029; P.M. (5 P.M.) 122 (before the proving); passed 48 ounces, sp. gr. in morning, as usual, 1029 (before taking any Sepia); at 5.45 P.M., it was 1022 (first day); 9 A.M., sp. gr. 1029; clear as usual; 9.30 P.M., sp. gr. 1029; quantity, 42 ounces in twenty-four hours (second day); 8 A.M., sp. gr. 1032; 6 P.M., 1030; amount, 45 ounces; this urine deposited after a few hours, a white filmy sediment on the sides of the glass, and on the rod left in it, not removable by water alone, nor by acetic acid; removable by caustic potassa, by ammonia, or by nitric acid; not otherwise examined (third day); urine smells badly, looks turbid; 8 A.M., sp. gr. 1031 (fourth day), [40].
Digestion excites heat and palpitation of the heart (after three days), [1].
Painful contraction and pressure in throat, [1].
Falls asleep late in the evening, [1].
Dry coryza (first days), [1].
Pressure in the pit of the stomach, passing off by a fermenting movement downwards (after three hours and a half), [2].
Burning heat in the eyes, [57].
Stomachache in the morning in bed, [1].
Burning in the anus, [1].
Distortion of the left pupil, [1].
Vomiting of milky water (during pregnancy), although she had not drank any milk, [1].

In the morning, after getting up, great itching on the occiput and nape (ninety-sixth day); great itching on the occiput, compelling him to scratch, in the morning (two hundred and seventy-fourth day), [45b].
*Reeling in the head
Pressure to pass water with the pain in ovaries (eighth and twelfth days), [22].
Nausea several mornings before breakfast, [1].
Right shoulder lame and stiff (twentieth day), [20].
Smarting of the lids; inclination to rub them; the eyes can hardly bear the light, in the evening (eleventh day), [15].
Drawing pain in a sound tooth, when the air got into the tooth, not when in the cold air, [1].
Palpitation of the heart, in the evening, for a quarter of an hour, [1].
Itching blisters and blotches on the face, hands, and feet, [1].
Pain running from one temple to the other like a pressing together (fourth day), [37].
The eyes are agglutinated, in the morning, the lids thick and red; afterwards dry mucus in the lashes, [1].
General languid feeling of the whole body (fifth day), [35].
Cough when going to sleep (fourth day), [1].
Great swelling of the face, without redness, [1].
Constant dryness and contracted sensation in the throat, [1].
Blister on the tongue and pain as if burned, [1].
*Dulness of the head, in the evening, [1]
My hip seems well so long as I keep still, but after moving the pulling commences (fifth day); pain not so severe (sixth day), [37].
Constant chilliness, day and night, with pinching pain in the abdomen for several days, [1].
Burning in eyes and feet (nineteenth day), [34a].
Dryness of the larynx, in the morning, [1].
Oppression of the chest, morning and evening, [1].
Red, almost sore, little indurations, going and coming, on the inner side of the prepuce and glans, tickling when touched, [1].
Eructation and hiccough, alternating, [1].
Hands generally cold, but moist with perspiration (fourth day), [20].
Sensation of coldness in the stomach, [7a].
Emissions weak and watery, [5].
Frequent awaking at night, on account of drawing pain, extending from the molar teeth to the forehead, [1].
Stitches in the left side of the hypogastrium, in the morning, [1].
Accumulation of much mucus in the larynx, which is difficult to cough up, but easy to swallow, even with deep inspiration (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Drawing-tensive pains in the right side of the lower jaw (seventeenth day), [29].
Inclination to vomit, anxiety, and vertigo, [1].
*Headache in the vertex as from pressure on the top of the brain (ninth day), [1].
Severe pressure in forehead over right eye, [11].
Teeth very much on edge, for seven days, [1].
Toothache in the open air, [1].
Cramplike pains in the calves, and shooting pains in the ankles, [14].
Milk causes much distress; it is vomited curdled, [1].
Scraping sensation in the anus during stool, [1].
A little acrid fluid comes from the nose (fifth day); increased discharge of thin fluid, about noon (eighth day); profuse discharge of fluid from the nose, in the evening (eighteenth day), [45].
In the morning, on awaking, tension of the skin surrounding the mouth (third day); dryness and tension of the outer skin round about the lips, and branlike desquamation of it (tenth day), [29a].
Painful ulcer on internal surface of lower lip; pain ameliorated by cold water, [1].
*Pressure in the head from one temple to the other, in the morning after rising, [1].
Inflammation in the nose (after nine days), [1].
Stitches in the heels and corns, during the day, [1].
Bitter eructations, with nausea, [1].
Pressing pain on the lower left ribs, even from touch, [2].
A small painful spot, covered with papulæ, on the right temple (two hundred and seventy-fifth day), [45b].
Both eyes inflamed, [56].
So weak that she thought she would faint (after seven days), [1].
Great weakness, at 7 P.M., [1].
He awakes in the morning with great dyspnœa, and covered with sweat, lasting four hours, [1].
Face red during the heat, [16].
Itching in the nose, [1].
Excessive hunger and appetite, [2].
Cracking in the knee-joints, [1].
About 3 P.M., feeling of fine sand between the right eye and lid (second day), [36c].
The gum bleeds on spitting, [1].
In the morning, after getting up, aching and heavy feeling in the occiput, extending into the nape; headache went off in the course of the day (forty-seventh day), [45b].
Tearing in the first phalanx of right thumb, [2].
A very violent catarrh came on, which lasted an unusually long time, viz., one month (fourth day), [28b].
Itching on the upper part of the sternum, [1].
Pain in the lumbar region (seventh day), [20].
Frequent stitches in the sole of right foot (after one day), [5].
Hungry feeling in the stomach, very soon after meals (two hours), (third day), [40a].
Moist scalp, [1].
Tongue coated brown with red edges (sixth day); yellow in the middle and at the posterior part; tip and edges red (seventh day), [37].

Menses began to flow one week too soon (sixth day); dark, scant, and fetid (seventh day); menses began to flow; dark clotted blood (thirty-eighth day); very scant all day (thirty-ninth and fortieth days); very scant and membranous, and very painful (forty-first day); better, but not entirely relieved (forty-second day); menses made their appearance, with pain (seventy-second day); very scanty and pale, and very acrid, no pain (seventy-fourth day), [21].
Before the stool the beginning of a flatulent colic, accompanied with groaning and sobbing, [1].
Pain in the ears, in the evening, like otalgia (after sixteen days), [1].
Grumbling in the abdomen, with eructations (after two days), [1].
Bleeding of the hæmorrhoids, when walking, [1].
Two days before the menses shuddering again and again over the whole body the entire day, [1].
Constant dull drawing pain in the back part of the neck (right side); worse on bending the head to the opposite side (third day), [35].
On moving, at 6 A.M., pain in abdomen, with sudden urging to stool (eighteenth day), [20].

Sensation of fulness in the left axillary gland, in a few minutes leaving the left and appearing in the right axilla (after one hour and a half); the sense of fulness returned about from 1 to 2 P.M., first in the left, then in the right axilla, then to the groin, during lecture; in the evening an occasional soreness in the axilla (fourth day); axillary glands still somewhat sore (twelfth and thirteenth days), [30].
Aching boring pains in the ears, especially the right ear and the temples (seventeenth day), [29].
Pain in the vertex, like a tingling, and pain beneath the right ribs from the (short) cough, [1].
Inclination to vomit, when washing the mouth, in the morning, [1].
Great sensitiveness of the tips of the left upper teeth, worse from cold water, with shooting pains, even in the morning, [3].
Aching pain in the forehead, [8].
I am not drowsy this time, as I usually am, during the menses), (eighteenth day), [20].

Pressure in the uterus, causing oppression of breathing; the pressure downward is as if everything would fall out, accompanied with pains in the abdomen; she must cross her limbs in order to prevent the protrusion of the vagina, yet nothing protruded, but there was an increase of gelatinous leucorrhœa (after ten and twenty hours), [1].
Painful confusion of the head, particularly of the forehead, [5].

Pressure and heavy weight in the ovaries, and a pressure to pass water (after one hour, eighth day); (I usually pass water twice a day, night and morning); increased pain in the ovaries, dull and heavy (after second dose, eighth day), [22].
Fluent coryza and on blowing the nose, also bloody mucus, [1].
Stitching in the heels, only at night (after forty-one days), [1].
Lascivious dreams disturb the sleep (fourteenth night), [1].
The teeth seem too long, [1].
Emptiness of stomach, with nausea, as soon as she thinks of food, which she would like to take, [1].
Pain in the head once every minute, a stitching pain in the head coming up the back at every step, [1].
Contraction in the region of the stomach, [1].
Flushes then chills, [9].
Chilly sensation, with nausea, at 11 A.M. (thirty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day), [21].
Severe cramp in the calves, at night in bed, when stretching out the legs, and days afterward constant tension of calves as if too short, [1].
*Pressive pain in frontal region (tenth day), [24].
Puffiness beneath the eyes (twentieth and twenty-third days), [20].
Pressure in the eyebrows and balls, [1].
Smarting in the forepart in the orifice of the urethra (after thirteen hours), [2].
Suffused look of the eyes, in the morning when awaking, with smarting in the canthi, [2].
So exhausted from a half hours walk, that he became sick at the stomach and could not breathe; the air-passage seemed drawn together as far down as the pit of the stomach, [1].
*A spot on the vertex is painful to touch, [1].
Fulness in the bladder, as if it would fall over the os pubis (twenty-ninth day), [20].
Pimply eruption in the centre of the vermilion border of the upper lip (fourth day), [1].
Taste insipid and bitter, and yet good appetite for dinner (forty-third day), [22a].
Stitching-pressive headache continuous in the lower part of the forehead, just over the eye, worse from motion in the house, much better when walking in the open air, [1].
Toothache and inflammatory swelling of the gum, in the vicinity of a stump almost entirely destroyed (twenty-fourth day), [34].
Supper relieved all the symptoms except dryness of the throat; sick all day until supper (twenty-fourth day), [20].
Tearing in the right half of the face, [1].
Falling out of the hair, [1]; (twelfth day), [34].
Dry cough, with vomiting of bitter fluid, even in bed, [1].
Nausea and weakness, [1].
Repeated shooting pains in the heel (ninth day), [38].
Tearing, drawing, and stitching from the forehead and the occiput, toward the vertex, [1].
Bad odor from the mouth, after dinner, [1].
Eructation of wind alone after supper, [1].
Stitches in the right side, when walking in the open air, [1].
Tensive pain in one side of the neck, as if it were swollen, [1].
Biting, as from blisters, on the tongue, [1].
A very painful fissure in the middle of the upper lip, which lasted several days (third day), [18].
Shooting pain in the right temple (second day), [25f].

Since commencing my proving of Sulphur I have observed a considerable weakness of vision, and very often a feeling of heaviness and aching in the eyeballs. When reading or writing I often feel as if a mist were before the eyes. I must then cover the eyes with the hand, slightly press and rub them, in order to read. Moreover, I must hold the book I am reading a considerable distance from the eyes, for when I hold it close I cannot distinguish the letters. I had previously noticed a slight diminution of my visual powers, but since the proving of Sulphur, the feeling of weight and aching in the eyes, and the weakness of sight rapidly increased, and to a great extent, [29].
Pain in the gall-bladder, [7a].
Externally perceptible gurgling in the left side of lower abdomen, over the hip, [1].
Severe itching in the right ear, with moisture in it, at night, [1].
Tearing in the whole thigh, particularly in the knees, after dinner and supper, [1].
Longing for sugar water, [1].
Boring pressing in the teeth and on the head externally for only a few minutes after eating, [1].
Soreness and pain in the back, in sacral region (first and second days), [44a].
Catamenia appeared the second time after an interval of only eighteen days, instead of the customary twenty-six days, [20].
Great weakness of the arms; they go to sleep when at rest, [1].
Sticking toothache, she could have cried, [1].
Pale face, [7a]; (after twenty-four hours), [1]; (second, fourth, and fifth days), [44].
Frightful dream; she screams aloud at night, [1].

At noon but little appetite; he ate more from habit than from necessity (third day); at noon little appetite, and no desire to drink water while eating, which he was always in the habit of doing (sixth day); at noon no appetite (ninth day), [29a].
At noon had a dull pain over the forehead, extending from each temple (after two hours, nineteenth day), [22].
Cramp in the thigh, when walking, [1].
Very weak and short-breathed, as in continued fever, [1].
Jerking of the eyelids, [1].
Pricking in the skin, in the evening after he gets warm in bed, [1].
Teeth on edge, and painful only when bitten upon; cannot chew black bread on account of pain (after five days), [1].
Much straining in passing, even the fæces which are not at all hard, [1].
Prickling in the tip of the little finger (after three days), [1].
Stitches in and above the forehead, [1].
Sudden stitches in the pit of the stomach, when swallowing the food very quickly, [1].
Pain, as if sprained, in the small of the back, over the hips, in the evening in bed and afternoons (after twelve days), [1].
Stitches through the bladder, a little while before urinating (sixth day), [21].
*At night, in bed, rush of blood to the head, with heat and confusion of it (first day), [25b].
Visible but painless jerking in one buttock and corresponding thigh (after eight days), [1].
*Pressure in the forehead, mostly in the afternoon, during the menses, [1].
Hoarseness, and therewith weak and chilly (after a few hours), [1].
A strange feeling in my head, as if just on the point of falling asleep (second day), [20].
A tender spot in the left nostril (sixth day), [45c].
Nose cold and pinched (fourth day), [21].
Aversion to meat; it makes her qualmish, [1].
Frequent painful contractions in the anus, [1].
Wine-red spots on the neck and under the chin, without sensation, [5].
Frequent expectoration of mucus from the fauces, [1].
In the afternoon, burning heat in the throat, with a fulness and pressure in the head (second day); increased (third day); continued four or five days, [32].
Pressure in the right hip-joint close to the body, coming on gradually, getting to its height, and then gradually going off, [2].
Menses two days too early, [1].
Slow stitches in the left groin, from below upwards, during stool, [1].
Vertigo, when moving the arms, [1].
Fearful attacks of toothache; all the top row feel as if being drawn, [58].

About 2 A.M. he awoke with violent pains in the inflamed gum; they were burning and tearing, and spread all over the head; at the same time a sensation as if the left cheek were swollen, which is not the case; after two hours he became again quiet and fell asleep; gum very painful, in the evening (one hundred and second day); in the morning the gum is still rather tender, but the swelling considerably diminished (one hundred and fourth day); gum more painful (one hundred and fifth day), [45a].
Violent shaking chill for one hour, then great heat, with inability to collect one's senses; then profuse sweat in the evening; the urine brown and of acrid smell (first day), [1].

Sticking headache at various times, at times continuing at night with tearing in the lower jaw, or followed by bruised pain in the side of the head, mostly for a short time, relieved by compression of the head, at times obliging to lie down, [3].
Painful nodes on the forehead, [1].
Eruption, large and scurfy, in the vermilion border of both lips (after a journey in the cold), [1].

All day long an almost constant desire to blow the nose, though no mucus was present in its front part. The mucus remains sticking in the nasal passage; it is uncommonly viscid, and it is only after great exertion, in the way of blowing, that it comes away in the form of long narrow pieces, which interrupt the free passage of air through the nostrils (twenty-seventh day), [21].
Stitches in the perinæum, pressing towards the rectum, while sitting in the evening, [1].
Drawing in the right upper jaw and in the left thumb (fourth day), [44e].
Purulent mucus in the eyes (after three days), [1].
Dryness of the tongue, which, after a quarter of an hour, gave place to a slimy taste in the mouth (fourth day), [25f].
Eruption on the head, back, and shoulder; it itched badly during the evening and all night (fifth and sixth days), [22].
Pressure in the left ankle-joint, as if the boot were too tight, [1].
Drawing between the scapulæ and in the upper part of the chest (after twenty-three days), [1].

Itching of the inner canthi, in the morning after awaking; after rubbing, there set in smarting and much lachrymation, and then sore feeling in the outer canthi, which were also somewhat agglutinated, [2].
Frequent sneezing, and the sensation as if a cold were coming on, and frequent blowing from the nose of mucus mixed with blood (almost every morning), (first fifteen days), [28d].
In the morning, itching and smarting in both eyelids (fifth day), [36c].
Pressing pain in throat, in upper right side, [2].
Loud rumbling in the abdomen, [1].
Roaring in the ears, for several days, [1].
4 P.M., I have a singular sensation about the pelvic region, a sort of weakness about the small of the back, pubic bones, and around the anus a dragging pain (third day), [37].
Dryness of the eyes, [1], [3].
*Rush of blood to the head, like a slight pressure over the head, [1].
Cluckling noise in the ears, when rising from stooping, [1].
At 7.15 P.M., several shoots in the second last healthy molar tooth on the right side (second day), [38d].
Pain in the roots of the hair, especially when touched, [1].
Copious sweat of the male genitals (after three days), [1].
Bitter-tasting mucus in the mouth, worse in the morning, [1].
Mouth dry, insipid and sticky, in the morning, [3].
Backache only when walking, arresting the breathing, [1].
Desire for but unable to pass a stool; intense constriction of the sphincter ani (after three hours, fourth day), [44a].

Occasional aching in the root of the nose, between the shoulders and all over the back (fifth day); some aching in the nasal bones, towards noon; recurrence of the aching after dinner (sixth day); aching in the nasal bones (eleventh day), [45c].
At night, when going to sleep, lightning-like flashes before the eyes (eighth day), [38b].
Pimple near the nose resembling a blood blister, [1].

At noon I notice soreness in location of a former congestion of liver (nineteenth day); the sore spot is felt on turning or reaching (twentieth day), and on moving suddenly (twenty-first and twenty-second days), [20].
With the earache after midnight, a cold sensation all over the head, relieved by warmth and sleep (nineteenth night); sensation of coldness on the head, especially at night (twentieth day), [20].
Aching in the sacrum, in the evening, relieved by pressure (eighteenth day), [20].

Sore pain in the whole nose, especially in its septum, the slightest touch increased the pain, in the evening (second day); sore feeling in the nose, in the morning after rising; at noon pain very severe and an acrid fluid flowed from the right nostril (fourth day); the nose, especially its left outer edge, is very sensitive to touch (seventh day); in the morning after waking, very tensive sore pain in the nose, especially at its point; feeling as if the nose was swollen; its internal aspect is covered with small scabs (eighth day); the edges and septum of the nose rather sensitive (tenth day); sensitiveness of the septum of the nose (eleventh day); sensitiveness and dryness of the nose, at noon (thirteenth day), [45].
Icy coldness in the stomach, with rumbling, [7a].
Burning smarting of the lower lip, [3].
Much yawning noon and afternoon, after taking a walk, [1].
Protrusion of the rectum (after several hours), [1].
A kind of cramp in the nose, [1].
*Stitches in the head and out at the eyes, [1].
Fine pricking pains in pit of stomach, [1].
Painful distension of the abdomen, while riding in a carriage, [1].
On blowing my nose, I notice blood mixed with mucus (eighth day), [37].
Violent continued cutting, soon also stitching in the urethra, [1].
Rumbling, with distension of the abdomen, [7a].
Fluent coryza, the mucus must be drawn through the posterior nares, [1].
A feeling as of sand in the eyes, [56].
Sensitiveness and burning in the eyes, for several days, [48].
Disagreeable odor of the sweat, almost like elder blossoms, [1].
Menses eight days too early, too scanty, appearing only in the morning, [1].
Soreness and redness of the labiæ, in the perinæum and between the thighs, [1].
Occasional sharp stitches in the upper incisors (twenty-sixth day), [38].
Severe dry coryza (after four and six days), [1].
After emission, burning in the forepart of the urethra, [1].
Spasmodic drawing in the jaws, [1].
Frequent stitches pass under the hypochondria transversely through the epigastrium, so severe that she could cry out, [1].
A dizzy condition of the head prevented sharp and clear thought
He cannot tolerate meat or fish, in the evening; it causes pressure in the stomach, draws the abdomen upward, and delays the stool, [1].
The limbs from the knees downward ache badly during the afternoon (third day), [22].
Stitches in left hypochondrium, [11].
Paralytic sensation in the arm, then throbbing in it, [1].
Laziness after a meal, [1].
Nose obstructed at night, especially right nostril (twentieth day), [20].
Soon after dinner, great flow of saliva into the mouth, and sudden softly digging pain in the right parotid gland (fifth day), [25a].
Colic, in the morning, quite low down in the pelvis, pressing outward, twisting and contractive, [3].
Blood-red urine, [1].
The epidermis peels off in large and small, mostly roundish spots, particularly on the hands and fingers, without pain (after a few days), [1].

While walking in the cold wind I experienced dull pain through both ears, at 4.30 P.M.; the pain seemed to come from within outward (the first time I ever had earache), (third day); walking in the wind caused the ears to ache; the pain is dull and dragging, passing forward into the parotid gland and backward into the mastoid process of the temporal bone; relieved by the warmth of the room; at 5 P.M. (fourth day); earache from being in the open air; relieved when entering a warm room; at 5 P.M. (seventh and ninth days), [21].
Very painful inflamed swelling of the nose, [1].
Hard difficult stool, also mingled with mucus, [1].
Painful tickling under the right thumb nail, [2].
Pressive weight in the head, in the temples above the forehead, as if the head were too full of blood, as during a severe chill, [1].

Slight adhesion and burning of the eyes, in the morning (eleventh day); burning in the eyes at noon (thirteenth day); burning of the eyes and lids, in the forenoon (fourteenth day); occasional slight burning in the eyes (seventeenth day), [45].
Nightsweat from above downwards, to the middle of the calves, [1].
Great dryness of the tongue in the morning when awaking, as if burned, [1].
Aching in the muscles of the abdomen and limbs, on waking (for ten weeks), [24].
Headache almost all night, and when I got up this morning, lasting until noon (tenth day), [22].
A slight burning feeling in the eyes, and a desire to close them; they feel sore to the touch (nineteenth day), [22].
Disagreeable taste in the mouth, in the morning (immediately, second day), [40].

Nightly headache; an intolerable, constantly increasing pressure in the lower portion of the occiput and in the vertex, with pressure on the eyes, which he must close, and with chilliness, not relieved by any covering, with profuse offensive perspiration, during which he must walk up and down the room (after five days), [1].
Hiccough after supper, [1].
Burning of the eyes, in the morning, with weakness of the eyes, [1].
Bitterish sour taste in the mouth (after five days), [1].

Violent stupefying headache and shooting in the left side of the chest, lasting more than a quarter of an hour (thirty-second day); during the day, dull headache (thirty-seventh day); in the afternoon, stupefying headache (thirty-eighth day), [33].
Frequent cracking in the ears, as if a string broke in them, [1].
Pressure in the right nasal bone, in the evening, [1].
Foul taste in the mouth, in the morning, [1].
Less appetite than usual, at noon (seventy-third day), [45b].

Abdomen very much distended after the least bit of food; felt some relief from loosening the clothes, but the distension soon returned, causing more distress than before, as it seemed to give the abdomen more room to expand (third day). Abdomen tympanitic, at 4 P.M. (fifth day). At 10 P.M., abdomen very much distended; since dinner, at 6 P.M. (seventh day). Bloated abdomen after eating the least bit of food; discharge of flatus does not relieve it (fourteenth to sixteenth day), [21].
Offensive sweetness in the mouth, causing nausea, the whole forenoon, [1].
Stitches in the gums, [1].
Swollen inflamed nose, nostrils sore and ulcerated, [1].
General prostration and weariness in the joints, especially in the knees (fourth day), [36].
A kind of occipital vertigo, [55].
Red swelling of the cheeks, without pain, [1].
Itching of the scalp, in the morning (eighth day), [45c].

Attacks of vertigo when walking in the open air, lasting from 2 to 3 minutes; it was as if something were rolling about in the head, and made her reel; followed in the evening by headache and humming in the ears, [1].
Profuse sweat on waking, at 5.30 A.M.; afterwards, on walking, even against cold winds (twenty-fifth day), [20].
She could not lie quiet at night, on account of great restlessness in the whole body; she had to turn continually from side to side, and dared not close the eyes, as it then became worse, [1].
Averse to motion, with desire to stretch, and very sleepy, on waking at 6 A.M.; dulness all day and aversion to motion (twenty-second day), [20].
He suddenly becomes averse to all sweets and to milk, [1].
Taste of blood in the mouth, in the morning after waking (sixth day), [44d].
*Redness of the eyes during the day; violent itching in them in the evening, [1].
Violent cutting in the anus and rectum at night, [1].
Bleeding of the gums, almost without cause, [1].
Profuse perspiration on walking, especially in the bends of the joints (twenty-third day), [20].
Slight aching at the neck of the bladder just after urinating (third day), [40a].
Looks ill (twelfth day), [34]; (sixth day), [45c].
Violent feverish headache in the crown, occurring several mornings and lasting several hours, [1].

Heaviness and confusion of the sinciput (after twenty minutes, twelfth day); heaviness, confusion, and dulness of the sinciput, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); frequent awaking, with feeling of weight and dulness in the sinciput (thirtieth night); dulness and confusion of the sinciput (nine one hour, fiftieth and fifty-first days), [29].
Heat in the mouth, and much thirst, at night, [1].
*Pressure externally on the vertex, extending to the forehead, [1].

Pustules on the conjunctiva of the left eye; no pain, but I noticed a mist gathering before my eyes, and in this mist seemed to float black objects looking like tadpoles, with their heads pointing to the centre and their tails radiating, at 7 A.M.; much better, at 11 A.M.; much worse than this morning; the mist causes nausea, at 2 P.M. (fifty-eighth day). Same as yesterday morning, at 7 A.M.; same as yesterday, at 11 A.M.; aggravated as yesterday at this hour, but more painful, at 2 P.M. (fifty-ninth day). Eyes better (sixtieth day). Eyes all right (sixty-first day). Again affected (sixty-fifth day), [21].
Sudden aching tension in the left side of the occiput (eighth day), [25].
Dull tearing in the forehead, immediately after a meal, [1].
The right eye feels very weak, water runs from it when looking at anything for a few seconds, [66].
Bitter taste in the mouth, only when clearing the throat, [1].
Drawing in the left ear, with eructations from the stomach, [1].
Tearing pain in the forepart of the urethra, [2].
Pressure in the throat, as from a plug, which it seemed to him he must swallow; from hawking or coughing mucus is raised, [1].
Loose cough, especially at night, [7].
Slumbering (almost immediately), with sweat of the face, [1].

In the morning, after awaking, pain in the left side of the forehead, which lasted till noon (eleventh day); pain in the left frontal region, in the morning (two hundred and twenty-ninth day); in the night, awakened by a rather severe but transient pain in the left frontal region (two hundred and forty-first day); woke, in the morning, with violent pains in the left frontal region, which lasted till he got up (two hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
Pain in the submaxillary glands, as if bruised; also painful when touched, [1].
Cutting colic after midnight, [2].
Cutting pain in the nose, and discharge of thin fluid from it, in the evening (seventh day), [45].
Tensive pain in the left scapula, toward evening, [1].
Digging sensation in the upper teeth, [1].
On the mucous membrane of the right side of the under lip two aphthæ, which went off in two days (third day), [25f].
Itching in the left ear, [3].
Violent formication in the abdomen, [2].

Distress in the pelvis, with the sick feeling, at 9 A.M., increasing during the forenoon; waked from a nap, at 4 P.M., with the distress aggravated and feeling somewhat gloomy, but battling against it; after supper, at 6 P.M., all my bad feelings left me; at 9 P.M., the bearing-down feeling in the abdomen returned (second day). At 9 A.M., the dragging and pressing sensation in the abdomen returned; pressure as though the contents would issue through the genital organs; pressing outwards in the hypogastric region, as if the bladder would fall out over the os pubis, partially relieved by hard pressure (third day). The pelvic distress was noticeable through the whole night, at waking intervals, and relief only momentary by lying on either side with the legs flexed on the thighs and the thighs on the abdomen (third night). I waked this morning without the distress, but it returned on stirring, and increased before breakfast; distress in the hypogastric region through the day, as of overdistended bladder, that could not be endured; worse by continually sitting and lying; better on walking about; it disappeared on eating supper; better when walking in the open air (fourth day). Pressure downwards, as if the uterus would issue through the vulva; complete cessation of distress in uterus from supper to 9 P.M., when it returned (fifth day). A load or weight in the lower part of the abdomen, in the morning; at 9 A.M. suddenly ill, with the bearing-down feeling greatly increases in the abdomen; pelvic symptoms aggravated, at P.M., after sleep; the distress was relieved on eating supper, and returned at 9 P.M. (ninth day). The pelvic distress and bearing down have returned; they last all day, with dull feeling in the head and desire to sit or lie still with eyes closed; amelioration after supper; sick in my room from 9 A.M. to 6 P.M. (sixteenth day). Bearing-down sensation, with the menses (eighteenth day). Feeling of crowding and pressing downwards (nineteenth day). Downward pressure in abdomen; the only way in which I could fall asleep was by assuming the knee-elbow position for a time, causing slight eructation, relief, and sleep (twenty-first night). In the afternoon pressure in the uterus, as if everything would issue through the vulva (twenty-third day). Through the day, occasional bearing-down sensation in abdomen (twenty-seventh day). Pressing down in abdomen (twenty-ninth day), [20].
In the evening a fine burning, like sparks, on some parts of the skin of the right upper lid (third day), [25g].
Abdomen much puffed up after dinner, [1].
Discharge of blood with the stool (after eleven and twenty days), [1].
Clotted blood is always discharged on blowing the nose, [1].

Nausea at intervals the whole day, also after a meal, with an afflux of watery saliva, bitterish sour taste in the mouth continually, without appetite, yet the food has a natural taste (after four days), [1].
Tingling and pulsation in the ears, [1].
Soreness and inflamed feel of labia, externa and interna, [10].
Great itching of the margins of the eyelids, [29].
Very sleepy during the day, and averse to everything, [1].
Dull drawing pain in the suprascapular region, on the right side (second day), [36].
Painful heat in the head, frequently, with flushes of heat over the body, [1].
Stitches in the left eye, [1].
Stitches from within outward at the forehead, so that he must hold it with the hand, on coughing, [1].

A sensation as if there were a foreign body in the right eye, in the morning (twenty-eighth day); feeling of foreign body in the eyes, in the forenoon in the right, in the evening in the left eye (twenty-ninth day), [44f].
Sour-smelling sweat (after thirty days), [1].
While seated at breakfast, felt a cutting pain in the hypogastric region, at the same time an imperative urging to stool (fifth day); I seldom have pains in bowels, [27].
Pressive headache in the occiput, in the evening till midnight, [1].
Several jerks in the liver, [1].
Pimples in the face, which itch somewhat, [1].
Boring pain over the left eye, [51].
Vanishing of sight, [1].
Desire for vinegar, [1].
Headache, most severe towards evening, particularly when shaking the head, [1].
Swelling of the mucous membrane of the mouth and the internal portion of the gums, so that the mouth seems narrowed, [1].
At 5 P.M., fluttering before the left ear (sixth day), [21].
Left eye ached very badly this afternoon; pain ceased in the evening, then came a feeling as if the head was stuffed (third day), [35].
The upper lip very red and sensitive on its inner surface (twentieth day), [45a].
Long-lasting scurf on the chin, [1].
All night likes to be well covered up, for five nights (third night after last dose), [16].
Tearing in the left scapula, after slight exposure, [1].
Heat and dryness of the margins of the lids (twentieth day), [20].
Nausea before each liquid stool (after five days), [1].
Sleep disturbed through frequent cough, and from pain in the feet, [4].

Violent headache on getting up; weight on the forehead; this pain is aggravated in the open air and when walking; a little later it becomes seated in the forehead and is pulsative (twelfth day), [15].
Uneasy sensation in stomach, cannot describe sensation, at 7 A.M. (twenty-eighth day), [21].
The sore spot swells and becomes hot, accompanies by burning pains, [1].

About midnight, a sort fainting fit, lasting for one-fourth hour, accompanied by profuse sweat, with consciousness, but without the ability to talk or to move a finger; in the midst of the paroxysm, he had a sort of dream in which he was fighting with a ghost; he had scarcely recovered from this faint before he fell into a second, with a dream of being lost in a forest, [1].
Felt sleepy and must lie down; relief from lying down (after five hours and a half), [33].
Tensive pain of the metacarpal joints of the fingers, particularly during flexion, [1].
Swelling and redness of the eyes, with pimples on the lids, [1].
After dinner, difficult hearing of left ear (first day), [20].
Scanty expectoration, with wheezing rattling in the chest, [1].
Dryness of the inner surface of the lids, [1].
In the evening, sudden, very painful tearing in the left upper eyelid (twenty-third day), [22a].
Ravenous hunger, which obliges him to eat frequently; if he does not, he has headache and great lassitude, and is obliged to lie down (after ten days), [1].
Severe stitches in the left ear and left cheek, [1].
Severe fluent coryza, with great pain in the occiput, and painful drawing in the hips and thighs, for two weeks, [1].
Bloody slimy discharge from the vagina, [1].
He awakes at night with inclination to vomit, [1].
Drawing pain in the face, with swelling of the cheek, [1].
Coryza, with very frequent sneezing (fifteenth day), [34a].
Awoke with a dull heavy feeling in the back of the head, extending down the spine, which passed off about an hour after rising (nineteenth day), [22].
In the evening troublesome feeling of heat in the eyes (thirty-second day), [18a].
Slight burning in the upper lip (forty-fifth day), [45a].
Short pain in the right thigh, in the evening after lying down, so severe that she had to lie without being able to move, sixteen evenings in succession (after two days), [1].
Heartburn forenoon and afternoon, for several hours, extending from the pit of the stomach to the throat, in which he has a sourish taste and a scraping sensation, [1].
Very much thirst during the day, [1], [2].
Sour taste in the mouth (after twenty days), [1].
Drawing-aching pains in the occiput to the nape, in the forenoon (one hundred and fifty-eighth day), [45b].
Great dryness of the lips, [29].
Thirst, with dryness and agglutination of the mouth, [3].
In the evening, twitching in the eyelids (second day), [20].
Sore pain on the right side of the lower lip near the corner of the mouth, [2].

Two attacks per day, one hour each, of contractive griping in the hypochondria, with nausea, extending from thence like a stitch into the back; also stitches in the chest; yawning until he vomits bile and food, [1].
Sharp stitching pain on inner side of left foot and underneath the toes after going to bed (thirtieth day), [38].
Smarting in the right eye, in the evening, with inclination of the lids to close against one's wish, [1].

A distinct chill at 9 A.M., followed by fever, with chilliness across the stomach and bowels, and chilliness between the shoulders; the sweat that followed the fever was exceedingly offensive and pungent; her feet, which had always been subject to perspiration (not offensive), now gave forth a most offensive odor (third day). One hour after a dose she felt a coldness between the shoulders, and then a general chilliness over the body, followed by sudden loss of strength and weakness about the chest, and she broke out into a profuse perspiration over the chest and neck; the hands and feet became cold as ice; her face pale; she thought she should vomit, but was relieved on getting up and moving about (eleventh day), [23].
During eructation stitch in the pit of the stomach, in the left side and between the scapulæ, [1].
Long-continued erections, at night (after sixteen hours), [1].
Swelling of the head above the temples (after forty-eight hours), [1].
I had some dreams, but cannot recall them, except one, of a foolish character (an old gentleman of seventy, running away from his wife, and suspected of having married another), [38].
The menses, which were usually accompanied by cold and aching pains in lower bowels, came on without the least distress), [9].
Great dryness of the palate, with much thirst; she is obliged to drink much, [1].
Three thin acrid stools per day, followed by protrusion of the hæmorrhoids, from which ooze a moisture, and which when sitting are exceedingly painful (after twelve days), [1].
Bleeding of the gum, [3].
Weakness of the head so that she can scarcely think, particularly in the afternoon, [1].
Looseness of the lower incisors, [1].
Drawing pain in the bones of the orbits, [1].
Woke with hands clasped, lying on right side; right hand felt numb, possibly from lying on it (eighth day), [15].
She must arise frequently at night to urinate, [1].
About 2 P.M. severe pain in a circumscribed spot, about one and a half inches in diameter, immediately over the spleen, deep; this continued until 3 P.M. (second day), [35].
Itching of the eyelids, as if they would become inflamed, [1].
Boring above the root of the nose, [1].
Weakness and dulness of the head during dinner, lasting till evening, [1].
Chest a little sore, [19].
Drawing and pressure in pit of stomach, at night (after twelve hours), [1].
Inflammation of the lower lids, without especial swelling, [1].
*Violent pain in the vertex, in the evening, as if the hair would be torn out; it bristles on the most painful spots, [1].
Bruised pain and lassitude in the legs; she sank unavoidably into a slumber full of anxious dreams, [1].
Lachrymation of the eyes, when walking, in the open air (two hundred and seventy-sixth day), [45b].
Convulsive beating of the heart, with great anxiety and trembling of the fingers and lower limbs, [1].
Painful smarting of the eyes, [58].
*Sore pain in both oral commissures, in the afternoon (eighth day), [44b].
Pain in the abdominal muscles during motion, only at night, [1].
Dry coryza, only in the left nostril, [2].
While walking, vertigo like an obscuration before the eyes, a reeling to the left side, lasting a few minutes, [1].
Sensation as if weights were attached to the posterior parts of the eyeballs (twenty-third day), [20].
Flushes of heat, she feels in a kind of glow, [9].
Burning in the rectum during the latter part of a soft stool (after six days), [1].
After coition, first an erection, then weakness of thought, vertigo, discouraged, relaxation of the body, and in the evening, low-spirited and inclined to start (fourteenth day), [1].
Stitches just beneath the pit of the stomach, during inspiration, [2].
At night during sleep, severe bruised pain and exhaustion in the thighs and upper arm, but only during slumber, on awaking it passed off immediately, [1].
Painful beating in the occiput, [1].
Large blood-boil on the left side of the neck, below the inferior maxillary, with stinging pain, [1].
A small ulcer in one nostril, lasting a long time, [1].
Pain in the tongue as if burned, for five days, [1].
A lame sore feeling all day (third day), [22].
Drawing in the scapula, intermingled with jerks (after nineteen days), [1].
Small severely itching pustule on the occiput toward the nape of the neck, which became an ulcer of an inch in length, with rough scabs beneath, which for a long time was moist, [1].
Severe oppression of breathing, towards evening from pressure over the pit of the stomach, [1].
Nosebleed for seven hours, but only a few drops, from time to time, [1].
Obstruction of the nose, indurated mucus comes therefrom, [1].
Accumulation of much mucus in the mouth, after midnight, with tickling, obliging frequent hawking, [3].
*In two hours, when in bed, he had a violent rush of blood to the head, and felt all the arteries in his head beating (first day), [23].
Anxious dreams, as if the body were disfigured, [1].
Headache above the eyes and nausea after eating, followed by heaviness of the head, [1].
Headache as if the head would burst, also when coughing, [1].
He awakes at night in a fright and screaming, [1].
About midnight, awaking with chilliness, great anxiety, jerking and spasmodic drawing in the thighs, the chest, and the maxillæ, lasting half an hour, [1].
In the evening after eating an ice, very disagreeable taste and slight nausea (ninth day), [45].
Drawing and tearing in the teeth, mostly aggravated by cold water, at times relieved by warmth; often with jerking in the tips, [3].
Tension posteriorly at the left side, as from a cold, [1].
Expectoration of white mucus of the size of millet seed (after fourteen days), [4].
Pain in the right side, between scapula and vertebræ (twenty-third day), [20].
Expectoration of blood when coughing, every morning, without pain in the chest, [1].
Leucorrhœa, especially profuse, after urinating, [1].
Single sharp stitches within the left ear, [2].

Waking at night about 2 o'clock, with violent colic, and at times also pressing pain above and around the navel, with trembling motion of the heart, which can be felt outwardly (without palpitation), with full pulse; with this, nausea and sensation of great weakness, for three nights in succession, with great dryness of the mouth, [2].
Twitching of the lower lid every day, [1].
On blowing my nose I have a dizzy sensation (third day), [37].
Appetite much increased (seventh day), [15].
Feeling of sand in right eye (first and second days), [74].
Tearing over the eyes, [1].
Dislike to the usual glass of beer, in the evening (seventeenth day), [40].

Although he ate a very good dinner, yet in the afternoon, contrary to habit, he became so very hungry that he had to eat again; notwithstanding this, he was again ready for supper (forty-seventh day), [45a].

In the afternoon, dryness of the nose (eighth day); dryness of nose (ninth day); dryness of nose (eighteenth day); dry feeling and aching in the nose (forty-third day); dryness of the nose (forty-seventh and forty-eighth days); tiresome dryness of the nose, in the morning (forty-ninth day); dryness of the nose (fifty-fifth and sixty-fifth days); dryness of the nose, in the morning (seventy-third day); dry feeling in the nose, at noon (one hundred and fourth day); sensitiveness and dryness of the mucous membrane of the nose (one hundred and fourteenth day); tiresome dryness of the nose (one hundred and thirtieth day); dry feeling and aching in the nose, especially its root, in the forenoon (one hundred and fifty-first day); dryness and aching in the nose severe (two hundred and seventieth day); dryness of the nose (two hundred and seventy-first and two hundred and seventy-second days), [45b].
Tensive headache in the eyes only on raising them, several mornings in bed, on waking, [1].
Urine thick, slimy, and very offensive, depositing a yellowish pasty sediment the next morning (third day), [23].
Gets to sleep late, if she does not lie down quite early, and then also awakes early in the morning, [1].
Exhausting diarrhœa, with diarrhœa-like feel in the abdomen, [13].
Taste altered, insipid (third day), [37].
Pressure in front in the lower abdomen, right side, [2].
Frequent sharp pressure on the os sacrum and a little below it, [1].
The candlelight fatigues the eyes when reading or writing, by causing a contractive sensation, [1].
Attacks of crawling in the thighs down to the toes, frequently lasting one-fourth of an hour, a number of days in succession, [1].

After dinner, rather severe itching of the lids, especially of the right eye (two hundred and forty-seventh day); great itching on the borders of the right eyelids (two hundred and forty-eighth day), [45b].
Deafness in both ears, very transient (after nine days), [1].
Leucorrhœa, as clear as water (after twenty-two days), [1].
Violent headache (seventeenth and following days), [27].

Sensation as if an inflammation of the eye were about to come on (second day); in the morning, on awaking, prickling, causing him to scratch, itching and smarting in the lids (third and fourth days); itching and smarting in the lids much diminished; towards evening it went off completely (fifth day), [36a].
Itching and biting in the inner canthi, [3].
Profuse coryza, [56].
Burning pain above and beneath the eyebrows, every afternoon, [2].
*Headache only on ascending steps, [1].
Sticking in the lower jaw, extending out of the ear, [1].

Severe itching on the right side of the pubis, worse at night on going to bed; becoming moist after scratching, and forming a thin scale, easily pulled off (after a week); this eruption has nearly disappeared (after eighteen days), [39].
Bruised pain in the tibiæ, [1].
Stitches in the elbow-joint, [1].
Roaring in the ears, in the evening in bed, with rush of blood to the head, [1].
Great heat, one day, right around lower ribs, with fever, but a moist sweat around body, [19].
Lachrymation, feeling fatty, from both eyes, [2].
Pain near the head of the humerus, at the tendons of the pectoral muscles, bending the arm backwards and from touch, [1].
Toothache every afternoon, as if the teeth would be broken off, with chilliness; disappearing when in bed, [1].
The left nostril is frequently too dry, feels swollen, yet without coryza, [1].
Violent fluent coryza (twenty-fourth day); severe fluent coryza, in the morning (twenty-ninth day); fluent coryza, towards noon (fortieth day); fluent coryza (forty-eighth day), [29].
Pressive headache above the left eye, in the afternoon, [1].
Shooting pain, beginning in the cervix and passing up to the fundus uteri, and thence to the right ovary; pain is so severe that it causes nausea (thirty-fourth day), [21].
Small painful sore blisters in the mouth, even slightly salted food causes biting, [1].
Cutting in the abdomen, with frequent nausea, [1].
*Jerking headache, [1].
Tearing and jerks in the teeth, in the afternoon, at every fourth inspiration; worse when lying down, accompanied with profuse ptyalism, [1].
Drawing pain in the teeth, in the open air, [1].
Sour taste in the mouth, with costiveness (after eleven days), [1].
Burning in the abdomen, when walking in the open air, [1].
No appetite for breakfast (eighty-eighth day), [45a].
Twitching on the tongue, [1].
Leucorrhœa, looking like pus, [1].
Painful eruption on the tip of the nose, [1].
Very hungry at noon (twenty-first day), [20].
Itching in the left eye (second day), [20a].
In the evening, violent pains in the occiput (fourth and fifth days), [36d].
Swelling between the tibia and calf (after thirteen days), [1].
Pressure and burning in the cheeks and cheek-bones, [1].
Discharge of prostatic fluid, after micturition, [1].
Tensive pain in the anus (and rectum), (after four days), [1].
Headache in the morning, with nausea, until noon, [1].
Painful stitches in the left temple, returned at 6 P.M. (thirty-first day), [38].
Severe dry coryza, with roaring in the head and ears (after twenty-four hours), [1].
The lids often close, after rising, in the morning, [1].
Sudden drawing above the right eyebrow (after two hours, third day), [25f].
Profuse falling of the hair, [1].
Hands hot, but moist, [19].
Profuse nosebleed, several times (after second day), [28].
At 2 P.M., I have a very severe headache, which runs from my right temple to my left, and extends into my eyes and nose (third day), [37].
Desquamation of the skin from the inside of the cheek, [1].
Drawing tension, like cramps in the calves, from the malleoli to the knees, [1].

9 A.M., 9 ounces of urine, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1022; 7 P.M., 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; midnight, 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; total, 38 ounces (first day); 9 A.M., 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 2 P.M., 6 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; midnight, 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; total, 29 ounces (second day); 9 A.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; midnight 4 ounces, sp. gr. 1025; total, 27 ounces (third day); 9 A.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1025; 2 P.M., 6 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1027; midnight, 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1031; total, 30 ounces (fourth day); 9 A.M., 8 ounces, sp. gr. 1028; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; midnight, 7 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; total, 29 ounces (fifth day); 9 A.M., 8 1/2 ounces, sp. gr. 1026; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 9 ounces, sp. gr. 1021; midnight, 11 ounces, sp. gr. 1022; total, 36 1/2 ounces (sixth day); 9 A.M., 13 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; 2 P.M., 7 ounces; 7 P.M., 10 ounces, sp. gr. 1024; midnight, 4 ounces, sp. gr. 1032; total, 34 ounces (seventh day), [36].
*Much headache, especially on stooping, [1].
Many black spots before the eyes, [1].
When coughing she becomes nauseated, she must retch at times, from which she becomes hot and sweaty, [1].
Much blood with stool, preceded by cutting in the rectum, [1].
Hoarseness, he cannot speak a loud word, [1].
Sticking and burning in the outer canthi, with dimness of vision, in the evening, [3].
Tongue clean and red, with desire for acids (twenty-third day), [20].
Grumbling and moving about of flatus in the abdomen, in the evening, [1].

The night's rest was disturbed by boring tearing pain in the teeth, such a height that he could not sleep a wink, in consequence of which he got the tooth, which was somewhat carious, drawn the following day (seventeenth day), [29].
Simple pain in the liver when riding over rough roads, just under the last ribs, obstructing breathing, [1].

About 11 A.M., while writing, the feet became very cold, afterwards the whole body, accompanied with shaking chill; he had to lie down, then became warm, and at 4 A.M., hot, with disposition to sweat, having had a slight sweat during the night over the whole body (ninth day), [1].
Constant dull heavy pain in sacrum and abdomen, extending to thighs and legs (ninth day); some pain in sacrum and hips, not severe, in the afternoon (tenth day), [44a].
Itching on the occiput, in the morning (tenth day), [45c].
Diminished appetite, everything tastes too salt, [1].
Bloody saliva, [1].
In the morning, weight and hot feeling in the occiput (fourth and fifth days), [22b].
Feeling of looseness of the teeth, in the evening, [1].
Compression in the upper part of the head, the entire day, with great dyspnœa (after eleven days), [1].
Very warm and oppressed, evenings, [1].
All the teeth become loose and painful, and the gums bleed easily when spitting (sixth day), [1].
Constipated, [19].
After rattling of mucus in the chest, severe cough, with expectoration, producing raw and sore pain in the throat, felt one half hour after the cough, [1].
A suppurating pimple on the hairy scalp near the nape (sixteenth day), [45a].
Tearing under the nail of the right index finger, [2].
A feeling as if the eyes were plucked back into her head, [66].

Frequent attacks of contractive pain in the right side of the abdomen, worse in the morning; following this, more severe constrictive pain in the stomach; thence the pain extends to the chest; relieved by eructations, [1].
Pressure and bruised pain in lower abdomen wakes her at night, for several nights, [1].
Contractive headache in the forehead, [1].
Sticking pain in the uvula, with redness of both sides of the throat; very sensitive on swallowing, with shaking chill and accumulation of mucus that cannot be loosened, [7a].
Painful eructations, with rising of blood into the mouth (after rapid riding), (after four hours), [1].
Headache and weakness much worse from walking in the open air, [1].
Violent burning in the upper lip just under the nose, [1].
Headache in the occiput from noon on, a stupefying tingling in it on stepping; she was obliged to sit very quietly for four hours, [1].
Drawing, first in the upper teeth of the left side, and then in those of the right side (third day), [18].
Old symptoms reappear, towards evening (ninth day), [38].
Stitches just under the patella, when walking fast, [1].
Pain in depressors of right side of jaw on voluntarily twitching those muscles (fourth and fifth days), [15].
*Beating of the brain against the skull on moving the head, with pressive pain, [1].
Blister on the gums, with burning pain from touch, [1].
Sneezing, with moisture in the nose, about 9 A.M., [46a].
Frequent faltering of the tongue, when talking, [1].
Toothache when biting and from pressure with the tongue, [1].
Reappearance of the menses (of an elderly female), which had been absent for several months (after twenty days), [1].
Violent drawing pain in an incisor, lasting till 11 P.M., followed by sleeplessness till towards morning, [1].
Inflammation, great swelling, and suppuration of the left tonsil; he could not swallow on account of pain, heat of the whole body, thirst, and burning in the eyes (after eleven days), [1].
Dryness in the posterior nares, yet much mucus in the mouth, with involuntary urging to swallow, [1].

A sore spot in the abdominal walls, just to the right of the median line and three fingers' breadth below the umbilicus (eighteenth day); tender to pressure and from movement of muscles in walking (nineteenth day); sore spot noticed on pressure or sudden turning (twenty-first day), [20].
Soreness of the left commissure of the mouth (sixth day), [17c]; (second day), [17d].
Drawing in the crowns of the teeth, in the evening (eighth day), [44f].
Pressure on the lower part of the right eyeball, [2].
After a second stool, stiffness and sensation of hardness in the back, and tightness in the pit of the stomach, with oppressed breathing, [1].
No appetite, all things seemed tasteless to her, [1].
Obscuration of the head, frequently in the morning, when rising from bed, [1].
The left auricle is painful, as if sore on a limited spot (one hundred and nineteenth day), [45b].
He wants to eat continually, and if he only thinks of eating the water collects in his mouth, [1].
*Feeling as of some heavy weight on vertex, [66].
Digging in the forehead, at night, [1].
The hæmorrhoids become painful (after two hours), [1].
Small induration at the root of the nose, without pain, [1].
External and internal tearing pain in the left shoulder-joint, [2].
Much mucus on the soft palate, [1].
At 5 P.M., fever, first thirst, and after drinking cold water, chilliness and inclination to lie down, then sleep and inclination to general slight sweat, [1].
Burning in the eyes, with redness of them (thirty-third day); redness of eyes much diminished (thirty-fourth day), [16].
Breathing much shorter, [1].
Cough, with stitches in the back, [1].
Stitching in the dorsum of foot, especially painful when walking on the pavement, [1].

Very difficult movement of soft small stool, insufficient, with constant urging and inability (fifth day); soft, small, insufficient, with great straining, followed by great heaviness in abdomen, and pain in pelvis and thighs from the straining (sixth day); small, very difficult, very insufficient stool, with great urging and straining (seventh day); urging to stool, with pressure and straining, but no evacuation (eighth day); urging to stool, with flatus, but no stool, in the morning and at 10 A.M.; very slight stool; constant and severe urging, at 9 P.M. (ninth day); small, soft, insufficient stool; less urging (tenth day); no stool nor desire (eleventh day); stool free, with little straining (twelfth day), [44a].
Attack of vertigo, as if fainting, lasting two hours, with very short breath, [1].

Great burning in the canthi, at noon (second day); slight burning in both outer canthi (tenth day); slight burning in the edges of the lids (twelfth, seventeenth, eighteenth, and nineteenth days), [45a].
During the first part of the proving I slept soundly, but now sleep is restless (forty-fourth night), [38].
Tired feeling, in the morning (tenth day), [35].
Pain along the sole of the left foot to a point between the fourth and fifth toes (thirty-first day), [38].
Pinching pains in the testicle (first and second days), [1].
Vertigo, while walking, as if every object were in motion, [1].
Stitches in the knee, [1].
The eyelids pain on awaking as if too heavy, and as if he could not hold them open, [1].
Burning-pressing pain in the corn, even in wide shoes, [1].
Dry feeling in the nose and fauces, [1].
In the forenoon on inspiring cold air, tearing pain in a lower healthy incisor tooth (thirty-sixth day), [33].

All the time I had violent palpitation of the heart, as though it would force its way through the thoracic wall; this was relieved by walking a long distance and walking very fast (second day); return of palpitation (fourth day); severe palpitation (thirty-sixth day); less severe (thirty-seventh day); another attack of palpitation (seventy-second and seventy-third days), [21].
After dinner flatulent distension of the abdomen, relieved by eructations, continued until evening, when it disappeared, without emission of flatus, [1].
Chilliness, with shivering, repeated two or three times (within a minute), [15].
Unsuccessful desire for stool, passes only wind and mucus, with sensation in rectum as if a plug were in it, [1].
Tearing in the first phalanx of the right index finger, [2].
Dry cough after a meal, [1].
Wakeful and excited the whole night, and through the whole day feels vigorous, [1].
Spasmodic contraction on the right side of lower abdomen, [1].
Sour eructations (ninth day), [38].
Dryness of the mouth, and taste of blood, [1].
Flushes of heat, in the evening, then itching, [1].
His food, which he generally likes very little salted, he now salts very much, and still it tastes to him as if there were no salt in it, [18c].
Pain in the left side of the head this afternoon, over the left eye, worse in the evening; it kept me awake a long time after I went to bed (fourth day), [35].
Pressure in the throat in the region of the tonsils, as if the neckcloth were tied too tight, [1].
Pains appear on the left side, at 5 P.M. (sixth day), [38].
Burning and pressure in the eyes; in the morning they were agglutinated and the whole face swollen, [1].
In the morning he blew some blood-streaked mucus from the nose (thirteenth day), [28].
At night heat, and from this restlessness, [1].
Itching on the eyelids, [1].
Paroxysms of obscuration of the eyes, while walking in the open air, with violent pressure and beating in the head, nausea and weakness (sixth day), [1].
Contraction and oppression of the chest, with stitches therein on deep breathing, [1].
Scraping in the throat, in the evening, [1].
Stitches in the left ear (sixth day), [1].
Dry feeling and tensive pain in the left side of the palate, gradually extending to the right side, and lasting two days, in the morning (second day), [18d].
Pressure mostly in the forehead and eyes, finally nausea, with spitting of much saliva, [1].
Throat feels as if it had been skinned (fifth and sixth days), [37].

A painful inflamed spot in the red of the upper lip (one hundred and seventy-fourth day); the spot of the upper lip is swollen and burns extremely (one hundred and seventy-fifth day); the spot has turned into an aphthæ (one hundred and seventy-sixth day); the aphthæ begins to dry up (one hundred and seventy-eighth day), [45b].
Severe pains over the eye, alternating from one to the other (second day), [28].
Pressure in the abdomen, [1].
Pressure in the eyes, especially on working in the sun, [2].
Stoppage of the nose, violent sneezing (twentieth day); coryza continues (twenty-second and twenty-third days); diminished (twenty-fourth day), [34].
Flashes of heat all over the body, about 8.30 P.M. (twenty-seventh day), [38].
Dryness of the mouth, after eating, [1].
Great bitterness in the mouth while eating, [1].
Singing before the ears, [1].
Great thirst for beer, [2].
Swelling and suppuration of the glands in the right axilla, [1].
Difficult deglutition; the muscles of deglutition seem paralyzed, for several evenings (after thirty-six days), [1].
Tearing stitches in the thighs when walking, momentarily depriving the lower extremities of all power, and almost paralyzing them, accompanied with chilliness, [1].
Skin seems tender; the least scratch heals slowly (twenty-fourth day), [20].
During the day, frequent sudden vertigo, especially when walking near a declivity. The accustomed beer at night makes the vertigo worse (thirteenth day), [22a].
Great heat in the head, in the morning, with sensation as if the nose would bleed, [1].
A sensation of prickling in both eyelids, causing him to scratch and rub them, [36c].
Bloated uncomfortable feeling around the waist (second day), [22].
Left side of tongue and mouth covered with vesicles, causing a stinging pain; tongue coated yellow (twenty-eighth day); tongue clean; vesicles have disappeared (twenty-ninth day), [21].
Menses five days too late, at full moon (after twenty-two days), [1].
Itching of the occiput, in the evening, [1].
Stupefied feeling in the head, with tightness on the chest and weakness of the whole body, [1].
The swelling of the legs up to the knees increases during sitting or standing, passes off when walking, [1].
Great protrusion of hæmorrhoids during stool, [1].
Dryness in the mouth and throat, in the morning on awaking, she could not utter a sound nor speak (after six days), [1].
Throbbing pains in both temples after walking, especially after going upstairs (fifth day), [44].
Soreness and burning pain between the nates, [1].
Left arm down to wrist feeling heavy and very cold, but hands hot, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Pain in both sides of the chest, passing around to the interscapular space, [9].
Smarting in the rectum after stool, [1].
Plugs in the nose (twenty-third day), [20].
A small spot in the lower part of the head, by the nape of the neck, hurts at times, and especially after scratching a sore burning, [1].
Frequent eructation after eating and drinking, [1].
Drawing pain in the occiput, touching it causes pain, as if from subcutaneous ulceration, [1].
Tearing stitches, so severe as to make him cry out, in the left thigh when at rest, afterward ulcerative pain at the same place, [1].
Shivering until going to bed, and heat of the face, in bed, [1].
Occasional slight twinges of headache in the sides of the head (third day), [40a].
Dull aching pain over the whole head, lasting nearly three hours, and then gradually going off (after half an hour, ninth day); less troublesome (tenth day), [22a].
Head feels full and hot (thirteenth day), [1].
Dreams, not exhausting, the whole night, [3].
Drawing in the right molar teeth (eighth day), [44d].
Stitch, as if in the bone, extending from under the right eyelid down to the upper canine tooth, [1].
Cramp in the abdomen (after seventeen days), [1].
Swelling of the inner mouth so that he can scarcely introduce any food, [1].
Loud grumbling and sensation of emptiness in the left side of the abdomen, every day, [1].
While walking, a sensation of fulness in right inguinal region, which soon passed off; I never had this symptom before (after two hours and a half), [30].
Very much affected, as if he had been hungry a long time, an hour after dinner, [1].
Dull aching headache, at one time deep in the forehead, then in the occiput, but always alternating with gouty pains piercing through the joints of the extremities (first day), [25g].
Sensation in the left lower extremity as if a mouse were running up and down, [1].
Tensive-stitching pain around the hypochondria, impeding every motion, worse when walking, [1].
Heaviness in forehead and temples (after two hours), [38].
Constant sweetish taste in the mouth, as from fasting, with frequent hawking up of mucus, [1].

Slept from 10 to 11 P.M., and then woke, feeling as if a load were resting across the epigastrium; she took a dose of Aconite 3d, according to her custom, when disturbed in her sleep, and slept until morning (eleventh night), [23].
Violent digging pains in a right healthy molar tooth; strong pressure on the tooth diminished the pain; cold and heat had no effect on it, [17e].
*Painful pressure above the eyebrows, [1].
A dull headache all day (twentieth day); headache (twenty-first day), [22].
Tearing in the left scapula, as from a cold (after four hours), [1].
Salt mucus sticks to the tongue, every morning, [1].
The nose bleeds easily, [46a].
Discharge of prostatic fluid with every difficult stool, [1].
*Dulness of the head, on waking at night, [1].
Inflammation of the eyes, which cannot endure cold water, [1].
The tooth is elongated and painful when not touched, or when not bitten upon, [1].
No appetite, but thirst, [1].
Stitching pain in the third toe of the right foot, at the same time as the pain in the left lung (tenth day), [27].
Stitches in the heart, in the afternoon (after five days), [1].
Heaviness in the feet extending to the knee, from early in the morning, [1].
Teeth sensitive to cold air (second day), [36].
Dull drawing-tearing pain, as if sprained, in the shoulder-joint (after dinner), [1].
Pain in the abdomen, as if the intestines had been beaten to pieces, [1].
Herpetic blotches around the mouth, [1].
Itching of the anus, even during the day, [1].
Constant aching pain in the back of the neck (right side), generally better after dinner, in the evening (third day), [36].
Slight headache at the left side of the forehead, just above the eyebrow (soon); at noon, troublesome aching on the left side of the forehead (third day), [18].
Cutting-stinging pain in the gall-bladder (after half an hour), [7a].
Severe distension of the abdomen, particularly in the evening, [1].
The limbs go to sleep easily, even from stooping, crossing the legs, reaching high with the arms, etc., [1].
Emissions frequently seem coming on, yet suppressed every time by his waking up (after twenty-hours), [1].
Griping in the abdomen almost every morning, for one hour, with nausea, qualmishness, and accumulation of saliva in the mouth, [1].
Everything seems an exertion (after three hours and a half, second day), [42].
Itching in eyelids and burning in eyes (twelfth day), [34a].
Weak feeling in the rectum in the evening in bed, causing restlessness, so that he cannot sleep, [1].
Swelling of inguinal glands in left thigh, painful on walking, [10].
Painful stiffness, apparently in the region of the uterus, [1].
Spasm of the bladder, [3].
Much itching in the sound ear, great roaring, and accumulation of purulent whitish cerumen, [1].
Itching on the occiput, [1].
Drawing in the left side of the lower jaw, towards its articulation, about noon (sixth day), [44d].
Very sour taste in the mouth, in the evening before going to bed, [1].
*Stitch in the head, [1].
Great increase of the wax in the ears, especially the left ear (fifteenth day), [45a].
Drawing pain in the back teeth, aggravated by inhaling cold air, [1].
Sight dim, and an appearance as of a mist before the eye (third day), [35].
Menses seven days too early (after three days), [1].
Drawing tearing toothache, now in the right, and now in the left side, for hours, and often with intermission for half an hour or an hour; also at night on waking, [1].
No appetite (third day); anorexia; what she eats has no taste; she has no relish, and the morsel seems to stick in her gullet (fourth day); no appetite (sixth day), [31].
Pressure and itching in the eyes and vertigo on stooping, [1].
Violent stitches in the rectum at night, [1].
Violent cramp in the region of the liver, relieved by eructations and emission of flatus, [2].
Lascivious dreams, with erections, disturbing his sleep at night, [11].
Drawing pain in the knees, [2].
While at stool, a painful raw sensation in the anus (sixth day), [37].
Empty feeling in the head, in the morning (forty-eighth day), [29].
Stitches in the temples, [1].
No appetite, and yet the food has the proper taste (third day), [30].
Violent pain in shoulder-joints on lifting the slightest weight, or when resting the elbow in an elevated position, like an excessively painful pressure, with trembling in the hands, [1].
Slept several afternoons (after two days), [1].
Stitching pain at the tip of the nose when touching it, as if a pointed hair were pricking it, [1].
Feeling of desire to pass urine more urgent than common, the sensation being referred to the neck of the bladder (third day), [40].

Feeling of bearing down of all the pelvic organs (second and fourth days); weight and bearing down (fifth and sixth days); some bearing down (seventh and eighth days); on rising, in the morning, with the leucorrhœa (ninth day); some pressure and bearing down after rising (tenth, eleventh, and thirteenth days), [44].
Outward pressure in the ears, while straining at stool (after three days), [1].
Stitches in the forehead, as from needles, daily, when walking fast, with nausea, [1].
Awoke at 4 A.M. with a sense of fulness below the pit of the stomach, above the navel (first night), [23].
Eructations, with efforts to vomit (after twenty-six hours), [1].
Some pain in lower limbs, most in thighs (ninth day), [44a].
Painfulness of the whole chest, [1].
Vertigo, when lying on the back, at night, [1].
Tearing in the left temple to the upper part of the left side of the head, [2].

Fine stitching pains from the scapula through the ribs, on the right side of the back, coming on with and lasting only during each inspiration, the same in all positions; only relieved when walking in the open air, [1].
In the evening, violent shooting in the upper lid (fourth day), [42a].
All the symptoms are greatly aggravated on lying; I must get up and walk about slowly; relieved after supper in all respects (twenty-second day), [20].
Bruised pain in the thighs, when touching them, with tension therein when walking, [1].
The head jerks and twitches forward six or seven times, with full consciousness, in the morning, [1].
A short tensive aching in the left side of the occiput (eighth day), [25].
Discharge of a few drops of blood from the vagina, fifteen days before the time of menses (after eight days), [1].

Bowels moved (in twelve hours); four movements during the day, and slight pain and some tenesmus during stool. (The bowels had always been remarkably regular, one stool each morning), (first day); stool about every two hours until the afternoon of this day; stool natural, but towards night it was diarrhœic, with tenesmus before and during stool, and burning of anus after stool, and feeling of intense bearing down in region of the anus (second day), [24].
After two hard stools, great weakness in the abdomen and entire loss of appetite, [1].
After blowing the nose, discharge of yellow water from the nose, with cutting headache in the forehead, [1].
Aching pain at the coccyx, just before the action of the bowels; it was intolerable, and shot across her with such severity that she had frequently to lie down and cry, [9].
Diarrhœa after partaking of milk, [1].
Great uneasiness in the limbs, at night, [1].
Dull tired pain in the right shoulder and muscles of the back of the neck (second day), [36].
Feel better when out of doors (third day), [37].
Toothache and throbbing in the gums during the menses, [1].
Weak, particularly in the knees, [1].
Attacks of tension in the chest, [1].
Darting pains in the vagina, on left side, from below upwards (after five hours, second day), [44a].
Continuous moisture, day and night, [1].
Violent toothache, [7a].
Beating here and there in the abdomen, [1].
Coryza (after fourteen days), [1].
Empty feeling in the stomach, [1].
After coition, great weakness in the knees, [1].
Nausea, mornings only, passing off after eating something, [1].
Dull headache through both temples and forehead, with drooping of the eyelids, at 10 A.M. (third day), [21].
The ear always becomes stopped on blowing the nose, [1].
Frequent stitches under the right ribs, [1].
Gnawing in the bones in front of the left ear; also on swallowing, [3].
Starting in the noonday sleep, [1].
Bitter taste in the palate and throat, in the morning on waking, relieved by coughing up mucus, [1].
Slight drawing in the lower incisors (two hundred and forty-third day), [45b].

*From time to time, painful pressing inward from the vertex superiorly deep into the brain, especially late in the evening and at night in bed; the pain compels wrinkling the forehead and drawing the eyes together, [1].
Trembling of the eyes, [1].
Bad smell from the mouth, [1].
Burning of the lips, [1].
Eructation after eating but little, [1].
Sleep pretty good, but not refreshing; I spent hours enough in bed, but they did no good, [35].
Disagreeable bitter taste in the mouth, in the morning, [1].
Bruised pain in the knee and tibia, more when sitting than walking, [1].
Vertigo, when she sees a large plain before her, [1].
Itching and itching pimples on the joints, particularly on the bends of the elbows, popliteal space, and ankles, worse evening and morning than during the day (after a few hours), [1].
Great hunger, in the evening, [1].
Inner surface of lower lip feels sore and is full of painful blisters (after seven days), [1].

A sudden, not violent, pain in the left side of the forehead (soon); in the morning, aching in the forehead, first on the left side and then on the right, extending to the mastoid process (second and third days), [18a].
Frequent tingling in the ears (after twenty-four hours), [1].
Vexatious dreadful dreams, [1].
Nose much stopped up (sixteenth day), [34a].
Painful blister on the tip of the tongue, above and below, [1].
Sensation of fulness in the region of the liver, [1].
Bleeding of the teeth, [1].
Strong, somewhat painful, erections, after the morning sleep, while sitting, [5].
Some pain in the forehead, with the dryness and stinging in the nose (second day); slight frontal headache (twelfth day); frontal headache, and below temples (thirteenth day), [44a].
Tingling in the ears; at times in one, at times in the other, and difficult hearing with the tingling, [1].
Red herpetic spots on both sides of the neck with much itching, [1].
Pain shooting into the right ear (third day), [37].
After a papescent stool, headache, [1].
*Sticking headache in the temples, [1].

A sharp stitching pain in the prepuce and frænum prep.; a smarting raw feeling, causing me to examine if it were not abraded; found only a congestion of the integument; these symptoms are new to me (twelfth and thirteenth days), [30].
The head pained, as if raw, and would not bear the slightest touch (second day), [43].
About 4.30 P.M., felt very hungry, and after eating a little felt satisfied, and the stomach felt full (second day), [35].
The upper lip burns as if it were raw (second day), [45a].
Severe uterine cramps all night, with only short intervals of relief, with the menses (thirty-eighth day); uterine cramps when moving about, relieved when lying down (thirty-ninth day), [21].
Much discharge of offensive flatus (after fifteen days), [1].
Pressure on the vertex after mental labor, [1].
Drawing in the left upper jaw and zygoma, about 5 P.M. (eighth day), [44a].
Itching on the bends of the elbows, [1].
Stitches in the forehead, with nausea (she cannot eat), better from lying down, [1].
Fulness in the chest and contraction, which interferes with her breathing, [1].
Congestion of blood to the eyes, [1].
Blisters on the hard palate, which prevent talking and eating, [1].
Violent itching in the outer canthus of the left eye, with sore pain after rubbing it, [2].
Very sensitive to noise, [1].
Intermission of beats of the heart, mostly after a meal, [1].
Great distension of the abdomen, immediately after eating some soup, [2].
Continued otalgia in both ears, at night, [1].
Swelling of both legs (after thirteen days), [1].
Headache, especially in the forenoon, as if the head were drawn forward and downward, [1].
Stiffness in the back, which passes off when walking, [1].
After urinating at noon, discharge of milky moisture from the urethra, [1].
Putrid taste to the expectoration and putrid smell of the breath coming up with it, [1].
Uncommon urging to urinate (as in the former proving), (third day), [40a].
Great ringing in the ears for five minutes, in the morning in bed, [1].
