Daily jerking under the eyes, [1].
Sourish taste in the mouth till after breakfast, [1].
Severe tearing in the urethra, [1].
After being stung by a bee, redness and itching red rash over the whole body, inflamed eyes, and drops of sweat on the face, all coming on in a few minutes, [1].
Pressive headache; every step is painfully felt in the forehead, with perspiration on the forehead, [1].
Heaviness of the limbs, [7a].
Burning in stomach and pit of stomach, [1].
Drawing in the thighs (after forty-eight hours), [1].
Stoppage of the nose (second day), [26].
Very faint all day (after seven days), [16].
Pressure on the spinal column, above the small of back, with rheumatic drawing in the neck, [2].
Great dryness of the vulva and vagina, causing a very disagreeable sensation when walking, after the cessation of the menses (eleventh day), [21].
Redness of the face and perspiration after dinner, [1].
Violent cough, with much expectoration of white mucus, every night for one hour, for several weeks, [1].
Disturbed sleep all night, from unpleasant dreams (third night), [42].
Fine quick gurgling in the right side of upper abdomen, [2].
External warmth was unbearable to her during the violent headache, yet she was chilly, [1].
An incisor tooth seemed elongated, [1].
He is hungry, but as soon as he only sees food his appetite vanishes and he feels full in the abdomen; when he begins to eat, he is averse to it, [1].
Superficial drawing and boring in the head, more at night, on account of which she could not remain in bed; about midnight it extended into the temples, ear, and teeth (after six days), [1].
Sudden obstruction of both nostrils, in the morning, [1].
Jerking in the lids, [1].
Vertigo, worse soon after taking medicine (probably the effect of the alcohol), but lasting in a slight degree all day (second day); slight vertigo (immediately, ninth day), [22b].
Aching in left eye (soon); in the evening, aching in the left eye (second day), [20].
*Pain, as if the brain were beating against the skull, always on nodding the head, [1].
Sense of giddiness
Pressing and stitching otalgia in both ears, [2].
Dry burning sensation in soles of feet, [9].
*Every step is painfully felt in the head, [1].
Sore pain in the nose, very painful during every inspiration, [1].
Anorexia (second day), [26]; (twentieth day), [37].
Vertigo, while sitting; reeling while standing, [1].
One-sided, sharp, pressive headache beneath the left parietal bone immediately after supper, [1].
Burning pain to the left and below the navel, [2].

When lifting, sudden shoot into the small of back, like a stitch, so that he dared not move on account of the great pain; he had to walk bent forward, and had severe stitches if he struck the foot against anything, [1].
She feels the beating of pulse in the head and all the limbs, day and night, but more at night, [1].
Spasmodic stitching in the heel, as if the tendons were too short, evenings when undressing and extending the feet, [1].
Bitter bilious taste in the mouth, when fasting, though food has a good taste, [1].
In the forenoon, itching and burning in both eyes, followed by great watering of the eyes (third day), [39].
Tearing and jerking toothache, from 6 P.M., until after midnight, about 1 or 2 A.M., on four successive days, [1].
Many gelatinous stools, with pains in the abdomen, [1].
Bitter eructation after breakfast, [1].
Putrid-tasting mucus on the tongue, [1].
Violent sneezing, several days, [1].
Cannot bear reflected light from bright objects (twenty-third day); annoyed by reflections from bright objects (twenty-sixth day), [20].
The mere thought of eating causes nausea, yet with natural taste in mouth, [1].
Tearing in the occiput, [1].
Cough, in the evening, before going to sleep, from 8 to 9 o'clock, continually, until she expectorates, then the cough stops, [1].
A scabby ulcer with burning pain on the margin of the red of the lower lip, [1].
Heaviness in all the limbs, [1], [7a].
Lies quiet before midnight, without sleep, [1].
Itching in the axillæ, [1].
Painful swelling on the lower jaw beneath the gum, [1].
In the evening, sudden drawing on the right side of the lower jaw (third day), [44].
Chest is quite raw, owing to much cough and expectoration, [1].
Heat in the face in the morning, pale face in the evening, [1].

In the morning, taste clammy (fourteenth day); clammy taste (seventeenth day); awoke with clammy taste in the mouth (twenty-sixth day); clammy taste, morning, noon, and evening (twenty-seventh day); clammy taste, in the morning (forty-eighth day), [29].
Distension of the abdomen, with diarrhœa and gripings, [1].
Much cough, with expectoration, only before midnight, as soon as he gets into bed, not during the day (after fourteen days), [1].
Hawking up of a quantity of bloody mucus (fifteenth day), [1].
Stitching in the sole of left foot, even when sitting, [1].
Sleeps better towards morning, with aversion to rising at usual time, for five days (third day after last dose), [16].
Cramp in the second toe, [1].
Disposition to sleep (first and following days), [22].
Contractive feeling in the anus, passing off after fermentation in the bowels, [2].
Fulness of the stomach, at noon, [1].
Vertigo, obliging to steady one's self after a meal, [1].
Orgasm and congestion of blood to the chest, as if hæmoptysis would follow, [1].
After a stool, which was not hard, pressing headache in the forehead, [1].
Chilliness for many nights, [1].
Vision is impeded by fiery zigzags before the eyes, [1].
Backache only when sitting, even from the least sitting, [1].
Anxious dreams, which drive him out of bed (after nineteen days), [1].
Pressure in the eyes as if sleepy, every evening, without sleepiness, [1].
Dryness of the inner nose, [1].
Dull pain in the left lumbar region (fifth day), [36].
Stitches in front teeth, [1].
Waked several times during the night; restless during the night (second night), [36].
A sore bruised feeling in the left elbow, in the region of the ulnar nerve (sixth day), [30].
Drawing tearing from below upwards in the upper and lower limbs, the whole day, but only when at rest, with great weakness, [1].
Continued ulceration and itching of the prepuce, [1].
Throbbing through chest and abdomen, as if the heart occupied the whole body (tenth day), [20].
Pressure in the eyelids, in the evening, [1].
Pressure in the stomach at night, for three successive nights, [1].
Drawing in the corns, the whole night, [1].
Cramplike penetrating pain in the right mastoid process, in the morning (fourth day), [25f].
Intermittent drawing pressure directly over the right buttock, [2].

Feeling as if the bladder were full and its contents would fall out over the pubis, with constant desire to press them back; this feeling of distension of the bladder is quite different from the pressure downwards, as if everything would be pressed through the vulva (eighteenth day), [20].
Toothache, which is renewed by cold rinsing of the mouth, [1].
Burning of the eyes, with great sensitiveness to daylight, [3].
Eruption in the corner of the mouth, with pain from touch, [1].
Restless all night, tossing and turning (seventeenth night), [20].
Complete loss of appetite, as if it were contracted in the pit of the stomach, [1].
*Vertigo while walking in the open air (after supper); she did not dare to stoop, nor to look down; was obliged to steady herself to avoid falling, [1].
Dryness of the mouth, throat, and tongue, which in the morning were quite rough, [1].
Pain in the back and in the sacrum, mostly between the lumbar region and the crista illi; more on the right side; a pulling or dragging; feeling strained when walking. -T. F. ALLEN.]
Profuse yellow discharge from the nose (fourth day), [37].
Pressure in the stomach, as if it were sore internally, [1].
Yellowness around the mouth, [1].
In the morning, on awaking, dry wrinkled lips (fourteenth day), [29].
Leucorrhœa, with stitches in the uterus (after twenty-five days), [1].

Stitches posteriorly over the right hip, for four days almost continuous; she could not lie on the right side on account of the pain, and when touching the part it pained as from subcutaneous ulceration, [1].
Cough, from tickling in the larynx, without expectoration (after five days), [1].
Feeling as of a painful sore at the tip of the nose; this sore came out afterwards like an eruption, but within two days it quite disappeared, [9].

In the morning, on waking, headache, having its seat above the forehead in the hairy scalp, where it occupied a space the size of the palm of the hand; it was of an aching pressive character, when off when he rose up, but did not go off till far on in the forenoon (sixty-first day), [45a].
Before the menses acrid leucorrhœa, with soreness of the pudendum, [1].
Hot, oppressed, and anxious from tobacco-smoking, to which he was accustomed, [1].
Frontal headache during the day; queer feeling in the head (third day), [36].
Cough, awaking at night, [1].
The lips become so dry in speaking that they are quite rough, and cause a disagreeable feeling of rubbing (sixteenth day), [45].
Nightly emissions, with sexual dreams (after twelve hours), [1].
*Pinching together in the brain from one temple to the other, frequently, for a minute, [1].
Oppression of breathing in the evening, from pain under the right short ribs, which prevents the slightest motion, [1].
Great thirst, and always more thirst than hunger, [3].
Symptoms of a catarrhal fever, with weakness in the lower extremities and drawing in the arms, [1].
Sick and feverish all day, with thirst, [9].
Dull stitches in the region of the liver (after three hours), [2].
Nosebleed, for seven days (after eleven days), [1].
On the right side of the scalp, over the parietal bone, a very painful pimple forms (eighteenth day), [45].
Stitches and burning at the anus, [1].

After midnight, excessively violent pains in the left lower jaw; the pains were drawing pressing, proceeding from a healthy tooth, spreading over the whole lower jaw, extending to the temple and ear, and lasting till he got up the following morning (two hundred and seventy-seventh day); some tenderness of the left lower jaw (two hundred and seventy-ninth day); towards morning, severe pain in the left lower jaw, sometimes with drawing into the left ear; in the forenoon, in the open air, the pain increased; it was a very painful drawing, which extended not only over the jaw, but over the whole of the left side of the face; one spot on the lower border of the under jaw was especially painful, also when touched; in the evening, in the open air, the pain extended in an aggravated degree all over the lower jaw; occasional pain in the left lower jaw, in the morning (two hundred and eightieth day); drawing in the lower jaw, in the morning (two hundred and eighty-first day); towards morning the pain of the left lower jaw, especially about a loose tooth, extremely violent (two hundred and eighty-second day); pain in the lower jaw during the day, occasional sharp tearing in the left lower jaw (two hundred and eighty-third day), [45b].
Alternating heat in the head and chilliness in the lower limbs (after thirteen days), [1].
The glans is hot and itching, with soreness of the prepuce, [1].
Great falling out of the hair (after one and eight days), [1].
Smoking does not agree with him, contracts the fauces, [1].
Easy bleeding of the gums (fourteenth day), [34a].
Copious secretion of mucus from the Meibomian glands (fifth day), [36c].
Fluent coryza, like water, [1].
Leucorrhœa, like milk, only during the day, with burning pain and excoriation between the thighs, [1].
Urine became thick and turbid, [8].
Frequent pressure in the larynx, without pain, in the morning, [1].
Pain in the right side of the abdomen, [1].
Constrictive sensation in the mouth, [1].
Eyes feel very sore, as if bruised (fourth day), [37].
Headache and weariness, while walking in the afternoon, changing in the evening to toothache and sleepiness (after eighth day), [1].
Restless sleep, confused dreams, [9].
Severe itching on the tibiæ, [1].
Severe cutting in right eye (first day), [17b].
Pressure in the right eye, as from a grain of sand, aggravated by rubbing; felt most sensitively when pressing the eyelids together, [2].
Alternating stitches and griping pain in the intestines, in attacks lasting about ten minutes, [1].
At noon, while at dinner, sudden recurrence of coryza (fifth day); occasional attacks (sixth to tenth days), [39b].
Difficult awaking, late, with weariness of the limbs, [2].
Very cold feet, with headache, especially towards evening and in the morning, [7a].
Headache as from jolting, after the noonday sleep, [1].

About 5 P.M., dull digging pain in the left side of the forehead, with confusion of the whole head (second day); towards noon, dull drawing frontal headache, which, after a few minutes, alternated with a similar pain in the right wrist (fourth day); in the afternoon, frequent alternation of frontal headache with the pain in the joints, described the day previous (seventh day), [25a].
Great swelling of the lower lip, in the morning, [1].
Tearing in the right upper jaw, in the evening, [1].
Heaviness in the feet when taking a walk (after a few hours), [1].
Tearing pressure in the upper part of the left chest, near the shoulder-joint, relieved by eructation, but soon returned violently, [2].
She groans and grunts at night, during sleep, without remembering any bad dreams, [1].
Pain constantly between the shoulders and down the back (after second day), [23].
Severe shooting pain in the left temple from 12 to 7 P.M.; pains also higher up about the anterior inferior angle of parietal bone (ninth day), [38].
The natural tension of the facial muscles gone, so that her features appear distorted, as if worn out by long suffering (fourth day), [31].
Stitching pain in the right chest, during inspiration (after ten days), [1].
He sees only one-half of an object clearly, the other half is obscured, [1].
Left commissure of mouth again painful (first day), [17b].
Drawing in all the limbs (almost immediately), [1].
Perspired very freely, wetting my clothes around the waist (I perspire very freely at all times), (tenth day), [22].
Obscuration of vision, while reading, [1].
Blowing of blood from the nose, with epistaxis (after sixth, seventh, and ninth days), [1].
Trembling of the thigh and knee, without chilliness, with jerking in the muscles of the thigh, [1].
